column2: LooseBritches, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication since June 10th.  Beginning weight was 253 and now at 227 in about two and a half months.  Weight loss was 14 lbs for first month and 9 lbs for second month.  I am currently in the third month and have dropped around 4 lbs so far.  Doc said to expect 6 to 8 pounds from here on out and that I would continue the medication as long as it is working.  I weigh in once a month.  The only downside for me has been side effects.  During the first week only:  insomnia for five days and excess energy.  After one month I developed excessive dry mouth and numbness in the middle of my lips and on the tip of my tongue...a tingling sensation that feels like I've just put something minty on these areas.  I have occasional constipation, constant dry mouth, but no problems with sleeping, palpitations, or excessive energy.  I am eatting about 1300 calories a day, exercising about 3 or 4 times a week (the hardest part for me), and have no food cravings.  I often have to remind myself to eat, even after 11 weeks of meds.  I have added daily vitamins, including calcium, D3, and a complete vitamin, to my diet.  I get one daily serving of dairy, one carb, veggies, fruit, and protein  (meat, nuts, legumes, peanut butter: one serving of one type of protein at every meal). I have occasional treats such as frozen yogurt or chocolate.  I have about 85 lbs to go and am expecting it to take around 12 months. I have been overweight since my late 20's (40ish now), but never taken diet meds before. I have dieted a few times before, but always quit because food cravings drove me absolutely crazy and I would blow the diet, gain weight, and get discouraged, eventually gaining back the 30 to 50 pounds that I lost over time.  Every month that I don't gain weight is a victory to me.  Good luck to you all.  I hope this is helpful.

column2: goodforyou, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column9: 11lb in 5 days

column2: gerbrabrit, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: Herc Mom, I am also taking phentermine, whenever you stall with the weight, stop taking it for 2days, and eat really good, a diet with higher calorie than what you were doing, you may gain a pound or two, then start taking the pill again and go back to your diet, you will start losing the weight again.

column2: Herc's Mom, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been taking Phentermine for a little over a month. The first week was amazing - I lost a pound a day consistently.  It has sort of plateaued and I haven't seen the drastic daily weight drop but I've lost 18lbs so far.  I am doing this in conjunction with My Fitness Pal to police my calories and reading online about the diabetic diets as my doctor told me to follow a diabetic diet. I had started exercising 3-4 days a week and cutting back on portions (not necessarily making healthy choices though) 5 months ago and had completely stopped losing weight so my doctor suggested I try this. The dry mouth is more of a annoyance than anything else. I forces you to drink a healthy amount of water which I needed since I am typically not a water drinker.  Appetite suppressant 100% for me, I am never hungry - its a matter of breaking the habit of boredom eating.  The constipation is no bueno and I find that to be the most frustrating but I also wonder if its because I put too few calories in my body now and it goes into starvation mode.  I have about 25lbs to go.  I am hoping by remaining on these for another 2 months that will happen.  Overall I am really happy with the results and minimal side affects.  I have tons of energy though I am OCD about the scale now.

column2: TEE, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a gastric bypass 4 years ago.  My starting weight was 277 and I got down to 204. I didn't lose as much as I would have liked but I still lost alot. After years of suffering with anemia and my menses being so overly heavy, I had a hysterectomy in January.  Although I felt much better, I gained 20lbs which I can not seem to get rid of.  I went my Dr and he said he could do a revision to my pouch which would require surgery.  I had so many problems after the gastic bypass that I do not want to undergo another surgery so I talked him into prescribing me Phentermine.  I started taking 37.5mg once per day on Sunday, 7/29 and I weighed 220. I weighed myself this morning and I weigh 210.  YAHOO!  I would like to get down to 180 so I am well on my way.  I do not have the cotton mouth but I do have the headaches which I am hoping will go away in time.  I love this pill although my doc is not a fan.  Screw u doc, just keep them coming until I can lose 30 more lbs because you will not be cutting on me again!

column2: Thinkthin464, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I am a 47 year old female and started taking this drug one week ago.  The benefits, it really helps with weight loss... I lost 6 lbs so far.  Downside for me... Side effects.  Dry mouth which was fine just drank more.  Insomnia, kept me awake if I took it after ten am.  I took a 37.5 mg the first day, didn't sleep a wink so I took only a half the rest of the week, did much better.  I dealt with a headache every day but not too severe but I didn't like it nonetheless.  The worst part happened last night... My lips, eyes and throat swelled and I started with asthma having difficulty breathing.  I did not like the way I was feeling at all!  Thank goodness for Benedryl and rescue inhaler!  I wish I could keep taking it but the pros don't outweigh the cons for me.  Good luck to everyone else.

column2: all4me, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Posted back in April this year. I just finished my 3rd month and went from 213.4 pounds down to 189.6. I'm taking it one more month and that's it. The only side effects I have are dry mouth here and there and constipation. I'm working out 3-4 days a week and using portion control. I think I've shrunk my stomach in size. I've also lost inches, 6 total.

column2: Bwine, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I am almost 35 years old.  I have been taking this medication for a little over a month, and have lost approx. 17 pounds so far.  I am taking it in conjunction with a low carb diet plan.  It definitely helps with appetite suppression and with cravings.  I haven't had sugar since then, and don't really crave it.  I have some increased energy, but not the shaky or nervous feeling.  It may cause you to be super hyped up in the very beginning, as it did for me for about 3 days.  I do experience the dry mouth, but have become accustomed to it, and just carry water with me everywhere.  I have also experienced constipation with this medication.  Very pleased overall with the medication.

column2: ladyark, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I just started month 2 on this pill. The first month i lost 18lbs along with healthy diet and plenty of exercise. It has helped w/my appetite and cravings a great deal. Side effects were minimal, very dry mouth , constipation and a tingling in the face area but i found them tolerable. I do have more energy when i exercise but i dont feel " on the go go go " like i did in the beginning. I do feel obsessed with the scale since getting the next prescription rides on me losing a certain amount by each weigh in.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started this medication in mid December. I am 5'8, I am a 32 yr old female. I weighed 236lbs. I was a person who over ate a great deal. My doctor put me on the 30mg, once a day for 3 months then changed to the 37.5 once a day. I am finishing my last month of pills now. I have lost a total of 38lbs. In the beginning I was exercising, eating super healthy, sometimes eating less than I should. Now I am very conscious of my portions, eating healthy at a "normal" level. I also have been doing some therapy type work on my reasons for over eating and working on those things. These last couple months I stopped taking it on weekends, because Im less busy and can plan my meals easier and to demonstrate my healthy eating behaviors without the pill. For me it worked as an appetite suppressant, I've never felt like it gave me more energy. I havent noticed any side effects but rapid heartbeat a handful of times. I am a person who has always been medically healthy has never had any health problems.

column2: Falling Weight, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I'm doing this for three months or to lose 30lbs whichever comes first. I wish you all the best.

column9: I took this medication for 6 months and lost 45 pounds. During this time I stayed on a 1000 calorie a day diet, 3 meals a day, no eating between meals. I also walked 30 mins on the treadmill every day.  Side effects were irritability and constipation with occasional insomnia.

column2: toobugs, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Update to a few posts down..I have been on this for a week and a half and have stopped weighing after losing a lb a day the first week. I can get obsessed about the scale and have had  my husband hide it "well"..lol. When it says Ive lost, I get HIGHLY motivated. When it says Ive gained/stayed the same, I get HIGHLY depressed. its insane I know. Side affects are the same, a bit of dry mouth, but as others said..helps to drink water, chew gum. The last 3 dys my lips have been severely chapped, almost like if I open too wide or something they will crack..yikes. But Im trying to control that. Ive been taking melatonin from the beginning because the reviews of not sleeping terrified me. I have 2 toddlers, I need my sleep. It really works, I sleep great! I cant take naps anymore though, too much energy ;)But my clothes are getting loose and a few people have noticed weight loss in only  week and a half, so thats promising. Last weight was 188.5 from 194.5. But it has been since Monday morning and today is Sunday, so Im sure i have lost more.Good luck everyone, It's worth a try!

column2: desperate weight loser, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Last year I was on this pill along with b12 shots every week, I lost 6 lbs the first week..At the end of the month I lost a total of about 15 lbs, and that was with no excercise. I started back on these pills about June 1, 2012, I weighed in at 244 , I weighed myself today and I was at 235. Now I did get a lipotropic shot( fatburner). which Im suppose to take once a week, But instead I take B12 vitamins along with my pill. I work at night so I take it late afternoon. When I say that Im awake all night with no sign of tiredness, full of energy. The only side effect that I may have is dry mouth which will make you drink more water and some occasional constipation which Ive had as a kid. Now Im 5'6 and Im suppose to be 135-140 , but I want to be 145-150 , My weight gain came from my last kid and post partum depression from the baby. I dont have much time to excercise and my meals are usually in the late evening when I get up and I usually eat like one medium meal a day and some snacks after that. So im sure if I eat right and excerise I will lose more weight. But for now Im happy with the little weight lost.Im going to continue and try to involve excercise (start with some walking) . My goal was to lose at least 80-100 lbs , so far I have lost 9 lbs in 2 1/2 weeks. So well see, wish me luck...Its not easy and it is very discouraging when you dont see a difference.. But you have to set your mind up for this physically and mentally.. trust me its not easy

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
toobugs, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 5'3 and weighed 194.5 and am 33 yrs old. I have been taking the 30mg capsule for 6 days now and lost 6.5 lbs! I have about 50lbs more to go. Here are my side affects so far. Dry Mouth, but def not as severe as on some meds. It is not cotton mouth, just a bit less saliva which yes, drinking water does help. Other than that, a few heart palpitations, and a bit of constipation. But if you eat right and use plenty of fiber it helps. I have been trying to eat 3 meals a day, but I probably have been able to cut my food intake by half or more. Also, I was drinking a lot of alcohol before, a few drinks a day. And now I no longer even have that craving. It gives me so much control to be able to say "no" I dont need that. I have never expierienced that in my entire life :) It is totally amazing to have a pill change your brain and how it thinks, but thats what it does. Food, drink is no longer important, so when I force myself to eat, I can focus on fruits/vegetables/healthy grains/proteins. I am defenetly hoping I can take this until I reach my goal! I will update soon. Good luck everyone! You can do it!

column2: Blkjewelz8960, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have lung disease and have been on prednisone for the past 6 years on and off.  This time I have been on prednisone for 2.5 years and picked up over 100 lbs.  Now that my disease is in remission, the doctor and I talked about weight loss.  Gastric Bypass is out as is the Sleeve as it requires being sedated.  With my lung condition that is not an option as being put to sleep is too risky.  So I opted for the pill.  I have lost 20 lbs in 2 weeks.  Yes, it does take your appetite away but that is the sole purpose.  Doctor said 1/2 the pill if I find I am not eating at all.  As for constipation mentioned by other increase your fruit and vegetable intake.  Craps and headaches mean your potassium is low.  My blood work is tested monthly for my lung disease.  I am just so glad to be getting the weight off.

column2: dukeydonkey, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking this med per my doctor's orders. I was unable to get my weight under 200 pounds no matter what i did. After only 7 days, i have lost 6 pounds! It takes no effort on my part and i no longer have the urges to eat out everyday. I take the 37.5 mg pill in the morning once a day, and that's it. The only side effects i have had was insomnia the first 2 days, but that went away, a dry mouth sometimes, and i get a bit moody sometimes. By late afternoon, i get a little tired, but it comes and goes. I actually have more energy now, and am getting more things done. I wish my dr would have prescribed this medicine for me a long time ago. I am so happy now because this is something that finally works. i have tried expensive mail order diet supplements and girdles, etc. I am totally recommending this  medication to friends and family that could possibly benefit from it.

column2: Lost in thought, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking phenternine for 3 months and have lost some waight, I have all ways had waight problems due to PCOS as long as i worked out i managed and due to an injury I gained 54# over a year. I have now lost 25# of it Yea!   I am wondering is this med used to treat other problems? Here's what is going on sence I started this med. I have always felt like the world was speeding by me, and I didn't understand many things in life because of this, when I started this med. about two weeks in, I noticed the world slow down and I have been able to understand more. I have learned more in the lase 3 months. column2: prettygirl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Phentermine 2/13/12. I lost 18lbs the first month.  I've changed my eating habbits; no soda, bread once or twice a week, and pasta once a week. Baked chicken breat, yogarts, berries, fresh veggies.. So far I have had little to no exersize. The first month I didnt really have any side effects.. I can tell that the pills aren't as affective as they were the first month.. After my 3rd month I will probably stop taking them and do the rest on my own.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 28yrs old, 5'6", and 235lbs. For 6 mos I've worked hard to change my eating habits and have been taking cardio kickboxing classes 3-5x a week plus power walking, getting really strong and tone but without weight loss bc my appetite was insane with the workouts. My doc thought I was an excellent candidate for success bc I'm so active, I just need to control my hunger. So now I'm on day 3 of Adipex and I've lost 4lbs already! I've only eaten 900-1100 calories each day, I have to remind myself to eat more to not get too low cals. It is so liberating to not have hunger consuming my thoughts. Dry mouth is an immediate minor side effect, and I also feel more "alert" but not jittery. At this rate I should be to my goal 175-180lbs in 2-3 months. Hopefully my stomach will shrink bc I'm eating small portions, so the hunger won't come back with a vengeance when I'm off this pill.

column2: Sunshine, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started on this drug 2/8/12 and weighed in at 264.5 lbs. The next day I noticed a dramatic drop in cravings and appetite, but an increase in energy with no jitters and a feeling of euphoria. I have experienced some side effects such as dry mouth, which causes you to drink water, that's a good thing. But not so good is constipation. There are other side effects listed with this medication but I have only experienced a couple. As of today 4/1/12, not quite two months later I am down 37.5 lbs. and continue to drop everday. One important fact to consider is that this is not a miracle drug, it does require a lifestyle change of eating right and excercise. This pill works to get the weight off if instructions by your doctor are followed. I never thought it would work, I am the biggest skeptic there is b/c I have tried everything to lose weight with no success. But make the most of this medication while your on it b/c your doctor will not keep you on it long term.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
Ruby, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: IM GOING TO KEEP IT REAL!! I STARTED TAKING THIS DRUG ABOUT 6 YEARS AGO. I WAS ABOUT 22 THEN. IT WORKED PERFECTLY! POUNDS FELL OFF, I HAD ONLY A LITTLY DRY MOUTH. I HAD BEEN ON & OFF OF IT OVER THE LAST COUPLE YEARS. EVERTIME I LOOSE ABOUT 30 POUNDS I STOP TAKING THEM. 9/2010 I STOPPED TAKING THEM. FROM ABOUT 2/2011-NOW I GAINED ALOT! I WAS 232 WHEN I GOT OFF, I AM NOW 300! I JUST WENT BACK TO THE DOCTOR TO GET BACK ON (2/2012) AND MY SIDE EFFECTS ARE HORRIBLE!! SO BAD THAT I STARTED TO THINK I HAVE BRAIN CANCER OR SOME SERIOUS ILLNESS. AFTER READING ABOUT 100 REVIEWS ON HERE & GOOGLING THE SIDE EFFECTS I REALIZE THAT IT'S JUST THIS MEDICATION. I HAVE SEVERE HEADACHES (I NEVER GET HEADACHES), DRY MOUTH (HAD A BLISTER IN CORNER OF MOUTH, SORE THORAT, & BAD BREATH... ALL COMES FROM DRY MOUTH). I ALSO HAVE THIS WEIRD TINGILING FEELING IN MY HEAD.. WHEN I WALK FAST MY HEART RATE GOES UP. I USUALLY START OFF WITH HALF A PILL BUT THIS TIME I WAS SO ANXIOUS TO GET THIS WEIGHT OFF THAT I STARTED TAKING WHOLE PILLS RIGHT AWAY, THIS MIGHT HAVE SOMETHING TO DO WITH THE NEW SIDE EFFECTS.. I CAN'T TAKE IT THO, IM GOING TO JUST STOP TAKING THEM. I HAVE ALREADY CUT REDMEAT, PORK, DAIRY & SODA OUT MY DIET. I ALSO JOINED A 24 HOUR GYM. HOPEFULLY THIS WILL HELP ME ONCE I DO STOP TAKING THE PILLS. BY THE WAY, FROM 2/3/12 to NOW (2/27/12) I HAVE WENT FROM 300 POUNDS TO 285 SO IT DOES WORK, I JUST DON'T KNOW WHY MY SIDE EFFECTS ARE SO HARSH. I HOPE THIS HELPED SOMEBODY BECAUSE I HAD TO READ ABOUT 50 REVIEWS BEFORE I ACTUCALLY READ A COUPLE I COYLD RELATE TO, PEOPLE WHO HAD THE SAME SIDE EFFECT SYMPTOMS AS ME.

column2: LON, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I want to share my experience with people that has just started using this or are considering it. When you first start taking it, it does take a while to get used to. It is similar to being on an upper, lots of energy, no appetite, but you do have some trouble sleeping. If you are heart healthy and have great blood pressure ( like me) I had no issues with heartbeat or my blood pressure rising. The drug worked great on me losing 30 lbs in 6 months. I was on it another 6 months and barely lost any more, but maintained well. Of course this is with diet and exercise. My doctor kept upping my dosage until the max of 2 pills a day. Then I started to get bad withdraws because I had built up such a tolerance to the drug. I was falling asleep everywhere. My body just craved more. I called the doctor and he weened me off, and believe me it was tough. Bad thing is I ended up gaining some weight back over the next 6 months. ( about 15lbs) I did not stop exercising or dieting, but my appetite and energy level went back to normal. Surprisingly, I decided to get back on it. I don't want to gain more weight, so of course I'm willing to do whatever. Been on it 2 months now and lost 6 lbs. started with one pill a day and Yesterday went up to taking an additional half pill around 3 pm due to getting tired in the afternoon. My advice is to know when to get off it, it's better not to be on it long term, so you don't build a tolerance and get bad withdraws like I did. Hope this helps you! :)

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
Silvana, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I went to my doctor with the following symptoms: headaches, hairloss, rapid weight gain (20 lbs in 4 month), my period stopped 4 months ago, zero sex drive, night sweats, sleepless nights, no energy. I am 40, 5'2", and 140 lbs now. I have never had a weight problem before. my sysmptoms indicate hypothyroid or menapause, so I wanted blood tests to see what is wrong with me. I am awaiting my blood test results tomorrow, but he gave me this Phentermine priscription. I have taken it for 3 days now. I feel worse, since yesterday I have flu like symptoms, but only in my neck and shoulders, rapid heart beat, I feel dizzy.  I do have to force myself to eat, but overeating was not an issue for me to begin with. I don't think I will not continue taking it, I feel so much worse, I can barely stand. I think I should wait for my results to see what has caused my innitial symptoms, I don't know why he gave me this to begin with, but I will sure call him tomorrow. I am noticing a lot of people here with weight gain that is in my range, and I must say, we are NOT obese. This medication is supposed to manage obesity not a few pounds. I am convinced the hormonal imbalance I am obviously experiencing is the reason for my innitial symptoms and will figure out how to manage that without this drug.  I do see it's working for many of you, that is great, but it's not for me.

column9: I have been on phentermine 2 months and have loss 30 pounds to date.  My doctor has given me my last 30 day prescription with strict instruction to take one every other day to start being able to manage on my own.  He will not give any further refills after this one. column2: SuzB, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I LOVE THESE DIET PILLS!! In August-2008 i weighed almost 240 pounds & i lost 80 pounds in a little under a year, with no carbs, sugar, & i was constantly moving around with my new business and all. After i met my current boyfriend i totally gained most of it back. I was back up to 212 pounds in May 2011. I tried that akai berry diet, dieters tea, did cleanses, tried xenadrine. I tried everything. I hated taking 6 dam diet pills in one day and have to remember 30 mins after or before?? HATED IT!!! & no results expect my heart beating a mile a min and my house & clothes always super oragnized.Then my friend told me wbout phentermine. I did alllll the research i could before investing in more BS diet pills. I saw more successful reviews than i had expected. So i decided to take them. I started July 1st @ 210-212 pounds, i am now 199. Im more focused @ work, i dont mind getting up a million times a day, i NEVER get cravings, or hunger pains! I eat something small, usually a banana or a handful of RAW nuts in the morning with alot of water to shock my metabolism into getting started for the day then down the pill & i accompany it with Biotin 5000(hair & nails) I read somewhere that your hair may thin & i love my hair so i took precautions. The phentermine usually kicks in after about 15-20 mins.. I take the pill around 7 am.. but i think i need to start taking it later cause around 7 pm it starts to ware off & i can feel myself being able to start munching.. Sleeping sometimes can be difficult & i smoke (marijuana) for my psoriasis, so that helps me in the area of getting to sleep. I dont get to exercise cause im constantly working, so id suggest to you out there, exercise may help in getting "more tired"..I hope this was helpful =)I dont recommend this pill for people who have hyper tension, high blood pressure or already have depression issuses. Alot of "balance" is required. I started doing yoga & its amazing. I love the results im getting from these pills.

column2: Not as fat, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It has been 3 months since I started to take this and I have gone from 261lbs to 225lbs.  I am 5'9" tall.  It's been a loss of 36lbs.  I have gone from a size 20 to a size 16 & it feels great! After the first 2 months I took a week off of the pills.  I had gone on vacation & I wasn't losing as fast as I was before.  After the week long break I started to lose the weight again.  I also will give my body a break on the weekends so I can get a good nights rest & also let my "system" get going again as I am still experiencing some constipation.  Stool softeners help but usually being off of the pills for a day or two helps more.  I am not going to the gym as much as I would like to but it seems that I am still losing without going regularly just yet.  I am sure I will start going when I hit a plateau.  I still have no appetite and still drink tons of water because of dry mouth.  I hope to keep on the path and be closer to my goal by the end of the year.  I recommend occasionally giving yourself a break from them every once in awhile.  I find I have no problems not taking them.  I don't have any withdrawal symptoms and I don't gain any considerable weight.  I am usually back to the weight I was right before I stopped taking them within a day.  Off the pills, I ate only a bit more than when I am on the pills.  I didn't need to eat sweets and turned them down when offered.  The only real problem I have with them is the constipation but stool softeners, laxatives, fiber pills and not taking them for a couple of days seems to help.  I am feeling better about myself than I have in a few years & I can't wait to reach my goal!

column2: ashdwhill, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: queeney, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

I have been on this now for almost a month again with the last two off.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
Linda, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: First, I'm under medical supervision while on this pill.  I see a weight loss Dr. every week to be sure I'm doing well.  In just 6 weeks I lost 15 lbs.  Under medical supervision, I was on a strict low fat NO CARB diet for the first 2 weeks and just light walks.  Week 3, I was able to add some of the low carb veggies to my salads.  I drink 90-100 oz of water PER DAY, which is VERY IMPORTANT and my excersice still consist of light jogs/walks.  You CANNOT lose weight on the pill alone.  You have to eat healthy low fat meats & low carb veggies and LOTS of water and at the very least take a 30 minute stroll.  The first week on the pill I took 1/2 a pill at wake up.  The second week I took half at wake up half at 10 am and NO LATER.  On the third week I took the whole pill at wake up and still do that now.  I have therefore had no side effects and feel better than I have in years!! I still have 30lbs to lose but I'm optimistic as this pill controls my desire to eat anything in front of me.  Without the pill, I know I'd be starving in the evening as its my usual time of increased appetite.  I'm also addicted to soda pop and anything sweet but while on this pill (and with some will power), I am able to completely skip any and all sweet stuff.  I've been on so many diets but by the end of my day I'm almost always STARVING so nothing worked until I started on this.  I'm 39 and can't wait to look fabulous and feel fabulous for my big 4-0, which has not happened since I was in my 20's!! Does this pill work?  YES, but you have to be willing to do your part in eating healthy (light HEALTHY low fat low, carb meals every 3-4 hrs, drink lots of water, and excercise).

column2: chickinabimmer, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been off and on phen for several months.  It works very, very well.  BUT, you must learn to eat sensibly and exercise along with taking the pill-or you'll just gain everything right back.I've been working with a local physician while on phen.  My PCP was too skittish to give me more than two months worth. This guy is more liberal.  Let me say that I was in great health before starting the program, except for being 40 pds overweight.  I am still in great health.  My BP has dropped and I have lost 36 pounds.  I am only 8-10 pounds from goal.No, this drug is not the panacea.  One must be careful and pay attention to warnings.  Lifestyle changes must go along with it...

column2: CaliGirl88, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm not overweight by any means but I've gained a few pounds that I've had trouble losing.. I exercise quite a bit but I was eating way too much and wanted some help with my appetite...I've gotten into the habit of midnight snacking.. I was given a 1mo Rx for phentermine 37.5mg tabs about a week ago. Definitely handled the appetite issue. HOWEVER... big however. I went jogging for the first time yesterday since starting the med. My goal was my usual 4miles, but after my first 1/2 mile I couldn't catch my breath. It was scary. My throat, neck, and shoulders were so tight. I decided to walk the rest of the route, but another 1/2 mile in with power walking, I STILL felt like I was breathing like I did during my most recent 1/2 marathon. SCARY. I'm curious how long it will take me to get back to normal, and I've only taken this med for less than a week!?!?!

column2: WestCoastDaisy88, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm not overweight, but I have gained a few pounds recently and wanted some help shedding them. I've never used this med before, but some of my girlfriends have and look way slim now. I started taking 1/2 pill in AM, 1/2 in afternoon a few days ago. My appetite has drastically decreased. Today I decided to go jogging (1st time to job since starting the pill). I've been running on/off for 3yrs, it's not hard for me. But today, I could NOT catch my breath. After 1/2 mile, my throat and shoulders felt so tight, it was like I had just done a 1/2 marathon- even as I simply walked briskly I felt SO short of breath. I usually do around 3-4miles easily, sometimes much more. And when I got back home, my heart rate was STILL up- NOT normal for me in the least. This med DOES suppress one's appetite and boost energy, for sure. But the cardiovascular side effects INCREDIBLY outweight the long-term use of this drug. I've experienced something very scary and I've only taken this stuff for less than a week?!?!!

column2: Maximus, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been taking phentermine for 9 months and have lost 90 pounds.  I started on 30 mg and after 6 months switched to 37.5 mg because the effectiveness was wearing off.  It is not a magic pill, you have to put in the exercise and watch your eating.  What it does for me is help me with the self control to make healthy choices and eat smaller portions.  It does take some getting used to.  In the beginning I experienced the dry mouth and nervousness.  Within a few weeks that went away.  The medication is cheap and doesn't involve all the complications of surgery.  Keep in mind, you can't take this and just sit on your butt.  You have to exercise and you will see the results.  I am down to 240 pounds and look forward to losing 40 more.  I recommend you start exercising and being active, and then inquire about this drug if you need help with self control and to jump start your weight loss.

column2: mwj, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: it helps me get goin in the mornings it also helps with my depression and with my nervrs and temper controll

column2: SandyMHicks, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking 11 days ago and so far i have lost 7 pounds!!!! I have had some side effects dry mouth, insomnia badly, dizzy ness is getting worse and im very irrtiable, so use caution you can experence some or all. I just keep telling my self to power through it and i can get this weight off. I try taking a sleep pill and that dosent really help either and i do take my pill every morning at 7am. I am proned to insomina anyways so i figured it would make it worse. And that could be why im so cranky ;) The dry mouth some days is very bad today is one of them so im drinking tons of water which is good. The pill oddly for me is hard to swallow so i have to get my mouth a lil wet then try to swallow it but again the pros me losing 7 pounds in 1 days out weight right now the cons. Yes the dizzy spells suck so bad i feel like i have a bad hangover so just be careful when standing up . Good luck and hopefully i can report back in 3 mths how it went!

column2: Remmiesgal, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The only real negative part of being on this drug is the dry mouth.  And sometimes insomnia.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
hopethisworks4me, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I rated all 5s because I just started taking today and I am thinking positively...so tired of being overweight.  My doctor suggested that I try this, but to start off with half a pill and see how the first few days go.  I am hoping that this gives me the help I need...I do worry about side effects...I'll be sure to drink plenty of water (both the dr. and the pharmacist told me to do that).  I'll update how things are going.

column2: Lori, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started this medication March 2011 and as of June 15, 2011, I have lost 30 pds.The medication curbed my appetite. I also achieved this goal with diet and exercise. I also took this medication along with Wellbutrin (which help control my cravings for carbs and sweets). I am satisfied with my progress. This diet has trained me to eat more fruits and vetgetables and also let me know that I can live without or very little carbs and sweets. The one side effect that is NOT mentioned is hair breakage/loss. Oh well, I rather wear a wig, than to be overweight!!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed this medication by a doctor and just took it for the first time today. I'm having horrible side effects!! Although I'm not hungry at all, I feel like I'm high! My whole body is warm and tingly, I'm dizzy, spacey, have dry mouth, and can't focus.  I definitely do NOT have any pep or extra energy. I am NEVER taking this again! I can't wait for this loopy feeling to wear off.

column2: tlterrell, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It gave me the energy that I needed to get up and exercise and suppressed my craving for carbs.

column2: coloradfotiff, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking 37mg 8 days ago. I went to a weight loss clinic and got it.  It worked great for the first 3 days.  Not too many side affects, other than the dry mouth.  I felt like this med gives me the oposite effect than most people.  It actually makes me feel tired and no energy.  I didnt have trouble sleeping because I take it early(before 8am)  after the 3 days I feel like it is not working anymore.  I ended up cheating on my diet and eating Olive Garden and boy did I pay for it.  I had diahrea all night.  I tried skipping a day to see if maybe I just got adjusted to it already but still not working very well.  I still feel I could eat and eat.  I am still taking it because I do feel it mentally helps me from over eating.  Instead of having seconds for dinner, I just eat half and thats all I eat.  No more snacking after dinner or at night. I have loss about 8 pounds so far so cant complain.

column2: kellysue, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: LIke another on here i am on it because it has knocked out my depression, fatigue, irritability, i love it was on it in the past for weight, but i dont  not have to take depressions med (which i had serious side effects to) anymore my DR. has me on 10mg and i know it goes up to 37.5mg which is too much unless weight loss is needed. I weigh 157lbs, weight loss is not needed i still eat with it, but fixing to go thru divorce and believe it or not i am off depression, anxiety, and other medicines well tolorated no problem, energy out the rear able to spend more time with my children which i wasn't able to in the past...due to lack of energy and severe depression Phentermine does wonders but some people disagree. EVery body reacts differently. I have no woman parts ( full hysterectomy done at 22yrs old) so i feel less of a woman, but other than that i feel great. I hope all others agree, can be addictive, that's the only problem, i have knocked out 4 medicines because of this. I hope someone else can get the same relief & results i did, and knock out other medicines. I have suffered severe anxiety & depression since hysterectomy, but now i am  great.Feel good! I hope this helps someone else, most doctors will not give it, but mine did b/c she is trying to help me get thru this tough time. And she doesn't think i need 2 be around my husband any longer....15yrs together! And he was my stress!Thanks

column2: pfhinaz, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: When I first took the drug in 2009 it worked great. I lost about 40 lbs. Since then I have been taking it off an on. Recently however the drug has made me very sick. I stopped taking it without knowing I was to be weened off of it. I am super fatigued, irritated, have night sweats, cant sleep, bloated and at times my fingers and feet swell to the point they hurt. I DO NOT RECCOMEND this medication as it BECOMES ADDICTING. Why should I have to use a small dose to not have these side effects. ITs like Cocain or Speed you need a little to feel good.

column2: Evantyson, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking Phen a few days ago, and my doctor really didn't want to give it to me because she doesn't believe its healthy, however, after explining to her that being 100 pounds overweight isn't healthy either, she had to give in. She has started me on a very low dose 15mg, and I have had absolutely no appetite at all. Yesterday all I manage to eat were grapes, and a piece of turkey wrapped in lettuce!! I was super energetic this morning, and didn't get much sleep last night. Also I've been doing some jaw clenching- is this normal? Has anyone else experienced any of this??

column2: flsoutherngirl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I lost 35lbs in less than 4 months. Since I met my goal I have been off the pill and the weight has stayed off. With  healthy eating and light exercising I am very happy. I would recommend this to people who have a hard time losing weight and are serious about getting healthy. Do not order this product online make sure you get your doctors approval

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: BIGGEN, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I LOST 28.7 POUNDS IN THE MONTH OF TAKING THIS MED. THE ONLY SIDE EFFECT THAT I HAVE THAT I DON'T CARE FOR IS SWEATING & BEING REALLY HOT A LOT OF THE TIME.

column2: allenlila@aol.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: it makes me feel fatigue and exhausted for the next few days. I think it is extremely hazardous to my health.  I believe that it will have long range effects that are not currently known at this time.

column2: Hope4Me, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am taking this medication for severe fatigue from Chronic Fatigue Syndrome.It wouldn't allow me to choose this option above so I checked obesity. In any case, at first it gives you the pep you need. It helps you get things done.I am currently breaking up the 37.5mg tablets in half. I couldn't even imaginae taking a full tablet. Hours later you crash! If you have a family watch out or perhaps they should watch out. You are so irritable and don't want to take it out on your family but you do. Furthermore,I hope you enjoy T.V because you will catch up on a lot of it at night. You won't be able to sleep. I have tried similar medicstions such as provigal and Nuvigal with all of the same side effects. I'm just not sure if there is anything out there that will work for me.

column2: Zelda, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was on this drug or almost 2 yrs.  Dr. supervised. He kept telling me that it's like having a cup coffee. With my medical history of having Lupus, I should NOT have been put on this drug at all. I experienced Anger, depression and I had a heart attack, which I blame on this drug. DANGER!  DO NOT TAKE THIS DRUG longer than recommended. It is legal speed! Only prescripted.  I should have listended to the pharmacist.  Lose weight the old fashioned way, and focus on being healthy, NOT just thinner.

column2: kgmd, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Started on 5/1/11 at 248 lbs & 5'6". I also started weightwatchers online  and exercising on the same day. as of today I've lost 21 lbs! The reason I started ww is so that once I come off this med I would have learned new eating habits to help me keep the weight off. Been walking 45 min 3-4 days per week. Still have about 50 more lbs to drop. I'm taking 15 mg twice a day. Side effects....insomnia for about the first 3 days and dry mouth here and there.

column2: Cynthia, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: This is a very effective drug from my experience.  Since I don't get hungry or get cravings with this medication, I eat very small amounts of nutricious foods.  Since it makes me thirsty, I eat lots of vegetables, soups, fruit and drink lots of non-caloric fluid.  I have been taking this medication for four months and have lost exactly three pounds per month, maintaining a 1500 calorie per day diet.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: my hair began to fall out!!!!!!!!!

column2: sargeanton, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been on phentrine for 6 weeks and have lost about 25 pounds so far. I'm only doing moderate exercise. My dosage is 37.5 mg which I find too strong to take all at once. So, I break them in half and take half late a.m., other half at about 3:00 p.m. Combined with coffee they make me a little bit jumpy...but that's okay. The weight is falling off and I'm not hungry. Generally, I drink a Slim Fast, take my vitamins, eat a small can of tuna fish, and munch on pretzels. I can get by on 500 to 800 calories a day without feeling hungry and have no loss of energy. I drink diet sodas and lots of water and have absolutely no craving for sweets or bigger portions of what I eat. Briefly, I am just not hungry enough to desire pizza or any other food that adds lbs. Even the tuna, which I usually NEVER eat, tastes good with a tad of mayo on wheat bread.

column2: SW, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I experienced loss of reality, a sudden increase in labito (to the point where I was uncomfortable) and shakiness, nervousness,even paranoid thoughts. I am so glad that my Doctor saw these symptoms and discontinued the medication.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Under active thyroid was causing me to have a hard time losing weight. Doc prescribed Phen and in 4 days have lost 4 lbs. I have cut down to a salad plate portion of healthy foods and run on treadmill for 30 minutes a day. It gives me tons of energy until about 7 p.m. Have a hard time sleeping, but my house has never been cleaner.

column2: Jopee10, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I gained massive wieght after having my thyroid removed. I took the pill for several months and lost 55 pounds. Best wieght loss pill ever.

column2: 2legit, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking this medication because I needed to shed some pounds.  I weighed in at 203 and my ldl's and hdl's didn't come back so good.  So the doctor said to try this out since everything else, including working my butt off didn't seem to help.  Within 3 days I was hallucinating.  I was at home and everytime I moved my head I would see trails of colors.  I also couldn't sleep and my heart felt like it was going to jump out of my chest.  I called my doctor up and told him I would rather be 203lbs then feel like a drug addict.  So, needless to say I stopped the pills and just tripled my routine in the gym.  I am now down 45 lbs on my own.

column2: K, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for four and a half weeks now. The first day that I took it, I could tell that it was having an effect almost immediately. The first couple days, the dry mouth was terrible. Since then though, I have noticed and increase in thirst, (mostly craving water) but the dry mouth and bad breath is gone. However, I have had pretty steady insomnia. I usually take my daily dose around 9:00AM, and sometimes find it difficult to fall asleep before 1:00AM. I have adjusted, but some people may find it more challenging. I lost 4 pounds the first week, and I have lost ten pounds so far. I have only been working out for about 10 days, and it has made a difference. I highly reccomend this to anyone who overweight or obese. I had a BMI of 30.7 and I'm down to a 28.7 already. I have a total weight loss goal of 42 pounds, and I think that this will really help me get there. But, you can't just take this pill. It isn't magic. I calorie count EVERYDAY and I'm working out.

column2: Purplestars0366@aol.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
boombalatty, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking this drug 3 weeks ago & I'm down 19lbs already. Started out at 261 & I am 5'9". I no longer crave or want sweets anymore. No desire to eat them even when offered & I could never turn them down before. No longer have a diet soda addiction and even stopped drinking coffee. Didn't even intend to stop drinking them but the taste changed for me (diet soda tastes chemically & uber sweet) and now all I want to drink is lots & lots of water. My appetite is non-existent & I actually have to force myself to eat something when I feel my blood sugar drop. I haven't even started to work out yet. I wake up early feeling refreshed, which I have never felt before being a grouchy morning person, but sometimes I do have trouble falling asleep. I am having a problem with alternating constipation for 2 days then a day of diarrhea for 1 day after but that may be because I'm not eating nearly as much as I used to & my body is probably getting used to it. Would have given it 5 stars if it wasn't for the gastric problems. I notice I have a ton more energy daily. I actively seek out cleaning around the house. I am just shocked that I no longer crave junk food & the only things I will eat are healthy whole foods because everything else sounds & tastes gross. I used to LOVE fast food, carbs & sweets. Overall very pleased so far.

column2: EmanFantastic, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Works.  Short term only.  Is addictive.  Effectiveness wears off so you must use the loss of weight as a catalyst to begin exercise or you will find yourself back up again when your MD stops giving you this stuff.  Or, you'll act like a junkie trying to get your hands on more phentermine.  Effectiveness can be prolonged by taking two days off every 5.  Plan vigorous physical activity on those days or you will eat the house down! (Hiking, long distance bicycling, etc.).  In the long run I ended up getting the Gastric Sleeve Resection surgery (it's the newest, best, look it up) but the phen got me to begin the process where before it I wanted to die.

column2: loura901, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i have been taking this for 4 weeks and lost 12 pounds   SO HAPPY

column2: Kate, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I found that taking Phentermine was best taken as early in the morning to avoid possible insonia which the drug can cause at night.I used the tablets in conjunction with a good execise plan and a healthy eating regime.In the early stages of treatment I started to lose weight quite quickly, perhaps because coupled with an exercise regime perhaps it works twice as well.Do not take this drug and remain a couch potato.It will not shift those kilos unless you get out and start something simple, like walking, runnning, going to the gvym or getting your own machine to have on hand to use at home.12 weeks is the length I believe that you need on the drug and then when you cease using it,you NEED to continue that exercise and take it up one or two notches or you will just put any weight you've lost back on.It does help you kick start the weightloss, but exercise is the only way I've been able to keep the weight off since losing 20 kilograms,All in all, I would rate it highly for those who have tried all other weight loss plans. And make a care plan with your GP and see a dietician. They help you amazingly - you learn so much about nutriton, eating the right foods and when to eat them.Whatever you do don't stop eating on this drug - you will become very ill. Stopping eating altogether will not make you lose weight, in fact you'll gain it because the body stores fat for those times when your not getting enough,Drink heaps of water, take a muti vitamin as well as taking Phentermine.If you follow these instructions you should all in all have a sucessful treatment. Thankyou for letting me share my experience with you.

column2: nseone, 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Took this Medication for 4 months. Played with 5 lbs for 4 months and finally gained all of it back plus one. I have changed to a different diet pill. I was also very congested after I took the medication and coughed the entire time I was taking it. I thought I had bronchitis or a nagging cold that would not go away. Then I noticed the coughing was after I took the pill, when I did not take it I did not have congestion or cough. hmmmm Don't have to be a rocket scientist. I changed to another pill

column2: Happy!, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am updating on a review a couple of weeks ago.. I have been on this for a lil over a month and loss 32 lbs and a shirt size. Have also gained some muscle mass ion shoulders and arms. If anyone is considering trying this, I say give it a shot! if you dont like it quit. I wish i would have took advantage alot sooner. Im now eating 1200-1800 calories a day and woking out 5-6 days a weeks for about 30-60 mins.

column2: CautiousOne, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This drug is dangerous. I know two people who have pulmonary hypertension (chronic and forever as it is not curable) after taking this drug for just a few months. It does NOT teach you how to eat, it is just a crutch. For those of you not willing to make the changes necessary, you will gain the weight back. I know because I did. Now, I am doing WW and have lost 30 lbs in 15 weeks and I am never hungry and I won't die due to these pills. Doctors who prescribe this medication should re-think this. It is DANGEROUS. You may not get pulmonry hypertension (which will kill you down the road) but why take chances? I consider myself lucky cause all that happened to me is I gained the weight I lost back. It is a lot of money to spend to lose a few pounds quickly. Vanity is not as important as your health. Please heed my warning. I am watching a co-worker die after only 7 weeks on this stuff. You are playing russian roulette if you take this drug. Will you or won't you get the bullet in the head? Not worth it. Join a good program and lose weight slowly and safely. Re-learn portion control and healthy eating. I am thrilled with my results and I know I will not die from WW...just get thinner and stay that way.

column2: kmr_32611, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Well, I went for my yearly exam on the 25th of April & I asked about this pill. I told the dr. that I had no energy whatsoever & I know I'm very overweight & need the help in losing it. I started taking the pill on the 29th & today is the 6th. The first day I felt dizzy/lightheaded,but after that I felt great. I started walking for 30 minutes a day & it's curbed my appetite,but I've had trouble sleeping at night. Starting today I started a new routine where I'll walk 30 minutes in the morning & also 30 minutes in the evening so I won't wear myself out trying to do 45 minutes at one time. I haven't weighed myself since I've been to the doctor & I'm very nervous to see what it says. I hope it's working for me. I'm 5'4 & weigh 250 lbs. I thought after I had my daughter the weight would come off,but I wasn't able to bf as long as I thought & depression doesn't help,so that's why I asked about the pill. I've still been eating what I want,but just not as much of it,eating like 2 times a day at the most & drinking lots of water having a soda every once in a while as my "cheat". How do you know how good your MG's are for the dose? Mine says on the label "phentermine 37.5MG"..is that considered a high or low dose?

column9: It seems that this drug works for a while and stops I did great the four weeks I lost 12 lbs. My Dr. put me on this because I don't have a thyroid. column2: jeanmarie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking 37.5 dosage of Phentremine for 1 month. I went to the doctors today and have only lost 4 lbs. Side affects:really bad dry mouth. I done better with T-lite w/energy diet pill and plan 7 years ago. But then again I only worked 1 job then. We shall see. Good luck to all who is trying to lose weight and get healthy.

column2: sloving48, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I take cymbalta with this weight control medicine so they say I could have a serotonin uptake.

column2: Kohara, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Today has been 1 month since I starting using Phentermine 30mg. I have lost 18 pounds! I go back to the doctor on April 21st.  Looking forward to losing more weight I need to lose atleast 40 more pounds.

column2: Lorri, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking the 15mg. dose in Dec. 2010 and lost weight during the holiday season!  My doctor bumped me up to the 37.5mg dose in Feb. 2011 and as of April 2011 I have lost 30 lbs. Hopefully I can maintain with exercise and good eating habits.  I'll try to check back and let you know how I'm doing.

column2: itsalwaysrealhere011, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

There is alot that i can say about it but over all of that i dont ahve anything bad to say about it because it is the forst thing that i have found that works.

column2: E Harris, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months

column2: Rocksister, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started this on March 15.  My doctor said I needed to lose 40 pounds, and at age 54, I finally need help losing weight, whereas before I had been able to do it on my own. And Easter is one of my most difficult times, with the chocolate bunnies and peanut butter eggs and such.  Ha ha.  Well I lost 7 pounds my first 13 days.  I go back on April 25 to see how I've done the past month.  The Adipex makes me feel a little like a thrumming guitar string, kind of edgy.  But not bad. column2: allisha3558, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I took this medication three times.  The first time was for two months, it seemed to work great.  A few years later took it again and was very tired all the time, I just wanted to sit on the coach.  Stopped taking it after a month.  This last fall I took it again cause my friend started and was doing great.  I was very tired again and just wanted to sit on the coach, almost depressed.  One day I started having shortness of breath and racing heart.  After a few episodes I had a really big one and went to the doctors.  They took me off and I have been going to specialist.  They are trying to say maybe it is asthma but I can tell something is different and wrong now.  Also my distolic blook pressure is high and I have never had anytime of high blood pressure.  I have been researching it and pulmonary hypertension fits the bill but you have to have a catheder or die to be diagnosed.  I would not recomend this drug at all.  My friend is doing great now but she has had some side effects too and has ignored them because of the results.  Who knows what she or I will find out what it did to us.  allisha3558@yahoo.com

column2: rhon-d, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: :), 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It works for sure. You won't be hungry, but you still have to eat to keep your metabolism going. I lost 15 pounds in a pretty short period of time, but I stopped taking it because I found myself getting addicted to it. It's like a watered down version of blow.

column2: Danielle , 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Very satisfied with the pill, I'm not jittery but I'm not crashing by 2:30pm either. I've lost 18lbs to date. I highly recommend training your body to exercise and eat a reduce calorie, fat and sugar diet. Increase your fiber too. If you don't incorporate these things you will gain the weight back. My girlfriend took it but she never worked out while on the pill and she didn't eat at all. So she didn't have anything to burn. Now she's been off of it for 2 months and I can start to see her weight coming back on. Remember a diet pill will only work as hard as you do. Workout and eat healthy.

column9: So I'll start with the bad, irritable is putting it lightly, no really. Other than that I have NO appetite and plenty of energy. column2: Sunshine101, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This medication works but if you don't ween off it slowly you will have a severe increase in appetite. Works best for 3 months max then come off 2 months and back on again. It's very easy to gain the weight back after coming off of this medication. In my opinion you're better of eating healthy by cutting calories and exercising, the good old fashion way.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: WARNING!!! This medication is not for everyone! I started this medication about two years ago-had to stop after a year. BUT....the most serious was when I started to feel numbness,  tingling and swelling all along my left side from my jaw down my shoulder and arm. My fingertips and toes would turn blue and go numb. My blood pressure shot up (never once had problems with pressure before using this drug) I suffer still today from these symptoms off and on and have had several ekgs to monitor my heart health. Not worth the 26 pounds lost-and regained!

column2: butterball o' love, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I've taken phentermine off and on since 2010. I first stopped because I was drinking 4-5 cups of coffee a day AND taking phentermine. Woof - not a good idea : ) Anyway, when I do take it I make sure to cut back my coffee intake, increase my water intake, and EAT when my body tells me to. In three days I have lost 5 lbs, and that's w/out exercise and a severe cut in calorie intake (wasn't hungry). I don't expect to keep losing this much weight on a regular basis. When I start to plateau I'll slowly incorporate light exercise. But remember when taking this medicine: it's and AMPHETMINE!! Your doctor should have gone over your medical history with you and had you do an EEG BEFORE prescribing this. Also, have a realistic expectation of this medicine - sure it will work for awhile, but if you haven't learned to adjust your diet and exercise on your own, you'll just gain the weight back.

There are no hungry signals at all, no stomach growling uncontrollably you almost have to remind yourself to eat. I have lost 4 lbs in 2 weeks. Not only can I notice the loss in weight, I can feel it. I think If I were to incorporate a workout plan into my diet i would loose more, I do watch what I ear generally salads for lunch, oatmeal for breakfast and a small portioned dinner. Water is essential you crave it taking this medication i can't say that i have the dry mouth symptoms any longer..but i am constantly thirsty...i take my pill every morning one hour after i eat breakfast and it has been effective thus far! I would definitely recommend it...

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been taking this drug since Dec 2, 2010 & lost 10lbs in one month (haven't weighed myself since). I work out 3-4xs a wk, cardio 2xs & lift weights 2xs. I follow the book, "How to lose belly fat diet" & have only dry month as a side effect, which makes me drink a lot of water. It's great. I don't feel any "high" or depression. I take only 1 pill & I take it at lunchtime because I'm a snack-er at night. When I took it at breakfast, I still felt like I had to talk myself out of wanting a snack at night. A little adjusting & it's good now.

column2: something2live4, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Well i started out taking this in 6/2010 at 305lbs. it's now 1/2011 and I am at 229lbs. I didn't exercise over the summer because my job is cleaning hotels so that is considered exercising. But I did join a gym in the fall and I got 3-5 days a week and at least get on the treadmill for 30 minutes. It comes out to over a little more than a mile. I don't go by the calorie count, because the side-effect to this pill is sweating and you do actually burn more than what the machine says. I also eat alot less, and I don't drink or eat anything that contains anything with caffine. This medcine has changed my life. I am 30 yrs old. When I was 25 my doctor said I wouldn't live to see 40. Now it's all different. When I first started taking them they made me real hyper and I was afarid of becoming addicted like alot of all you are saying. But I take mine every other day. Plus it's all in the will power. They ARE NOT ADDICTIVE!!!!!! I stopped mine for a week for antibiotics and was fine. You just have to tell yourself that you enjoy who you are becoming and not who you were before you started taking them. You started taking them for a reason. But you can not stay on them forever.

column2: mrsaba310, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Important thing to know is not to purchase this online.  That is not phentermine (see spelling on label).  Go thru a clinic where they can monitor you.  The other thing is not to take any sort of caffeine with this drug as your heart rate and/or blood pressure may rise and your behavior may become more erratic.I believe I'm addicted to this drug.  It did great things the first year I used it.  After that, I ended up needing it more for keeping in focus and becoming more productive (like ritalin for ADD).  I've taken it for so long that when I had a terrible stomach flu and couldn't take it for a week, i experienced depression and felt so exhausted and couldn't focus on my work.  I gained all the weight back and craved fatty foods.  I'm back on again for the wrong reasons but I've cut my pills in half in hope to wean off it properly.  Use what this drug is intended for - accompany with a exercise and a diet program.  You will gain all the weight back if you do not learn good eating habits.  Please let me know if you have a dependence on this drug.  Good luck.

column2: im no longer in the 200's, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I think the pill works, only in the first week i lost 4lbs. and I wasn't drinking enough water and exercising as i was supposed to, I had no trouble with not eating a lot (and before the pill i would eat a lot) because I couldn't feel hunger all day and night. At the beginning I would get really dizzy, and a very happy feeling, a very bitter taste in my mouth and my mouth would get really dry. I am in my 5th week and i notice that is not working as before, I am starting to get hungry at night and i no longer get that bitter taste in my mouth, I still get a little dizzy though. I know I am already addicted to the pills because just the though of not taking the pill for a day makes me nervous ( I don't want to feel hunger again so I can keep up with eating healthy and I feel like I wont be able to do that without it because I am usually always hungry). My doctor wants to schedule an appointment next week to see me and I know he is going to change my dose and it sucks because I don't think is going to be a bigger dose.

column2: Ziggie's Mom, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I am a 53 yr old female going through menopause so my moods & weight gain are all over the place. I am usually a skeptic in most things that sound to good to be true especially when it comes to using drugs to help loose weight, but I saw such a dramatic weight lose in a friend I decided I should give it a try. I have only used it for a week. My appetite has decreased & my cravings seem to have lessened. I wear contacts, so my eyes dry out easaly anyway, but my vision seems a bit off, but nothing to worry about. My friend experienced headaches, but she was also cutting back on her Soda Pop addicition which I do not have. So far I have lost about 1 lb, but for 1 week that is not bad. I hope I continue to do the same each week. Taking it off slow is my goal. I need to loose about 40 to 50 lbs to be at a healthier weight & do not intend to gain it all back.

column2: none, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Years ago I was perscribed this meducine and it worked very effectively for my body.

column2: sweetie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: this pill is very effective.i started this pill weighing 215 and in 2 months i was at 176.i didnt exersize i did drink a lot of water (like crazy)i also did get dry mouth but drinking alot of water helped.it made me not hungry at all,it stoped my cravings and when i would eat i would eat a little and would get full really quick.i would like to get on it again but i moved and no longer have acces to that doctor.try it ,it will help.goodluck!

column2: chouser599@yahoo.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: I have taken this in the past and lost 28 pounds with it.  I just got lazy and let my weight back on.

column2: staci28!, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: carebear, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am 5'1 and I weighed 179. I started this med in april of 2010. The 1st 2 months it worked perfect I lost 29lbs. Then from June to Oct. I took it off and on with no more results so I have took a break from it to get it out of my system. I did good until Thankgiving and christmas break gain 9lbs. I plan to restart tomorrow since I have took a 2.5 month break. The only side effect I did have was very dry mouth, but it was worth it.

column2: Lostlove1971, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on Phentermine HCL 30mg since Dec.14,2010.  I have lost just over 11 lbs. and that part feels great.  Not wanting to eat everything in sight also feels great, but I'm not experiencing the energy boost that I was told it should give me.  Anyone else with this experience and if so did you tell your dr. about it and what did they say??  I have been exercising as often as possible (3-5 days a week @ 1hr each) and not eating much at all 800-1100 cal. a day.  I just feel I should have much more energy to do even more.

column2: Orland1973, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Hi - I am a newbie to Phentermine 37.5.  My goal is weigh 180 lbs, currently I am at 238 from 233... About two and half years ago, I was at 185 thin and loving every bit of me... Well I still love every bit of me but after seeing some pictures I was like on hell no - this weight has to come off. We all say we're our own best critic - well here it goes... I looked unhappy and miserable with that amount weight on me. Lucky me I have will power - I now eat like a vegetarian - and work out 3 - 4 days a week cardio only with light weights. In addition, to calorie counting throughout the day. As for my experiences to date - a little buzzed energy wise and my appetite has zapped that I now ask myself should I eat or should I pass on a meal.  Ok - I am rambling... I will be back weekly to give a status update.... By the way thanks to everyone for the positive reviews.... We can do it together one force.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I took this med for about 35 days and lost 26lbs I stopped taking it in late October and managed to keep the weight off to date. I would recomend it to others.

column2: mimi, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm 5.1/175 and started to take this medicine almost 3 weeks ago.  So far I lost 8 pounds, lots of energy and because I'm not hungry all the time I take my time and make better choices during my meals, more fruits and vegetables in my diet now.  I also purchased pedometer and walk at least 10000 steps 5 days a week.  To avoid problems sleeping I take it around 6:00am before going to work. The only issue is dry mouth but that helps me to drink more water every day.  The only concern I have is gaining the weight back if I stop, will ask my doc about that next visit.  This pill is GREAT!

column2: BetterThenEver!!!, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Tamika, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just started taking this medication and I have found that I am no longer hungry. I snack on fruit to ensure I dont get a headache. I am 285lbs now and plan on taking it for a month. I will check back in a week.

column2: ScottO43, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: snapplegurl, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 24 years old and a type 1 diabetic and 35lbs overweight I worked my butt off with eating right and excersisng and I couldnt lose a pound. So my Doctor percscribed me this med. it has been 5 days and i am still feeling the side affects like upset stomach, imsominia, and dry mouth. However my doctor also put me on a low dose antidepressant and a anti seizure medication to help with the side affect, it still makes me feel like a zombie sometimes. I also completely stopped drinking. my doctor told me those side affects will go away. Also I have not lost any weight yet but it only has slightly suppressed my appettite. not what i expected but it only has been 5 days so I will check back in with hopefully better results.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Female 27 start weight 236.  Started 37.5 mg in October.  Now in December at 218 lbs. Side effects I have experienced: irritability, bad breath and taste, jittery feeling at times, mild to moderate nausea.  The plan is to stay on for 3 more months and a goal weight of 180.  i workout 4-5 times weekly (3 aerobic, 1-2 strength training) but have been doing that for a couple years with little or no weight loss.  This has improved the numbers but sometimes the side effects can be a little overwhelming.  My appetite has been almost completely wiped out at times and i have to force myself to sit down and eat some vegetables or a bowl of cereal to keep from getting nauseated.

column2: kb, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking phentermine hcl for 7 weeks, total weight lost 22 lbs.  In the first 8 days I had lost 12 lbs. Then stopped losing for a week.  Then lost another 10 lbs over the next few weeks. The first side effects I noticed was a metallic taste in my mouth and had a very dry mouth. But that went away after about 2 weeks. It really helped with my energy, I was very sluggish before taking the meds and now I feel great. Do not have much time to excercise, but I have so much energy I am constantly moving.  The energy is not a jittery energy, it just feels like this is the way I am supposed to feel.  I love it! I have had no problems with sleeping.  I take my extended release pill very early in the morning, around 7 am and do not eat breakfast till 8 am. I do not snack anymore. I eat 3 meals a day, and not real big meals.  I am completely satisfied and never feel the need to snack.  Some days I have to make myself eat something because I am just not hungry. But I eat a little something anyway because I have found that if I completely skip a meal I do feel a little irritable and a little jittery.  But that is a small price to pay for 22 lbs in 7 weeks. Now I just need to fit in an hour on my elliptical, I am not doing any conventional forms of excercise yet. I know that I need to start. Because this is just a step to getting the weight off.  It will be up to me to keep it off once I go off the meds!

column2: yumyum12, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have used it before and lost 20 lbs. but I have never lost more than that while others seem to just drop 50lbs or more. It does keep me awake.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication just reminds me of Aderal.. very awake, no appetite whatsoever but I have a compulsive need to clean and do busywork when I'm on the phentermine. I haven't lost any weight since that first month. I'm satisfied with the drug but I can't help but wonder how much of it is all mental.. since I didn't drop a single pound after I stopped my exercise routine even though I still took the pills for another 3 months.

column2: chardma, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: had thyroid ca when i was 25, now i'm 45. i had not really had a weight problem until i had a child. i am in the us army, i have to maintain weight standards, i tried for 1.5 years to drop weight, even going to endocrinologist to make sure synthroid dose correct. started adipex, and lost 25 lbs in 6 months. i break the medication in 1/2, the whole is too much for me. i eat very small meals throughout the day, sometimes forced. i dont take it on the weekends and eat what i want. i have fit it into my schedule and what works for me, and makes me the happiest.

column2: pudge, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: traveler567, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: Ducky5, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column9: My daughter turned five on November 26th, 2010 and I weighed 140.6 lbs.  When I found out I was pregnant almost 6 years ago I weighed 130 lbs and 9 months later I was huge and weighed 205 lbs. (I am 5 ft 1 1/2 inches, quite petite)  After a lot of hard work, exercise, and a lot of graduall changes in my diet I was able to get to 165 lbs.  I just started my fifth month on this medication and am very thankful that I did except for one thing....My doctor informed me that she usually does not prescribe this for more than three months.  After taking it for the forth month I felt as though it was not working very well so I skipped a week.  I felt VERY TIRED and crappy.  I have had others tell me that after completing a full month AT LEAST a week should be skipped.  That way you can reset your motabolism.  I wish that I had done that, my body doesnt know what to do without it. I will have to speak with my doctor about cutting down slowly.  I did not enjoy that crash at all.

column2: lifechange, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Overall I'm satisfied with controlling my appetite. it has helped me lost my desire for 'sweets'. Great for me! My only problem is not sleeping at night. Only 3-4 hours. And now constipation.Lost 15 pds. Someone please reply. It now 3:30 a.m. thx.

column2: louise, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
msstacieb21, 25-34 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Today makes a week since I started the drug.  I wrote the review where i said im 25 and 335 pounds. I now weigh 320 pounds and the side effects r all gone.
