column2: DD, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Hello I started taking phentermine 30mg the lower strength 0ctober 25th, because I'm 5'1 and was 173lbs gained 20lbs after having my son. I was to take 1 pill every morning before breakfast. Side effect: it made me very hyper and energetic, some times moodier than usual, very allert, i had headaches the 1st 2 days beyond that no additional negative side effects. but everyones different so know ur body and pay attention to it! :). i did change my diet, i eat more fibers like oatmeal or cereal (cheerios) for breakfast at the recommended portion size on the box, a fruit in between breakfast and lunch. during lunch i ate fast food someday :) like mcdonalds but something small no big macs! salads or some healthy choice low cal meal from the grocery store. i ate snacks sometime but not daily if so it was yogart or more fruit. and dinner i ate whatever i wanted in a smaller portioned size. ill be honest i get icecream like every other week or an iced coffee every other week. lol. i did wrkout 2-3times per week 100 crunches, 20 side leg lifts 25 pushups and 50 squats. i lost 12 lbs. now weighing 161 so i think the pill worked pretty well especially considering it was lower dose and i didnt take daily (im forgetful) i still have 13 pills leftover. So i'd say better eating habbits and a little bit of exercise will help take the weight off. good luck guys!!!

column2: MSSTACIEB21, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking 37.5 mg of Phentermine this week on Wensday, Nov. 17, 2010.  I take 1 whole pill before breakfast, then another whole pill before lunch. My doctor put me on this dosage and medicine because I am 25 years old, 5"10 and I wieghed an embarrasing 335 pounds.  It is now Friday, November 19, 2010 and I weigh 324.5 pds. which is a weight loss of 10.5 pds. in 3 days! I will join a gym on Monday.  I cant eat half of what I used to before taking this pill. I was being greedy yesterday and tried to eat a whole bowl of brocolli and cheese soup from Subway and I immediately vomited. The drug tells my brain that the sight, thought or smell of food is disgusting so I dont even desire eating.  Two setbacks though: 1.) I sleep only about 3-4 hrs a night. no more naps. nothing but energy but I hope this insomnia passes in a few weeks. 2.) I get a little out of breathe and heart palpitates sometimes when walking long distances.  Overall, so far I'm happy. I just want to stay focused, get healthy and not feel fat and ugly anymore. GOOD LUCK TO EVERYONE! WE CAN DO THIS!!

column2: Janet, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column9: The first time I took it, I had some issues.  Doc suggested I beak pill in half.  Worked perfect since.  I have lost 15lbs in 45 days.  I simply do not feel hungry, therefore I eat less.

column2: lpcemt, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this med for approximately 3 months. My dr. put me on it for a little mental clarity (focusing problems), plus i was a little over weight. Now I eat all the time and it has totally increased my metabolism. Love this medication !

column2: ladytex, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Back with an update to my first review from 11/5. Have had 2 more weekly weigh-ins since my 10 and 3 lb losses the first 2 weeks on a doctor-supervised weight loss plan. Week 3 was 2.5 lbs and week 4 (yesterday) was 3 lbs, so a total of 18.5 lbs in 4 weeks. Not bad, but was hoping to lose at least 4-5 lbs per week consistently for at least the first month or so before dropping to the 2-3 lbs average, especially since I have been so disciplined at diet, exercise, and water consumption. At my doctor's recommendation, I increased from one 15 mg capsule once per day to 1/2 of a 37.5 mg tablet twice a day (1 hour before both breakfast and lunch) starting on 11/10. Still no side effects. Continuing to follow an 800 calorie diet plan and exercising 5-6 days per week. However, I lowered my Satisfaction rating from 4 to 3 stars because I am not seeing any fat-burning benefit from the drug as my doctor said I should. When I do the math on my resting daily calorie rate (per her machine) vs. my 800 calorie diet (sometimes less) and the average 350 calories burned daily through exercise, it accounts for 2.5 - 3.0 lbs per week lost on its own, so no apparent help from the drug in this regard.  It does control my appetite, but with the reviews I've read about the risks of long-term use, I'd like to see a little faster weight loss so I can reach my goal as soon as healthfully possible. I'll plan to give another progress report in a couple of weeks as I hope the info will be helpful to others.  In the meantime, does anyone have any feedback on Phentirmene, which supposedly works as well as Phentermine but not as risky?  I have read  several reviews online that are positive, but it would be helpful to know if they are too good to be true. Thanks and good luck fellow dieters, especially with the food-filled holidays just around the corner.  Blessings to you!

column2: lily, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: 8u6ffwm, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: barb, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months

column2: Christy2781, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking this on 9/1/10 (30mgs) & weighed 260lbs (5'8"). I've lost 40lbs with a strict diet of 700-900 calories/day. The 1st 2-3 days I had more energy but after that I went back to the usual. The 1st week I lost 10lbs so when the weight loss slowed it was discouraging but I kept at it & have been losing 2-5lbs/week since. The 1st month I was exercising twice/week at the gym for at least 2 hours each time & lost about 17lbs total but the 2nd month I started a new job & I now I only get to go every other weekend but I push myself hard the whole time I'm there & I cut my calories a little more. After the 1st month my hunger started to come back around dinner time & it was much harder to not each junk food so my doctor changed my dose to 37.5mg & it's been working great ever since & I lost about 16lbs the 2nd month & another 7lbs so far this month.  I would like to lose another 60lbs over the next 5 months but my doctor won't let me keep taking it for that long. I'm afraid that once I stop taking the pills I'll gain all the weight back because  before I started taking them I felt like I was staving all the time no matter how often or how much I ate. It's so easy to watch what I eat with the pills but I don't know if I can keep up with not touching any fatty or sweet foods & eating such tiny portions afterwards. I haven't had any side effects except for a few palpitations once or twice when I drank a lot of coffee with the medicine (a whole pot of coffee in 1 day once).

column2: happy, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: helpful

column2: bubbly, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Started taking pills 11-1 and combining with low carb high protein diet and also joined a gym have been three times so far but I have lost 10 lbs in 10 days and im not starving myself i love this pill i have so much more energy now everyone at work notices that i have a lot of energy and that i am losing weight which is great im hoping to lose 60lbs by march and the way things are going now i may lose it sooner with the help of this drug i would recommend it to anyone tahts like me who thought they could never lose weight and always tried to start dits but never stuck with it i finally just told myself that i had to do this for me and my family so i can play with my 4 year old without getting tired and out of breath LOVE IT!

column2: mom of 16, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have taken this med in the past and lost 50 lbs. It works great I think the water really makes the difference though. I did gain all the weight back after I quit taking it. I had heard about this from other users and thought they were just going back to their old habits this is not the case for me. But yes it does most defiently work! I am back on them starting 11/4/10 with a weight of187.8 this am I weigh 184.0.  Yeah!  I have hoshimotos so weight loss is tough. Good luck to every one you can do it and it feels so good to be thinner can't weight {pun intended} to wear my jeans again

column2: Bama, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: works

column2: SARAH BALDWin, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years
ladytex, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started this drug on 10/19 along with an 800-calorie doctor-supervised diet plan.  I am 5'8" and started at 252.5 lbs with a goal to weigh 150 lbs.  The doctor prescribed 15 mg for first 3 days then increase to 30 mg after that, but since 15 mg was doing such a great job of suppressing my appetite and I don't like to take more drugs than necessary, my doctor said OK to stay at 15 mg.  My energy level is up, and no negative side effects that I've noticed. Lost 10 lbs by 10/26. Next appt on 11/3 lost only an additional 3 lbs, which was discouraging because I had been doing cardio 5 days per week and strength training 1 day per week and not always consuming all 800 calories due to being busy and rarely hungry. I know weight loss slows down after the first week, but I thought I'd at least get a couple of 5 lb weeks in before dropping lower since I am so overweight, especially since I am being so diligent.  After reading several posts here, I am more encouraged and hoping to see steady progress. Good luck to everyone in reaching their weight loss goals!

SO WE WILL SEE IF ITS THE MEDICATION KEEPING MY MIGRAINS AWAY.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: i started on phen on the 28 sept posted on the 8 oct loss of 11 lbs again on the 19 oct and was down by 19lbs and as of today total loss is 25 lbs. Side effects have all but disappeared. I have missed days taking the drug with no problems. I was staying in a hotel last week where price included full board so it wasnt as easy to watch what i was eating but back to normal routine again an find that i am still loosing the lbs. Just need another 6 lbs off to reach target. Loosing 25lbs in 35 days for me has been a huge achievement. I am now eating much more healthily and enjoying what i am eating. I have breakfast lunch and dinner everyday and fruit in between. I still have tea and a couple of chocs or biscuits in the night time.I do wake much earlier but am tired around 10.30 11 at night and can sleep at this time without any bother.Another couple of weeks should see me reach target, then coming off them completely is the goal. I would love to hear from people that has come off them and what was the best way to quit them

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Ive been getting treatment for Hypothyroidism for over 16 yrs. Still fighting my weight. No energy to workout. My doctor prescribed me this rx and i have never felt so good in my life! It gave me energy so i could and want to workout and stick to a program to keep me going for when i do get off the phentermine. I lost over 30 lbs in 4 months. At first i thought it stopped working because i couldnt feel the jitter anymore which only lasted about a week or so. Guess my body got used to it! Still had Energy and kept me going! Then i noticed my weight dropping. Always had low self Esteem so when i lost my weight, it was the best feeling. Ive been off it for quite sometime now and still maintaining my weight. Definately works! With Exercise and eating healthy makes the weight come off faster! The only side effect i had was dry mouth, but that just made me drink more water which i needed to anyhow! I didnt plan on wanting to take it long, just something to get me going! This was a great help!!

column2: KMR2319, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

When I went to the doctor, I weighed 190. Mr doctor said that 130 is a good weight for me. Im 5'3". Looking forward to some good results! Will keep posting. Next Drs. appoinment is 11/29/10.

column2: prettywings1928, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: prettygirlmd, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: hopefulgirl, 45-54 Female  (Patient)
energy1, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My last post was on 09/02/2010. I have been taking phen for a little over 2 months now the 1st month I had a loss of 18 pounds. That was with working out every morning and during my lunch break. My second month I only lost 8 pounds that was eating pretty much what I wanted and not working out. So yes the pill helps. I took myself off the pill for two weeks to see how I would do. As of now I have not gained any weight and have maintained my weight with out working out. Going in to my 3rd month I plan to work out again twice a day and eat better to see how my body reacts to the pill again!!!!  Again this pill does HELP you lose weight but is NOT the answer you have to be active!!! Will post again to update!

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My last posting was on the 8 oct and i had been on the med for 10 days and had lost a little over 11 lbs with dry mouth as the only side effect now down to 205 lbs which is a total loss of over 19 lbs in as many days. Still have a little dry mouth but other than that i feel fine. i am drinking over 2 liters of water every day and urinating quiet a lot. I now decide what i want to eat and when i will have it. Before i began on the med every time i went into a filling station for petrol I would buy something to eat. I drive fo a living so i was stopping a couple of times a day, i have cut this out and am filling only the gas tank when i pull over. If i feel hungry i eat an apple or pear. I know its only 19 days but i feel great and can see the belly disappearing. Everybody I meet comment on how well i am looking which helps. I am not sure how much of this is down to the meds or to the change in lifestyle. from reading all the posts on here my only worry is coming off the med and will i be able to maintain the weight loss as some posts say they put it all back on and more. My goal is to loose around another 12 or 13 lbs which would have me down to around 193 lbs which is 88kgs which would be fine as i am male 6f 4 age 36. I said in my last post that it is very important that your doc knows all your medical history and would strongly emphasise this again. I would love to hear from people that have reached their goal and if they were able to maintain the weight loss. I dont plan on staying on it long term as it is pretty powerful and and the longterm effects are not very clear. I have also read that if you are subject to a drugs test this can show up in your system the same as cocaine so please be careful.I am not sure how true this fact is. I would still recomend it with caution and again will stress the need for controle at the table. Regards to all trying to kick the habit of a lifetime (over eating)which is one of our highest killers.

column2: Che, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: My last posting was on 8-24-10 and I was at a loss of 72.5 pounds.As of today I am at a loss of 80 pounds.Exercise, portion control, and low fat/calorie meals are key! I cannot stress those three factors enough!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on the drug for a little over four months. 65 lbs gone. I always go off the drug for one week, and I dont have the hunger that I use to have before I started taking this drug because my body is use to the intake that I have been doing since being on the drug. I use to have the dry mouth all the time but barely have it. Im hoping to lose 60 more lbs on the drug. However I work out, play a sport, and jog a couple times a week, and watch what I eat so I feel like Ive been successful with the help of this drug and my life change. I would recommend this drug to anyone because it has done wonders for me. Im a little nervous about stopping taking it but I think I wll be just fine with all the life changes I have made. Good luck everyone.

column2: litahni, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I agree with the last review. She sounds like me!!! I began taking it on 09/28/10 and I weighed 168 now on 10/14/10 I weigh 156.4 puonds!! I like it because I use to think of food all day long and now I don't I feel good and I am not sleepy like I use to be which I believe it was the food and calories I was putting into my body!!! I have 28-30 pounds to go I am 5'4". The only thing that gets me is the dry mouth BUT it helps because I drink A LOT of water all day long! :)

column2: Thinkingthin, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on a plateau after a year of being on weight watchers... I began this drug 37.5 dose on 082310 at 166 and now on 101410 am 153 and I am 5'4.  I would like to lose 13 more pounds at least while taking drug but only have 3 weeks left of rx.  Side effects include dry mouth the first two weeks, sleeplessness if more than one caffeine dring per day and occasional mild constipation.  I take this drug daily except for Sundays which I use to stay off of the drug so my body doesn't get immune.  I would love to hear from people who have lost and who have kept it off.  I still eat but I stay within my weight watchers points.  it would be easy to not eat and lose more because you're truly not hungry but I think the goal is to get in a habit of eating the correct amounts.  If you've lost and have kept it off please post your experience.

column2: Down50, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been on it for 4 months and have lost 50lbs., 25 more to go.  I have not experienced any side effects. Nervous about stopping, i've read some posts where they've gained the weight back but still exercised and stuck with the diet?  Very happy with results so far.

column2: milkmaid, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started 9/20/10, so far i have lost 12 lbs. I am happy with my experience thus far, I have not had the jitters or any extreme burst of energy its more a steady burn throughout my day. I do forget to eat @ times I have to make myself eat more often than not. I have dry mouth so water & chewing gum are my constant companions. i get a 30 min work out twice a day except for weekends my gym doesnt have hours condusive to my work schedule on those days but I still try to make it in once on those days.

column2: sweetpea0810, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for a long time now. I have read that there are not any studies done for long term use, which I admit is concerning. Other than that, I have not had many side effects. When I first began taking it I did feel slightly jittery and did have the dry  mouth issue, but after a week or so it went away. I honestly have been on it so long I am not sure how much of my weight loss is due to the medication and how much is just eating better and working out. I do know that I am able to eat what I want, within reason of course, without too much of a problem with weight gain. I have hit a plateau with weight loss and have been at the same weight for the last 6-9 months. Also I did stop taking the Phentermine  recently to see if any of the weight would come back on. I didn't gain any weight, but I decided to get back on it after a month. Overall, I think it is a good drug that helps aid in minimal weight loss. Without somewhat watching what you eat and exercising I don't think people will see a substantial weight loss.

column2: Pretty, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 5'2 1/2 and was weighing about 180.  I used this drug for about 3 months and got down to 138. The weightloss doc I went to prescribed this pill along with a water pill that I was only to take a half of per day.  My weightloss was so drastic because I took it the WRONG way!  When I wasnt hungry it was very hard to force myself to eat so most days, I wouldnt eat very much however, I ate what I wanted and I didnt workout much.  I also noticed that when I drank coffee or coke it increased the effect and I would be on the go all day long.  I did suffer side effects though..i couldnt sleep so I used the vitamin melatonin to sleep, I would get headaches which probably came from not eating enough (i didnt have them everyday) and thats about it.  I recommend trying it, as I read these reviews I see that most users havent had my luck so it apparently works different for some people, also I recommend getting it through a doctor not online because online they can sell you anything and say its phentermine, which is why some of the people who ordered it offline failed to get results.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: top heavy, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I began med 10 days ago at 224.4lbs I am 6"4 so didnt look too over weight but have been trying to get rid of a belly for years with different diets and exercise without success. now down to 211 lbs with fat around belly disappearing. no side effects eccept dry mouth so i carry a bottle of water with me. Loads of energy. Sleeping fine.I`v cut down on all the snacking between meals and replaced junk food with fruit. I have done alot of research onthe med and it works differently for different people but on the hole seems very positive.I have noticed the effects are not as strong as your body gets used to the med. The pounds will return if you stop taking it and return to your old habits. I found it brilliant to kick start me into action and now feel brilliant. I would reccomend it with caution. Make sure your doc knows of all your medical history before you begin on it. It will not work on it own you have to help it by doing a little extra excersise an cut out the fatty junk foods.Hopefully this helps and best of luck to everybody trying to get rid of the inches.

column2: msbojangles, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: been on the drug for a month and a half. I am eating healthy now.  I did not feel hungry .   I found myself getting hungry in the evenings though.   I have lost eight pounds.   Thought I would have done better since I have changed my eating habbits.   Dry mouth, bad breath and constipation are the side effects I notice. Today the dr added another pill.  Its 7am and I am wide awake. Not sure how I feel about it at this point.   It does curb appitite until you get used to it.   I am not giving up yet though.  It does not make me thirsty like the others have said.   Maybe I need to force myself to drink more water.

i do not recomened this drug at all i have never been a drug user but from what ive been told it is not any different than street meth. I can also see how it could turn into something very bad. It has effected my whole life . It made me become someone i am not . my wife, kids and job were all hurt by this med and to see that you can get this over the net in my oppinion is nothing more than the devil himself at work!I pray for those who are trying to lose weight and are relying on this for help

column2: debicanshop, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just started taking this medicine 9/3 and I've noticed I have less of an apetite and more energy. However, I also have a nervous feeling and lots of dizziness. Hopefully these will abate once my body gets adjusts.

column2: energy1, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking phen on 8/2 with a weight of 203. As of 9/2 I weigh 185. Thats 18 pounds in 1 month time. I have been eating healthy 3 to 4 times a day, I work out every morning and during my lunch at work. I started out with a weight of 225 and lost 22 pounds on my own but was stuck at around 200 for a while. So yes I do believe that this pill helps. But no you can't just sit on your butt and eat whatever you want whenever you want to. Get up start moving and feel over all so much better!! I have more energy and I am loving life. I did have dry mouth a time or to and did get angry easier than norm but not often. This pill is a jump start to a new life style just don't depend on it.

column2: skinnygirl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Ihave been taking Phen for 1 week, however i have taken it before and notice my togue had weird bumps the next day, then my gums became irratated. Sad because it really works for me, I loose weight and have lots of energy. Thats is why i rate it so high. It really works! oh yes and very very dry mouth,but i dont mind that because i drink more than my required amount of water.

column2: Tboy69, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am an overweight woman, age 41, with Type 2 Diabetes. With my doctor's approval, I started on Phentermine 37.5 on August 1,2010. I had never heard of this drug, until my doctor suggested it to me and prescribed it for me to try. I was concerned about taking any weight loss pill, in fear of side effects.Some weight loss pills out there, I heard can be bad for you. ( I am still seeing the lawyers ads on tv for people who have taking Phen-fen, and had bad problems with it) But I am very please with Phentermine. My doctor told me he has alot of his obese Type 2 Diabetes on it and they are doing well. So far, I lost 12 lbs in one month. Now I am not saying this is a magic pill, but with diet and excerise, it sure is helping me along with my weight loss journey.

column2: sally, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
lily, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: 8/19/10, I went to the Dr. and was told I lost 10lbs.  That totals to 18 lbs in two months and a half.  Not bad.  So I am now at 178lbs and loving it.  I am continuing on the 30mg and so far only issue I have is dry mouth and that time of the month when my craving really strikes especially sweets.  Will be back to Dr on 9/29/10, crossing my fingers for another 10lbs if possible. Will keep posting. Bye!!!!

column2: ashton, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
nessa, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just started Phen and so far I am excited. I have been on Phen for 2 days now and already lost 2 pounds!!! The 1st day I had so much energy I didn't know what to do with myself so I went to the gym, and for the 1st time in my life I enjoyed working out and it was amazing! However, that night I had trouble sleeping and the next day I didn't have as much energy I will keep everyone posted on my results so far so good. All I need to do is to eat a little healthier and I should lose more weight. I also don't feel my appetite suppressed maybe because my doctor gave me a lower dose I only take 15mg a day.

column2: DwnA9, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I went to the weight loss clinic that prescribed this drug on Aug 23rd and also received the lipotropics injection that same day in the clinic. I started the phentermine 37.5mg the next morning around 7:30 am and take it daily. The day I went to the clinic I weighed 213lbs at 5'8". As of this morning, Aug 26th, the scale says 207lbs. With that being said, I have been able to watch what I am eating and I do not have anymore cravings or the urge to just eat for no reason. I was told to cut back to one diet coke per day and drink more water so I have been doing that as well. It has definately suppressed my appetite and seems to have an affect on my behavior with food. Since I am taking both the phentermine AND the lipotropics injection I am not sure which is the most effective or if it is the combination of the two but I am pleased so far. Right now I do not experience many of the side effects that I have read about but I am keeping a close eye on that. I will post again in a few weeks.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking the drug for 4 months lost over 32lbs. but it seems like I'm at a stand still, I'm doing the same things nothing has changed but it's been over two weeks and have not lost a pound but I haven't gained any either. anyone else done this?

column2: dieter101, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Dr.'s scale had me at 199 lbs when I started Phentermine 37.5 mg. four months ago.  I have lost a total of 30 lbs. and two pants sizes. Doctor is very happy with the rate of weight loss and so am I.  Lose weight fast will cause you to gain it and more back.  Only side effect is dry mouth. Energy level is back up to where it use to be.  I take the pill around 6:15 a.m. M-F and eat yogurt or a low calorie cereal bar around 9:30 a.m.  That keeps me going until lunch then I have a salad / fruit or lean protein.  I have slimfast snack bars several times a day and a very sensible dinner.  Daily calorie intake is 900 - 1200 calories.

column2: Grl30, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was 221 when I began taking Phen and I was at a loss, I just couldnt lower my calories enough. I started to take it and I didn't like it much at first. I felt jittery and my eye would twitch. I love diet soda and when I'd drink some while on it, I'd go through a bad anxiety/depression. I wasn't taking it daily and I was feeling too weird to really get serious about dieting the first month. Id even go off on the weekends. The following month, I decided to get serious, and I nixed the diet soda. I ate about 1550 calories per day and later began adding in exercise. I lost 17 lbs in the two months I took phen. Now when I stop taking it for a week, I am able to keep my calories low because my stomach has shrunk and I know that I need to use my calories in a more useful way. I fill up on veggies and fruit and make everything else a secondary, as it should be. I don't go overboard trying to do 1200 calories per day. I'm still doing roughly 1550 and exercising but I make good choices. I know this is a great drug but you have to work too. You cant expect to just get thin on it by starving yourself while on it and doing nothing else. Ofcourse you will binge when its out of your system if you starve yourself while on it. You should eat enough calories even if you dont feel hungry and make those calories ones that count. You have to be smart on Phen, you cant expect to lose 20 lbs per month because you will gain it back and look flabby... this drug can help you lose weight at a moderate pace if you use it correctly. It's for people who have the will but needed an extra push to help out.

column2: mjem, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: When I used this med, it made me tired and I didnt really lose any weight. I even got a little mean. I stopped taking it and life went back to normal.

column2: Che, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: The last time I posted was on 7/7/10 and I had lost a total of 64 lbs. since starting this medicine in January. Today I am happy to say that I am 72.5 lbs. lighter than the day I started this! I started weighing in at 330 and I now weigh 257.5!  Fabulous! I don't take the medicine everyday, like I stated in my last post. I find it works better for me when I skip days. I also find that on those days I don't take it, I continue to eat as if I were taking it. It's definitely a tool in behavior modification, if nothing else. But you must work in accordance with it. Point blank.  The pill does not do all the work, trust me.

column2: helpless, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started phentermine 2009..was on it off and on..everytime I go off of it I gain weight back fast..even though I'm still strict with what I eat and exercise..it doesn't matter! Works great while your on it but your doomed when you go off so beware! It becomes very stressful. If anyone knows of any help let me know.

column2: mamasusie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This overweight medication is wonderful and I wish a person would not have to go to the Doctor for it.  It could help so many people.  I feel wonderful on it and also about myself.  I have been on it for 2 1/2 months and have lost 21 lbs. I have more engery then I have ever had and it REALLY works.  It will leave you with a dry mouth but you need to drink more water any way.

column2: runner, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Very effective in supressing my appitite. It has helped with will-power and hunger attacks. It has also helped reduce my cravings. I would highly recommoned this drug to anyone who needs help getting started on the road to better health.

column2: boopsie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: some days it just makes me nervous not reducing my appetite

column2: momofone, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My starting weight was 183 lb., and I'm 5'3". I started taking phentermine (37.5mg dosage) on 8/6/10. It is now 8/19/10 and I have lost about 13 lbs. I exercise 6 days per week for about an hour and a half. 45 mins of hardcore cardio and 45 mins of weight training and ab work. This pill has completely transformed my apetite, I find it hard to make myself sit down to eat because I'm usually not hungry at all. I try to eat between 750-900 calories per day. I now drink skim milk, no soda at all (not even diet), I drink mostly water and sometimes fruit juice. Upon first taking phentermine (for about the first week) I experience dry mouth and kept a liter of water with me at all times. I usually drink about 2-3 liters per day now. The first day I took it I also experienced a rush of energy (like drinking a 5 hour energy shot) but the next day and since then haven't felt that at all. Every Sunday I don't take it so I can feel it more during the week. One suggestion, if you start taking this pill make sure that you exercise because losing weight fast but with no diet or exercise will make you more succeptable to gaining your weight back almost immediately when stopping the use of this pill. Another little hint that I've found useful is if you get home from work and are very tired and don't feel like working out (I get up at 4:15am some days for work and feel exhausted when I get home) rest for about 2 hours and take half a 5 hour energy shot before working out and it'll give you the energy for a great workout (and they only have 4 calories). I'll keep everyone posted about how things go for me after my next doc apt., so in about 2 weeks....

column2: Hope, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Last post 5/30/2010 Restarted taking the drug two weeks ago(8/3). Starting weight was 211 now 198lbs. after 10 days,weight has seem to remain the same 4-6days now.I lost the weight without exercising but eating healthy and no carbs,and lost of water.I believe it is due to the fact that I have not been eating much lately.Only side effects is dry mouth. Will resume at least 1200 calories and start to do some walking.Will check back in about 2wks. hopefully with more progress.

column2: Trish, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication does work for weight loss and I was satisfied with the amount of weight I did loose in the first month. However I statred it to get me jump started on loosing weight. When i first started taking it I came down with severe bronchitis. My lungs were sooo tight that they didnt really expand when breathing in. I Thought it was a coincindence.I thought I had just caught a bug. Had breathing problems for over a month even after going to MD for breathing treatment and an inhaler. I had to go back for z pack. Felt good went back for my second month of pills and have lung/breathing problems again. And now getting headaches. I am going to stop taking the drug and diet and excercise as to not gain all the weight that I did loose back and to continue to loose weight. After all diet and excercise are the key.  I hope you all do not get the breathing problem as I did or any severe side effects for that matter.....Good Luck to everyone on your weight loss journey and dont give up.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: stomach pain

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been taking Phentermine for about 1 1/2 months now and have lost 21 pounds. The side effects were present for the first week or two, but now I hardly have any. The side effects I experienced were dry mouth, jitters, not sleeping well and having so much energy I just didn't know what to do with it (I sit at a desk ALL day). But like I said the side effects subsided and I've lost the weight. I hate to admit this, but I haven't even exercised. The not wanting to eat and actually having control of my eating was enough. My caloric goal is 1200 (which is right for my height & size). So I eat a fiber bar in the morning, lean cuisine or smart one at lunch and something sensible for dinner. I do allow myself a cheat day. Now I am down to 175. I would like to get to 135-140. TIME TO EXERCISE!! But to give myself some credit, before this medicine I would come home, make dinner and sit in front of the tv for the rest of the night until it was time to go to bed - I was VERY lazy. Now I make dinner, clean the house, take my little boy outside to play, etc. I don't stop until I hit the bed. To sum it up, I would recommend to my friends and family; and this has been really effective for me.

column2: Lissie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have taken this for 8 months and have lost 80 lbs and at 120lbs am at my goal weight. However, I believe that weight loss is more mental than anything. The med helps with hunger, but unless you change your eating habits and exercise, the weight will come back when you stop any weight loss medication. I weigh,measure, and food journal everything I put in my mouth! I don't eat any processed foods, cut out all white carbs like sugar and flour. It's about being healthyand keeping off the weight.The meds just help get you there. The rest is up to you! GOOD LUCK!!! It's sooo worth it, it's not easy at first, but your body will look and feel amazing!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I have been on this medication for 3 days now. I lost 4 pounds by the second day..wow..that amazing but the nausea, dizziness, gitters, and blurred vision is kicking my butt. hopefully it will pan out. I really don't have a desire to eat and anything and i can atest to the dry mouth which promotes drinking more water. I figure if I add a little more activity/exercise it will more effective. I haven't had much trouble sleeping...no bad news there.

column2: Monica P, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking this drug 15 days ago my starting weight was 224 and now it is 210. the first & second day I had such a boost of energy I actually exercised for about 1 hour and a half i felt like I drank 2 energy drinks and could not sleep at all had severe dry mouth and the thought of food did nothing for me. As each day passed my body started to adjust more to the medication I sleep great now I still do get random severe dry mouth but that only makes me drink more water I have changed my eating habits all together I exercise at least 5-6 times a week. It really does assist in not making you hungry and when you do choose to eat you want to make the choice not reach for a do-nut you reach for fruit or a veggie. I think so far it is great! It is a lifestyle change. I have noticed another side effect after others reviews I do have finger or joint strain on my hands like I have arthritis I thought it was because my office they run the air conditioner so high my office is usually somewhere between 68 - 70 degrees I thought my fingers were just freezing so I will talk to my doctor about that on my next visit. But 14 pounds in 15 days and a complete lifestyle change is pretty great with me! Good Luck to all of you but be aware of all side effects losing the weight means nothing if you are not healthy at the end.

column2: missy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Well I have to share my experience with this stuff. It did help me to loose weight (about 35 lbs over 6 mos period) then I got pregnant. (did not know I was pregnant till about 4-6 weeks along) then I stopped taking it. however at 5 1/2 mos I lost the baby. Doctors are not sure why my body did this. Anyhow, now I am back on the phentermine(& birth control) but cannot loose any weight at all. Im on full dose & I just stay the same every week. ready to get myself off here in a week or two max if nothing happens. Doc says your body gets use to it, and maybe time to switch to another medicine.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: Anon, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been on Phentermine for 1 week and have lost some weight, feel energized but not speedy.I haven't noticed the dry mouth but did have trouble falling asleep the first 2 days on it. I found that if I take it early in the morning (about 6AM) w/ a glass of water it works best. I eat small but healthy meals even though I don't feel hungry. So far, I am very pleased w/ this drug and this week will add exercise (walking) into the equation. If you are looking to lose weight, I highly recommend this drug! Take it early in the day and drink lots of water. Eat 3 small but healthy meals and exercise. By the time you're done with the drug, the change of lifestyle should be a new habit for you. I guess if you start gaining the weight back, you could just go back on it for a week or so. I am pleased so far with my results but I am making weight loss a lifestyle right now. Wish me luck!

column2: gettinINTOtheSKINNYjeans!, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been taking phentermine for a week now and I feel GREAT!! The only side effect I have is dry mouth which just makes me drink more water, so no biggie there.  I've lost 9 lbs! I know it'll slow down but seeing that weight gone is awesome motivation.  I feel awesome.  I haven't had this much energy in I don't know how long. Not to mention that even though I was breathing hard from the cardio, I wasn't winded or tired at all.  It's crazy! But it truly is a miracle pill.  I'm taking it supervised by a doctor which I do recommend.  I forget to eat sometimes and when I do it's small meals.  I ate half a sandwich for lunch yesterday, I don't remember the last time I ate half of anything :) If you need to lose more than 40 lbs this will give you the help you need.

column2: theteacher, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i have been on this medication for a week. i havent weighed myself yet but i know i have lost weight because my underware fit looser. column2: Shan, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been on Phentermine for three weeks now and overall results are good. Like others, I lost a great deal of weight in the first few days - 4lbs overnight and 7 total in the first week. Now I have lost a total of 10 lbs in three weeks (started at 209, now at 199). I think people should be aware that the initial huge weight loss is not the way it will be the rest of the time. After that first initial drop, the loss is definitely slowing down. I think that big initial loss we all see is definitely a result of the massive amounts of water were drinking to combat the dry mouth  so the majority of that first drop is most likely water weight. Ive been eating a very restricted calorie diet and wonder if I shouldnt be losing more than the 2 pounds a week Ive had the past two weeks. I think if I added exercise in, Id see bigger losses. But this is still working better than anything else Ive ever tried.My biggest complaint is that after taking it for three weeks, I get very irritable and unmotivated while on it. When I first started taking it, I felt great, had tons of energy and felt unstoppable. But this is typical for amphetamine-based drugs  just want everyone to realize that those great feelings you got when you first started probably will not last. Just be weary of this and make sure youre getting exercise to combat the lethargy.

column9: Just wanted to say that I have been reading these reviews for a while now and have to say that everyone seems to be doing a good job on it.I however have been to 2 different doctors and they will not give me a script for it.Just b/c I'm not way overweight for my height does not mean I feel any less confident,big or anything else I feel emotionally b/c of my body at this time.Its hard.They just tell me Im not that much overweight.Thanks doc's but have tried losing weight and now Im at my heaviest.I'm 5'7 170lbs and keep gaining.Have tried W.W and other things and just want this as a boost for lifestyle change.So anywho,congrats to others who have had success.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: IT is great while used, but coming off is hard. I have never been so tired in my life. And as soo as you stop taking , weight comes back(some) because your system forget how to work. And I had hair loss.

column2: SuzyC, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've only taken this pill for 4 days, but so far I'm beyond thrilled with the results!  I'm 5'5 and have about 80lbs to lose.  In 4 days, I'm down 7lbs.  I fully expect this to loss rate to slow way down, but the initial loss has encouraged and inspired me.  The first day (37.5, whole dose), I had too much coffee and had a case of the jitters.  That wore off and became simply "energy." I felt fantastic all day long!  The first night, though, even after taking my usual OTC sleeping pill, I was WIDE awake until 4am.  I would have gotten up to scrub the house from top to bottom but I didn't want to wake anyone else up. I read a book, watched tv, and eventually fell asleep at 4.  At 8am my husband woke me up and the minute I sat up I was wide awake and ready to tackle the day. I felt so great all day, and I would normally have been dragging my tail in the worst way after only 4 hours of sleep. Night 2, I was up until about 2am, felt great day 3.  Night 3, I slept like a rock.  So if you're having initial sleep problems, please try to give your body a few days to adjust.My plan:  About 1200 calories a day, I track all food, exercise, and daily weigh-ins in my calendar so I can see what's working for me), exercise 4-5 days a week (20-30 minutes on treadmill right now, as I exercised NONE before, but will be increasing that), only water or black coffee as beverages, I'm limiting carbs to only whole grains and fruits, trying to eat tons of steamed veggies, staying away from fried foods and keeping proteins lean. I had slight dry mouth, but nothing sipping water can't fix. I don't just have energy, I'm in a really good mood, too!  I wouldn't say exercise is a joy, but it's SO much easier to do now with my energy and the results I'm seeing. My only worry is that my body will eventually adjust to Phen quickly and it won't work for me. We'll see!  Remember that this is only a tool, not a cure, and take advantage of this opportunity to reset your mind and your body. Good luck!

column9: weight 250 starting three months later 214.could have lost more weight in begaining when med worked stronger.doctor advised not to lose to fast.trouble sleeping and nervisness only lasted few days.feel great.i exersize at every opportunity.I eat low fat low carb calorie restricted diet five days a week and two (my weekend) i eat what ever i want.dry mouth contenues to be an issue i always chew gum.i also take a water pill and have had trouble with potassium being a little low.i believe i still have three months on program.my goal weight is 175..for now!!!!!!!

column2: amsnpo, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I can go to a restaurant and want to order all the fattening items.  :)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Someone else made this comment on 6/10/10:"any side effects after stopping, thought i got a bad bottle. never made me tired before.."I have been taking this off and on for about 3 years (after having babies).  I never had any side effects except dry mouth and mood swings.  I just got mine refilled 2 weeks ago and have since been having crazy skin problems (rash, dry patches), blurry vision, achy finger joints, severe gas, loss of ability to focus, and extreme munchies at night.  Again, I have never had any of these issues in the past 3 years.  I also was thinking it was a bad bottle because I've only had good experiences with phen.  Maybe there is an issue esp since this person posted this around the same time I got mine refilled...

column2: Peshu, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am in my 4th month of taking this drug, and have lost 30 pounds. Average loss has been about 2 lbs/week, which I am happy with; I hope the fairly slow rate will help me maintain weight once I'm off the drug.  I am 5'4" and my starting weight was 200 pounds.  I was reluctant to take any weight loss drug for a long time, but after menopause I started gaining weight and could not lose more than 5-10 pounds on my own.  I have had no side effects other than mild constipation from time to time. I do sometimes feel very hungry late afternoon, but can't eat nearly as much as I used to.  I've cut way back on portion size, which was my main problem because I eat healthy foods and don't snack.  That was hard for me to do before I started Phentermine, and I tried many times.  I've now trained my eyes and stomach to recognize what a healthy portion is, and I hope that will enable me to sustain the weight loss.  I would like to lose another 10-20 pounds.  I have not been exercising much, and plan to ramp that up to tone and to help lose the additional weight.  I may ask my doctor to prescribe half the dosage he has been giving me, to wean myself off it. My goal of 150 may sound heavy, but that will bring me down to a size 10, and I believe that is a weight I will be able to maintain.

column2: lily, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Hi everyone! I'm back. It's July 1st and I went to my Dr's appt. today and I lost 9lbs. Not bad for not being able to exercise these past 25 days since I broke my toe.  My starting weight was 197lbs on 6/2/10 and today my weight was 188lbs. My Dr. did however increase my dosage from 15mg to 30mg, not because I didn't loose enough but because I began feeling a bit more hungry towards the early evenings these last few days, so will see what that will do for me this month of July.  She did stress for me to try to exercise even if I have to limp so that is my challenge for this month. I will get back to everyone in the middle of August after my Dr's appt. and let you know what my new weight will be. Again crossing fingers!!!!

column2: loris, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i took this med 4 years ago and lost 50lbs in 6 weeks. and my house was really clean lol. you have to eat healthy, not starve yourself and exercise. and you need to realize that when you start working out, you will actually slow your weight loss or gain weight amd this is because muscle weigh more than fat, but when you build muscle, your body will continue to burn calories whn your not working out. all of the sudden the weight will drop. DO NOT cut out a food group. eat whole grains, it'll keep you full longer. wheat bread, oatmeal brown rice. lots of veggies and yogurt. watch fruit, its high in sugar and too much will make you fat. i kept weight off with no pills for 2 1/2 years and recently started again. weigh every day to remind yourself what your doing but dont go by your weight, go by your clothes. its more accurate. cheat once in awhile so u dont binge. black jelly beans are a natural appetite suppresent and will help along the way. good luck!

column2: PhenterPRO, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Phentermine for about 2 years now on/off.  Let me tell you, after the first time I took it I lost 50lbs in 3 months, I continued to take it for another 2 months but it became ineffective, I built a tolerance to it.  Once I stopped I gained 75lbs back. (Yes the 50 I lost +15lbs).  I started taking this again in March at 248lbs and I am 51  and in an effort to get the weight off quickly, I cut my calorie intake DRAMMATICALLY (1000/day).  Bad Idea.  I only lost about 5 lbs in a month.  You have to remember that you have to take in enough calories to get your body off of starvation mode so that your body does not store fat and exercise.  In the past month and a half I have actually increased my calorie intake to 1700 and noticed the weight dropping off.  I have lost 14lbs with a total of 19lbs since March.  I had my thyroid testing done yesterday because I am still very sluggish, the doctor said if everything comes out normal, he will put me on B-12 injections as well as the Phentermine.  I will update in 30 days.

column9: I could'nt wait to to write this review well i started this med 1mo ago today 5/12/10 i am so impressed i have never lost this much weight at one time. column2: mtbroadcaster, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started Phentermine on March 10, 2010.  Today is May 12, 2010.  As of date, I have lost 45 lbs in the last two months.  Using this drug along with exercise and a "lifestyle" change of food, has helped greatly.  I did gain 3 lbs one week because I wasn't listening to the pill and still eating even when I wasn't hungry.  This pill curbs hunger like you wouldn't believe.  Even though you forget to eat, need to make sure to get in your recommended daily caloric intake, mine is 1600-2000.  Going to low on the calorie side will result in the body storing the fat that you have so it can use it as energy, thus you're not loosing.  Changing your lifestyle and how you eat and workout is the most hardest thing I have ever done!  There are days that I could still go for that Double Quarter Pounder at McDonalds and trust me, I have failed and ate it all!  I'm looking at myself as we speak, thinking that I have lost motiviation to continue on this journey but reading others post on this topic has helped greatly.  Only side effect I have seen is an increase in blood pressure and becoming dizzy when standing.  Great drug in helping with this issue.

column2: Shug, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking Phen and B-12 shots on 4/27. My starting weight was 201 lbs. I am a female, 5' 10". Today, 4/30 I am 196. 5lbs in 3 days...I'll take it! BREAKFAST- slim fast or 2 eggs with 1 slice of whole wheat toast. SNACK-grapefruit, 12 green grapes, 2 plums, blueberries, strawberries, OR an apple. LUNCH-Smart One meal. I have cut out all sweets, only drink water, very minimum carbs (from the meal). DINNER- I am not really hungry, and if I do get hungry I eat more fruit or yogart. Or I have the option to eat 4oz of meat, 1/4 cup of veggies and 1/2 of salad. I DO NOT EAT AFTER 7pm. play the Wii for about 20 mins a day. I also have not smoked or had a drink since 4/27. Cutting Carbs, smoking, and wine at the same time...imagine that!! but seeing my belly shrink is well worth it. I will start getting B-12 shots weekly and hopefully I will be able to get Power Walking or the gym in very soon.

column2: ReclaimingMyLife, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm 26yrs old, 5'4, started at 170lbs in Feb'10 and lost 20lbs as of Apr'10. Diet and exercise habits were not drastically changed while on this medication. Smaller food portions were consumed during the day, which lead to increased hunger at night. Did experience anxiousness (similar to effect of caffeine) for first few hours after taking medication. Insomnia for first 2 nights. Also, noticed a slight increase of sweating. Appetite has been suppressed. Lighter foods, such as fruits, salads, and leaner meats, seem more appetizing than fattier counterparts of typical, Americanized, "convenient" foods. Energy was boosted, especially after losing 10lbs in the first 2 weeks. I still do not regularly and conventionally exercise as I find it highly boring. But I have increased the amount of physical effort I put into common daily activities, such as walking and lifting more at work (I am a diet aid and a waitress), scrubbing house floors instead of using an easy mop, washing dishes instead of using the dishwasher, push-mower instead of riding-mower, etc. This, in the past month, has increased the inches I lost as opposed to the weight I lost (for the past month I only have lost 5lbs, but have dropped 2 dress sizes), which is good because I know I am losing body fat and increasing lean muscle weight. Overall, this medication has given me the boost I needed for taking control of my physial health and nutrition. I am still on this medication and intend to lose another 15-20lbs.

column2: Che, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The last time I posted was on 2-17 and I had lost about 25 lbs by that time, after having started on 1-10. By 3-13 I was down 31 lbs from my original weight, 330. Since then I have lost another 10 lbs. A total loss of 40 lbs since starting this medicine. This is with exercising for about an hour a day, at least 4 days a week; eating low calorie/low fat meals; drinking at least 100 oz of water daily. This medicine has truly helped me in learning how to eat better. I rarely take the meds on weekends, mainly because I don't have a set schedule like I do during the week and I forget to take it, but yet I am still able to maintain how I eat on those days. I don't over do it. And I don't deprive myself of anything either, and that was a problem I would have in past diets. If I had to cut something out that I know I liked to eat, it wouldn't work for me because I'd always end up eating whatever it was. This pill has helped me to eat those so called bad things in moderation. So...it's like the best of both worlds for me. Good luck you all.

column9: There is not doubt as to whether or not this medication works. I lost 7 lbs in 6 days, however I have been very sick. column2: hopefulgirl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started Phen on 2-24-10 at 239 lbs. Am 48 and 5'8. Today 3-30-10 I am at 222 - about 17lbs gone.  All side effects gone.  The dry mouth was helping me to drink more water - now I have to remember on my own. Had cold feet at night but that's gone, too.  Some trouble sleeping the first two weeks but that is gone as well.  Working with my doc - seeing him every two weeks for monitoring.  It's really helped me to control cravings and suppress appetite.  Have more energy now.  want to lose 33 more lbs.  You still have to control old habits like overeating and eating the wrong things but I find it easier to make good food choices since the cravings for carbs are gone.  I don't deprive myself foods I like, just limit how much.  I'll keep trying and seeing the doc.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I am still considered overweight event at 136 lbs, but it's ok, I'll take this over that any day. Keep working hard, this time it really will pay off. Smile, think good thoughts, and know your not alone in this life long battle!

column2: pattiporter, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking this March 25th,10;starting weight 225lbs. I am 5'7"..I am 50 yrs. old.  It is March 29th, and I weighed this am 216.so a 9lb loss.  The side effects that I have experienced are dry mouth..I was a little jittery but that is passing...I am not hungry at all have to remember to eat...I take it at 6 am when I get up for work so by the time I get to work like 7am or so I drink a Atkins Advantage shake and also for lunch....this way I know I am having something....for supper consists of healthy picks..grd turkey,chicken, or a fish..veggies, & fruit...I don't come home now and binge eat like I did before..I do have more energy..I have to check in with my doctor a few days before my script runs out..as the company he is associated with doesnt allow a refill on in unless you see him...also he told me to that as soon as he writes the script for me to go get it that day as it is time sentitive my insurance wont cover it but it is cheaper than ALLI..cost 45.00 but a friend said she got it for 18.00 with Kmart Prescription Plan ? so I am going to check this out.  Just remember this is not a lifelong way of life ...to me it is a boost that I needed with getting back on track...just remember to drink your water and pick healthy choices...you will eat alot less...Good Luck and I hope this has helped you on making your choice..will let you know I am keeping a daily diary of how I feel and what i weighed and what I ate and I will be taking this to the doctor when I go to get my next refill...also try to put in some kind of exercising walking or get a DVD like lesile samsons Walking Away the Pounds...remember this will help with the weight loss also...I will keep you all posted on how I am doing ...maybe once a week.

column2: Sadi, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: workinit, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking this medication about a month ago. I have two more weeks left. I have already lost 20 lbs. I take the medication in the morning on the way to work. It seems to keep its "energy" effect for about 12 hours. You can time it accordingly. I take it at about 730am, so I'm able to start widing down and getting ready for bed by 8pm. If you take this pill too late in the day, you will not be able to sleep at night. There have been 2 weeks in which I skipped a Sunday (because I woke up too late to take it) and during those weeks, I didn't see as much weight loss as the other 2 weeks when I took it daily. I make sure that I'm watching what I'm eating and make sure that I eat atLEAST 3 meals/day. Rather than snacking througout the day, I've added a, light, fourth meal. I have breakfast early in the morning, lunch around noon, something light (like an egg sandwich) before the gym, and dinner when I come home from the gym. If I'm still hungry, I have a weight watchers ice cream bar or a sugar-free fudgesicle. You NEED TO WORK OUT while taking this pill. Your results will not be as drastic if you don't go to the gym and get your butt in gear! I do an hour of cardio a few times a week, plus some weight training. I don't have myself on a strict gym schedule, but I end up going 5-6 days/wk, anyway. This pill has helped me change my lifestyle. I now realize the difference between feeling full when you're really full & feeling full when you're snacking on "small things." I would reccommend this pill to anyone who is SERIOUS about losing weight and making a lifestyle change. I am aware that the weight will come right back if my habits did not change. I've taken the initiative to change, and it has worked for me!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The key to this medication is making sure you drink a lot of water. I find myself not liking to drink as much caffine drinks as I used to. I also have been making better choices on the amount of foods I intake as well as the types of foods I ingest. So far I have lost 15 lbs. and have been able to keep it off. Eventhough I haven't gone back to gym, due to working, but when I do will have no problem getting back to my ideal weight of 150.

column2: catdog12, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: annonymous, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking this medicine around the second week of Feb. I've lost about 15 pounds so far. I've noticed in the last two weeks that the amount i'm losing is slowing down but it seems better on days where I drink more water than normal. I do have some minor side effects mostly dry mouth and occasional constipation. I try to eat a fiber 1 bar everyday and that seems to help the issue. I occasionaly get a little jittery but I find it's only when I didn't have much of a breakfast at all and then took the medication. Overall I am very pleased, my energy is better, not as much as when I first started the medication but it's enough so that I exercise more and I think the medication keeps me more motivated because I actually see the weight come off; which keeps me wanting to work out and eat right. I would reccomend this to anyone who wants a little help to kick start their weight loss. Just remember it's only a tool and if you don't make a lifestyle change you will end up back where you were.

column2: Justjohn, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I only just started this med today so I cant describe side effects - none so far after five hours - or its effect on weight gain. But after reading many reviews I am concluding that the drug works differently for different people and a review is not a perfect indicator of whether you should take it or not.This is not a miracle drug. It is an appetite suppressant to help you get your eating under control and maybe make it easier for you to exercise.  I need to lose about 68lbs and am combining this with a very low calorie, high protein diet. In a couple of weeks I will add exercise. But its the whole package people and it has to change your lifestyle or it will do nothing for you in the long run.  Just saying.

column2: tiamaria, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It helped with my overweight,I was losing a pound daily by eating 3 meals a day 2 snack and exercising for 30 min and power walk for an hour.

column2: Gorgeous!!!, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking 37.5,mg in Sep '09.  I am 5'4' and weighed 250lbs. I weigh 210 lbs today. I exercise 5-6 days a week for at least an hour.  I have incorporated weight training to firm up, but the muscle is heavier than fat, so that also contributes to a slower weight loss. The weight loss slows down the longer you are on the medicine. My blood pressure is good.  I do experience the dry mouth, but I find that if I drink lots of water, it helps. It is somewhat frustrating when you do not lose as much as you do starting off, but I am pleased with the progress.  I plan to stay on the medicine to lose a total of 75 lbs.  My cholesterol, blood sugar and blood pressure are all really good, so even though it is not coming off as fast, the health benefits are great.  I am looking at possibly eliminating my diabetes medication very soon. The weight loss has made me a healthy person and I still have more to go.  I am very engergetic, and I do not sleep a lot (only 5 hours a night) but I did not sleep a lot before taking this medication.

column2: jww, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: this is the second time trying this medicine. after having my baby my thyroid got out of wack and i gained back what weight i had lost postpartum. the first week was great i didn't want to snack and had energy. after the first week i couldn't tell i had even taken it and i am having to stop after 1 month because i am burning up hot and sweaty all day after taking it. i lost about 5 lbs in 3 weeks with diet and exercise. i still need to lose at least 23 lbs just to be prepregnancy weight and that is still about 50 lbs over what i am supposed to be.

column2: HONEY, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I started taking phentermine 37.5mg pills on Feb. 22, 2010. I am 24, 5'1 and weigh 198 pounds my goal is to lose 45 pounds by May of this year. I took the pills before (the lower dosage) in 2009 for 2 months, I lost a total of 22 pounds then I stop taking them. While taking the pills the first time around as others mentioned I had large amounts of energy, so much to the point that I woke up 4am after going to bed at 1:30am and cleaned my place from top to bottom. This is now my third day taking the pills and along with the massive amounts of energy I have this urge to want to clean or work (just keep busy) I am not really sleeping well and I do have the dry mouth. I have yet to start exercising but will. I will say one thing I'm experiencing now that I didn't the last time I was on the pills are migraines the first and second day was horrible but today seems to be fine. I have yet to lose any weight as of yesterday but it is only my third day. What works for me is once I get up in the morning I eat breakfast, then take the pill no later then 9am that way if Im not hungry at least I had something. Shall keep you posted once a month on my progress. Much luck to everyone.

column2: Christina, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My doctor prescribed me Phentermine after my bloodwork reported a high cholesterol. After only 2 months, I've lost 23 pounds. The compliments I've received have encouraged me to exercise more and watch what I eat so I can get the most out of this prescription. The only side effects I've experienced are dizziness and dry mouth.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: 5'3, 147lbs.  I have been taking Phen for a little over a week and I have lost 9.5lbs.  I have a significant appitite decrease and an elevated amount of energy.  I am only looking to take off another 15-18lbs.Some of the negative effects are making yourself eat something.  I really have no feeling of hunger(which is the general idea, i suppose), so I make myself eat at least 3times a day.  I would hate to stop taking the medication, then start eating normally and gain it all back plus some.  So even if your not hungry its important to take in atleast 1200-1500 calories/day.  Also, I take two 37.5mg pills/day.  Once in the morning, after breakfast and the second around 2:30pm.  This allows me to have energy for the rest of the night and also stops the late night eating.

column2: losingfat, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started my 30mg pill a week ago today, I am down 8.2 pounds and fill fine. I do experience the dry mouth side affect but that forces me to drink more water. Will keep you posted.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: it has been over 2 years now and i have kept the weight off. i am only 5'1" and weighed 189lbs started this in nov 06 and by june 07 i was down to 114 lbs... i went off of it and kept my weight under 120... very pleased!!! super excited.....wishes everyone luck!

column2: Che, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I forgot to mention in my earlier post that the pill has also helped me develop better eating habits. It has actually changed my thought pattern when it comes to eating. I am now counting calories and fat grams and am consuming no more than what my doctor suggested. I am eating 5 small, low calorie meals a day. I've incorporated more fruit and vegetables in my diet. I'm eating way less sugar and salt than I used to. Before taking this, my eating habits were the total opposite of what I'm doing now. I'm actually satisfied with whatever I'm eating and I don't feel the need to go back for seconds and thirds or to pile my plate up with a lot of food. To me it has changed the way I view food and how to eat. By working in  accordance with it (meaning eating healthier and exercising) the medication has proven to be a very helpful tool in losing weight. HUGE tool.

column2: stanley , 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Due to obesity and encroaching age (62) my doctor suggested trying phentermine.  However, he gave no instructions concerning followthrough, and I have had to do my own research.  I have had a weight loss of 25 pounds in three or so months; very satisfactory.  However, shortness of breath is a problem.  Knowing its addictive effects, my concern is withdrawal in the future and possible weight re gain.  My diet consists largely of copious quantities of fruit and vegetables, lean meats, whole grains, and water.  This is all too easy.  I am praying for no serious long term detrimental effects or re bound weight return.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
amorales, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i have been on phentermine for over a 3-4 months now. imy first 2 weeks on the pill i lost 8 lbs. without trying, i started out 282 2 weeks later 274 and just last month i was 276, my dose was then increaded by my dr. will keep you posted of my weight on increased dose.

column2: Tish621, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: When I first started taking this pill, I weighed 255, in a matter of 2 months I was weighing 235, then another month went past and I weighed 217. A year has passed and I've gained it ALL back! I love the energy, and the low appetite, but the side effects of being extremely moody, feeling weird, little sleep and headaches are not worth it. I began a low cal diet and working out heavy on Jan 11,2010 and a month later I have lost 10 pounds the natural way. TRUST me it's easier to maintain when it's done without meds! But good luck to those who choose to stick with the "magic pill".

column2: Che, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking this medicine on 1-10-10 at 330lbs. I lost 10lbs. by 1-18-10, and that was taking half of a 37.5mg pill per day. It cut my appetite tremendously. Like many have said already, I found I was forcing myself to eat some days, especially in the first week. I didn't experience dry mouth, mainly because I am a big water drinker anyway. It gives me a lot more energy, it has cut my craving for sweets like nothing else! I work out for about an hour, at least 3 days a week. My workouts are a lot better than they used to be. I'm able to push myself a lot further than before. As of today, 2-15-10, I have lost 25lbs. I've begun taking a whole pill now and the only real issue I have is the lack of sleep. I find that sometimes I wake up much earlier than I'd like to and I have trouble getting back to sleep when I do. Other than that, this has helped me tremendously. It's amazing.

column2: AnjellyS., 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took phentermine for a few months in 2008/2009- My first exposure to it my side effects were more intense. The first pill I took made me so dizzy and loopy I had to lie down and make myself take a nap for a bit. The dizziness went away after a few pills. The pill was super effective for me in cutting appetite. I am more of a "grazer" and could nibble here and there rather than eat a meal- and this cut all of that out. . .Side effects for me- the worst was dry mouth- which I agree with another post, I hate drinking water but with this I actually liked water and drank it all the time. Also, the post that mentioned not sleeping much-I was never tired but always waking up super early no matter when I went to bed- minimal sleep. Other than that, headaches sometimes- that could also be from not eating very much. I worked out about 3-4 times a week and lost about 25lbs in about 3 months. Here is a BIG CAVEAT!- if you do not adjust your exercise, diet, lifestyle, etc. you will gain ALL the weight back upon stopping the pill. Any amount you eat- after not eating anything at all will make it harder for you to lose and/or maintain the weight. Expect to work diligently when you stop the pill. I ended up gaining all the weight back and then some. So after about a year, and gaining it all back- I started back today- I rated satisfaction lower because I gained the weight back- but then that's my own fault and I shouldn't expect a cure-all So hopefully this time will be better. . .Good luck!

column2: carebear, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking Phentermine on 1/26/10.  It was prescribed by my family physician.  I was rarely hungry (had to force myself to eat) and I had tons of energy.  I felt really, really good until the evening of 2/12/10.  I want to warn everyone that if you do not need to be on this (are not very overweight or obese), please be careful!  My husband had to call 911 on 2/12 and by the time the paramedics arrived at my house, my  heart rate was 170 (extremely dangerous) and I was dehydrated and malnourished.  While on this drug, I had been drinking a lot of water but the doctors stated that Phentermine dries a body out very fast.  It's kind-of like taking Speed.  Just please do your research before you start/continue taking this medication.  It may make you lose weight fast, but it's addicting, can cause heart problems, and there are other bad effects as well.  I felt on cloud nine for almost 3 weeks before the medication caught up to me and put me in the emergency room (transported by ambulance).

column2: oilmanintexas, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This drug should never be taken with alcohol.  I got "accidentally" got intoxicated with some friends at happy hour after taking my afternoon pill .  I experienced a mood swing like no other.  Extreme uncontrollable rage.  I ended up getting into a fight with a person and nearly killed him.  I do not suffer from depression/anxiety or any other mental issues.  I had not been in fight since high school.  I do not take any other medications.  Do not drink alcohol with this drug

column2: doctorofstyle, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: This stuff is the greatest thing since Penicillin.  Whoever came up with this should get the Nobel Prize in Medicine.  I've been blessed to have relatively few side effects. The worst thing about it was there was some sexual side effects for the first 7 days.  My wife and I joked that it was a preview of what I had to look forward to when I'm 70.  That "problem" vanished as soon as my body acclamated to the drug.  Again, wonderful medication.  Couldn't be happier.

column2: Pugsyann, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 33 and 5,5.  I started this drug 13 days ago and have went from 199.8 to 191.6.  A loss of 8.2 lbs.  Very dry mouth first day than has continued to get better.
