My appetite has decreased dramatically but I find that in the evening hours I am hungry.  Try to ignore it or drink a glass of 1% milk.  I try to eat around 1,200 calories a day.  Low fat and healthy food.  I would recommend this drug.

column2: 25-34 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

Would recommend something besides Phentermine.

column2: Gorgeous!!!, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This pill has worked well for me.  I started taking 37.5m in Sept '09 at 48yrs old and 250lbs and have lost as of today 31 lbs.  The weight loss slows down the longer that you are on the pill. I have had to increase my workouts to 4 days per wk mostly cardio.  I feel great. I did have some headaches and the dry mouth.  Try drinking more water and that has helped with both the headaches and dry mouth.  My doctor wants me down to 160lbs which will take me probably 6-7 mos.  I am fine with that because I am also learning new eating habits so that when I stop taking this pill I can sustain the weight loss. I have dropped two sizes and I have lots of energy.  I also have hired a personal trainer to help me with having effective workouts.  I intend to have the trainer for a couple of months.  I have been overweight most of my life and this pill has been truly helpful.  It will take me a while to get to my goal weight of 160-170lbs, but I am committed and I try to remember that I did not gain this weight over night, so I will not lose it over night!! Stay encouraged my friends, it is a journey and not a sprint!! As we all get healthier, it will be worth it.  Hope that this is helpful to some of you.

column2: Must loss it, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been experiencing headacks, bad heartburn, and floppy stomach

column2: stephanie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was presribed this Sept.08. My doctor told me I literaly had no metabolism. With this drug I lost 16 lbs. in 3 months then I had a death in the family and gained it all back. And I've discovered that as long as I exercise or do something active within an hour after I take it I don't get a headache, but if I take it and just sit around I get a headache and get dizzy.

column2: elbee, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: killian, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Phentermine October 1, 2009. As of today (1/13/10) I have lost 44 lbs. I have never had "bad" eating habits so this has been very east for me. The goal the doctor set for me was between 35 and 45 lbs. I am shooting for 50 lbs. just so I have a few to play with.

column2: Linda, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this drug for almost 2 months. I have not lost any weight as of today.I have experienced shortness of breath,fatigue and racing hearth.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took this medication for about three months and it has helped me lose 50lbs. In the beginning it made me have no appetite at all. Now I'm learning to control portions. Only side effects were: racing heart (2nd day) severe fatigue for one week, and dry mouth. Other than that It worked great for me!

column2: swanfish, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for about two months now and have lost over 20 pounds, which is about half of my initial goal. I struggled with binge eating and in the past have had success with losing a lot of weight, but always struggled to maintain. I find that it is important to address the behavior of eating and not depend on the medication to do the work. The medication, like many others is simply a TOOL to help you lose weight. You are the one that has to do the work. The medication does awesome with giving more energy and reducing any desire or cravings for junk. It was frustrating and overwhelming when I first started taking the medication due to not having any appetite; I had to plan my meals and snacks and make myself eat appropriate portions. The lightheadedness and feeling like you are going faint is in huge part to not eating enough. I work with a dietician and see my doctor every three weeks like clockwork to make sure that all is well. I journal everything that I eat, and like I said before, I plan out my meals based on what my body NEEDS for fuel and not what I want. I also set monthly fitness goals and currently go to the gym and attend yoga class three times per week. I don't agree with people taking the medication if they're just a little overweight, but definiately find it helpful and useful for people who are in the obese/morbidly obese category.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Under Dr. monthly follow ups and supervision, I have lost 65lbs. since Feb 09. I'm a 53yr old male that was weighing 265lbs in Feb 09, and as of Dec 09 I weigh 198lbs. I watch what I eat ( healthier foods, and REDUCED intake). There was a little adjustment period at the beginning, as the pill made me a little anxious, and jittery, but it subsided withing a few weeks.  At present I feel no side effects.  My goal is to get down to 180 lbs. I'm getting there!

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been using this med (generic) since Nov. 23rd, and have lost 20 lbs as of today. I don't crave beer, alcohol, or junk foods, and have dramatically improved my eating and food buying habits. If anything, I often have trouble forcing myself to eat 1800 cal/day. (I am also tracking everything on livestrong.com - check it out, its free and very helpful).I have found that dieting without exercise is not very effective for me, so I am re-committing to exercise and will quit making lame excuses for not doing it. Dosage: 1 tab early AM, 1/2 tab 8 hours later. Side effects: Dry mouth, BP controlled well with medication, I was jumpy and jittery at first, but not so much now, and I used to wake up at 3-4AM and not be able to go back to sleep. After consulting the doctor, I reduced my afternoon dose to 1/2 tablet, and am now sleeping through the night.  Since I started using this, it is a little more difficult for me to achieve/maintain an erection, don't know if this is related to the drug or something else (age or physical condition). Hoping it improves after I stop using the drug. I have a long way to go (another 50 pounds) but am feeling confident, energized, and focused on my goal. I will succeed. Having tried lots of different diet groups and plans, I find that this is much easier for me to manage.  I should also add that my spouse is very supportive and has contributed to my effort and success with her delicious, healthy meals. (She was a diet counselor at one time).  I also am getting lots of support from family, friends, and clients.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was 27 years old and 152 at 5foot2. Mother of 3 and wife. I was short and chunky my bust size had increased to 36DDDand about a size 12. I had what appeared to be acid reflux or ulcer. I had back pain stomach pain chest pain and depsson. I have tried a lot of other pills diets etc. I dont have the time or money to just devote 100% to a diet that would work for me. So, I went to my doctor. I been on the pills one a day for almost 6 months. I lost 25 pounds and its a lot for a short person:) I feel and look amazing. I havent had and of my prior medical problems. I havent even been depressed or felt the need to got back on prilosec. I always recommend this to friends.Prilosec turned me into a zombie. This has cured it along with everything else. (It is kind of hard in the first fiew weeks you start because of the side affects but they all went away. Im able to function normally. Wont just give you the runs and dehydrate you. This with exercise and water helps. Takes away the cravings. So you have a chance to learn healthy eating without feeling deprived.

column2: lfetsko@gmail.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: dawnie67, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Wonderful after I turned 40 had a hard time with weight loss gave me the boost and incentive I needed and now I'm maintaining my weight

column2: staceyxxrenee, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've went from 261 (June 09) to 222 (today Jan '10) and I love this medication. I have many of the side effects but nothing major. It helps with the appetite. I took Bontril for the first few months of my diet, and Phentermine worked 150% better/faster than Bontril. I plan to finish my goal of 100 pounds by July. I would recommend this pill to someone wanting to lose weight. But also remember, it's you losing the weight, let the pill help you, don't let it do it for you!

column2: Deviantgrrl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I love this treatment, because unlike with the rest of the overweight medication this one does not make you jittery, shaky or nervous.  I am able to function and deal with every day life.

column2: Mama2two, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: 200 lbs 5'8" female 35 yrs oldI love this drug. To make sure it works, you have to take it on an empty stomache. If you have dry mouth, you aren't getting enough fluids. If you have diareha, then you're eating too much sugar. If your heart is racing or feel jittery, cut your caffeine intake. This is my experience. My problem is my brain says eat and my body says NOT. Sometimes it is the other way. My body and brain are confused and want to stay fat. That's why we have a hard time losing weight. The pills help, but it's you that puts food in your mouth.

column2: crazykat123, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Phentermine has changed my life! I've lost 60 lbs in 6 months. I use the dry mouth side effect as motivation to drink well above the recommended 64 oz of water per day - I usually double that.  I also learned to watch my calories using The Daily Plate @ livestrong.com There are also motivational weight loss and fitness groups & members encourage each other in our journeys to health. I would suggest anyone check out livestrong.com to learn more about a healthier lifestyle.  I am no longer the lazy, boring person I was less than a year ago. I'm so glad to be starting this New Year as a new person! I started at 317 lbs and am down to 261 lbs. Size 24 jeans, needing size 26. I'm now in size 18 jeans, and plan to be into 16's by the end of January.  GOOD LUCK ON YOUR JOURNEY TO HEALTH!

column2: joannie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column9: I have been on this medication thru a local weight loss center for 4 weeks. I went for my first month check up and my blood pressure was great and only side effect besides being very thirsty all day is extra energy after I take my dose in the am. column2: Happily Thin, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I've been taking phentermine for almost 8 months and have lost approx. 100 lbs. I went from 249 lbs. to 150 lbs. My energy level has gone up significantly. I would recommend it to anyone that is struggling with weight and ofcourse, with the supervision of a weight specialist doctor.

column2: Toni, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: A friend who had lost 40 lbs told me that her Dr prescribed this and that it had been very helpful to her. A little personal/family history: Morbid obesity is a serious issue in my family. Both of my sisters (12-18 yrs older than me) have both had gastric bypass surgery as well as my oldest neice. My mother died morbidly obese. I have struggled with gaining and loosing weight for the past 10 years. I had all but given up as I was 5 lbs from my highest weight. I weighed in at the Dr.s office at 207 and my eating was out of control. I went to my Dr. to beg her for help. I asked her to prescibe an appetite suppressant and this is the drug she gave me.  She told me only 6 months and that I had to agree to exercise.  I told her I was completely out of control and needed help gaining control of my eating.  I was as desperate as an alcoholic!  I asked how effective I could expect it to be, she told me that the medicine was very successful, but that once it was stopped typically the weight comes back on.  I have to say the first day I took the medicine I could not believe how effective it was. Dr told me to take 1/2 a pill. I did, it didn't seem to work, but a whole pill worked so well that I ate because I had to, not because I was hungry. I ate VERY healthy and kept to the basics Protien, whole grain Carbs, Veggies/Fruit, good fat. I did as my doctor told me and I started exercising as well. Side effects that were annoying, but servivable EXTREME dry mouth and hard time falling asleep at night (taking it early made it better, but didn't solve the problem). I made one REALLY important decision: I decided that I would only take it until I got control of my eating and then I would only use it when I really felt I needed it.  This was the BEST decision I made. I took it for about 1 month then only for PMS going to a party etc I have now stopped even taking it for that. The last pill was Thanksgiving. The best part: I survived Christmas on my own and still lost. I now am 155 lb

column2: Purple Leopard, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm obese not overweight. In less than 1 week of taking this med I can say that I don't feel any negative side effects at all. If anything, I have to remember to eat! I've warmed up food or served myself, take a few bites and then go off to do something else.  Up to 1 hour later I remember that I left my food somewhere! I hope this continues. I tend to eat out of boredom or stress. I'm a teacher (stress) but enjoying the 2 week break. Maybe because of that I'm relaxed, etc. I naturally drink a lot of water because of my allergies and love to take naps. However, my 3-4 hour "naps" have turned into 1 to 1.5 hr naps!! Reading about 100 posted comments has been like having a support system at my fingertips.  I've been curios about the lapband but have a friend who did it and has only lost 16 lbs. in 16 mos. Hello?! She says its because she can't eat as much but does eat as much as she can of something BAD and fattening. Just weighed in at 237 lbs. I'd be ecstatic to weigh 155 again and be size 14 with no flab hanging out. I'm hoping to get a huge jumpstart to my weight loss by taking Phentermine every morning.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I lost 17 lbs in first month.  Could never stay on diet, would excerise 2 hrs a day and would either stay the same and eventually fail and put on more weight.Phen has killed my carvings.  My idea of a diet was to drink diet soda all day skip meals, then blow it with a huge dinner and binge on sweets after dinner.  Would also wake up in the middle of the night and binge on sweets. I have also started taking St John Wort which has improved my mental attitude and I feel very encouraged with my diet.  The only draw back is that I have experienced some Constipation.  My Doctor told me that I must drink more water.  My goal is to lose antoher 25 lbs, hoping can do it in another 2 months.  Phen is great,killed my cravings and allowed me to stay on diet, instead of all the yo-yoing I had been doing

I am dissappointed, since it worked really well while I was on it.  Lost 27 lbs and of course it was pretty much predictable that I would gain the weight back after stopping the use of the medication for a while.

column2: lil mama, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I love Phentermine, back in 2007 I started taking it in January weighing 232 lbs.-by June of that year I weighed 169.  It was a real help to me.  I did walk and do exercise videos too though.  I started back on this med about 3 weeks ago because I had a baby in September and gained all my weight back, since starting back I have all ready lost 7 lbs.--starting 216 to today 209, so I am a real believer in this med, yes I've had constipation, dry mouth, and some irritability, but to me that is a very small price to pay for the long term outcome...I feel so much better when I weigh 170 than 230!!  It's not for everyone though, I work in a MD's office as a medical assistant and I have seen some negative side effects--at my office we actually have all pt.'s who want this med have an EKG first as a screening to rule out heart irregularity because Phentermine does increase your heart rate.  For most, this drug is completely safe and effective, but as with everything else, it's definitely not for everyone.

column2: bagjam, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a baby at 38 years and it seemed impossible to lose the weight.  I would lose 10 gain 5, etc.  I have been using phentermine for 6 weeks.  In the 6 weeks since I started I have lost 18 pounds.  I have maintained a diet of approx 1,000 to 1,200 calories daily and also an exercise regimen of 9 - 12 miles weekly as well. Side effects are slight headaches at times, insomnia or difficulty staying asleep, but a small price to pay for the results I am seeing.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this medication has caused the following side effects for me: Insomnia,difficult urination,constipation,dry mouth

column2: Loving the new me!!!, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking phentermine in 09/20/09 and I weighed 250 lbs; after 2mos I have lost 24 lbs! I exercise 2-3 days per week. I plan to increase my exercise after reading some of the comments.  The only side affect that I have is dry mouth.  I was hesitant about taking a diet pill, however, my dr is monitoring my blood pressure closely and it has been fine.  I am also diabetic and just recently took my AIC and I am waiting for results, but my glucose numbers have been much better.  This drug has been a blessing to me. I am making smarter choices in food selection and the portion sizes have been reduced greatly.  With the weight loss, I feel better and I know that I am healthier.  I have a long way to go but I thank those you for your encouragement and candor.  I am going to increase my exercise to five days a week.  This has been a great drug for me.  It has given me the stamina to make better food choices and I know that this is indeed a life style change.  I have skipped the meds a couple of times to see if my appetite would reappear and if I would gain the weight back and I did not. Stay encouraged, this drug has worked for me and I intend to stay on it until I reach my goal, which is around 170lbs.  Be encouraged and hang in there if it is not working as well as you would like.

column9: I actually started on this medication in Nov 08 and I have been taking it off and on since then. column2: Purezone09, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started taking this pill 6/15/09 and started with one 37.5 pill a day. I took it in the morning at 6am at 7am I would eat lite breakfast of 400 calories and do a cardio tape for 45 mins. I would eat a lowfat 1200 calorie diet cut out pop, fast food, and I didn't eat fried anything. for snack I eat cheese stick, fruit, or 20 dry almonds. lost 40 pounds first 3 months. My appetite was fine but my energy was low so my doctor let me go up a half that I would take at 2pm. I have lost 65 pounds now and I workout only 4 days a week now. my only side effects were dry mouth(lots a lots of water) first 2 months then I started to sweat alot no matter what I would do(hated this it was embarrassing). And when I would miss a day I noticed that I would get the worst headache and when I would take the pill it would go away in about 1/2hr.So don't give up just tweek your diet and your times and it will work for you. You cant eat what you want and just sit on your butt it wont work then. Good Luck(pls consult you Dr.before increasing your pill your BP will have to be closely watched)

column2: fatboy, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given a 30 dose prescription (1/day for 30 days). First 5 or 6 days took a bit to get used to my heart feeling like it was going to jump out of my chest, but after that, i really didn't even notice it... it works as advertised. I combined my adipex with a 1000 calorie diet (i averaged around 1100 or 1200 cals a day) with less than 30 grams of fat per day. I also ran/jogged 3 days a week & got on a pushup/situp plan 3 days a week. I lost 20 lbs over the 29 days that i took Adipex and it was VERY easy to only eat 1000cals/day once u get used to actually counting the calories and the fat. Now, the one thing i had a problem with was day 29. I had to work through lunch with NOTHING to eat. By the time i finally found a nutrigrain bar at around 2, i was very light headed. Got home & started to prepare dinner, and experienced fairly substantial chest pains just left of center of my chest (assuming heart) and a TERRIBLE headache that lasted for nearly 2 days. I drank lots of gatorade thinking it might be dehydration related, ate a GOOD meal that night and the next day as well, and it eventually all subsided, but i decided against taking my 30th dose just as a precaution.  Overall, VERY excited about the results of Adipex, AND the motivation that came with seeing the almost DAILY losses on the scale.

column2: brownqueen, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: Phentermine has helped me to jump start my weight loss.  It is not a cure, but I have found that I use it for about a month, then have weaned myself to a half pill a day, to none, you can't use it forever! I have also found that when I started eating no more than 2 "white" carbs a day, I also started losing.  I eat between 1000-1500 cal/day, depending on my appetite. I don't starvr myself because I love food.  The only side effect from it I have seen is constipation & gas, which lowered with a half 37.5 mg pill. Also, I drink plenty of water & exercise 4-5 x week!!  I losing 4-6 lbs a month, mostly on my own.  My goal weight is 150-160 lbs. I have been overweight all my life, though I did lose weight when I was 18, but got pregnant!  This time, I hope to keep it of!!

column2: y2katielou, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have battled with losing and gaining weight over the past 4 years.  I got engaged last November at my heaviest ever...163.  I started a rigorous exercise routine for the 1st time in my life (5 days a week) and cut my calories down.  I also live more or less by the South Beach way of eating.  However, after 7 months of this, I was stuck at only 11 lbs. lost.  I started taking this drug in August and have lost 10.5 lbs. since then (with a 2-week hiatus due to wisdom teeth surgery).  I only had side effects for about 3 days.  Now I feel normal.  It's like that part of my brain that is constantly telling me to eat has just been turned off.  I eat three meals per day, but have zero cravings in between meals.  My incessant chocolate and dessert cravings are gone with this drug.  I currently weigh 142 lbs. at 5'2" with only 6 weeks left until my wedding.  I am hoping to get down to a healthy 130 in the next 2 months by going back to hitting the gym pretty hard.  I am also confident in the fact that once I get to my goal weight, I know I can maintain due to the fact that I now work out regularly.  Good luck everyone!

column2: Aurora, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
losing it!, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking half a 37.5 mg pill everyday before lunch on 9/9/09.  Today, 14 days later, I have lost 15 pounds.  I started large at 242 and am down to 227 - i know the bigger you are, the faster the first pounds come off, so I expect to see my loss taper off.  However, I am very pleased.  I do have dry month alot, so I'm drinking lots of water, which also means lots of potty breaks.  I got the sweats the first few days, but those seem to have went away now.  I have more energy, but still sleep well at night.  My doctor has advised me not to start any exercising other than normal daily activity until the end of week 3, she said that will help prevent a plateau of the weight loss.  Also, I can bump up to a whole pill a day if the half dose starts to lose affectiveness.  I also only eat 800-1000 calories a day, I'm not hungry and I get much fuller feeling quicker.  However, I have changed my eating habits and I am eating whole grains and lots of fiber, so that might have something to do with it to.  I don't like having to cut the pills in half, it seems I can never get it right down the middle, so I am convinced some days my dosage is stronger than others.  Otherwise, I'm happy with the progress so far and I would recommend phentermine to anyone who had a large amount of weight to lose.

column2: clou79, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am currently in my second week of taking this medication (37.5mg pill taken in the morning).  I went to my doctor seeking prescription weight loss pills due to the extra 30 pounds I was hanging on to after have my two boys back to back (17 months and 2 months).  I started the pill on Sept 12, 2009 and in 1 week I lost 5 pounds.  I haven't been exercising and wish I had the time to do so.  I have cut soda out of my diet and usually make myself eat a little.  I am probably eating less then a 1000 calories a day.  The only side affects I have experienced (and the get better as the day progresses) is sweating and the feeling of being a little jittery.  Other then that, nothing.  It hasn't given me the energy everyone else has seem to get, but I am up at all hours of the night with my 2 month old.  I am hoping to lose the 30 pounds in 2 months.  My beginning weight was 174.6lbs and I am hoping to return to my pre-pregnancy weight of 145lbs.  Good luck to everyone.

column2: Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Phentermine has been a true blessing to me.  I took my first 37.5 mg pill on Wednesday, September 9, 2009.  That morning I weighed 234.4 lbs.  Now, less than 12 days later, I am down to 125.6 lbs.  I cannot believe I have lost 9 pounds in less than 12 days!I've experienced virtually no side effects.  The first day I took Phentermine, I tried to lay down and take a nap in the late afternoon.  Obviously, that didn't happen.  My thoughts were racing and although I felt relaxed, I was never able to fall asleep.  However, I had no trouble sleeping that night at bedtime, which was what was really important.Other than that, the only side effect I've experienced is mild dry mouth.  In fact, I wouldn't even go so far as to say it's dry mouth...more of just a general thirst at random times throughout the day. In terms of effectiveness, I'm very rarely hungry.  I've been eating less than 900 calories on most days, not because I'm trying to, but because when I do eat I become full after only half a meal.  When I was reading reviews for Phentermine before starting it, I would read people say "I had to remind myself to eat!" or "I had literally no cravings!" and thought to myself "Yeah right...that would NEVER happen to me in a million years."  I've always been a member of the "Clean Plate Club."  I always got annoyed when I had to share my food and was constantly thinking about when my next meal would be.  It's no wonder I weighed 234 pounds, right?!  However, with Phentermine my habits have totally changed.  I love to share my food now and am practically never thinking about my next meal.  Let's hope I can keep this up for the next two and a half months and keep the weight off after that!

column2: 195lbs-here-i-come**, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: **195lbs-here-i-come**, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is my first time every taking any type of weight loss drug so I knew there were different side effect trying any type of diet pill.. But I know that I have to eat or I will get light headed.Phen helps me use portion control I eat half of my food now sometimes I don't even finish the old me would eat my plate and go back for 2nd and 3rds.The only side effects that I have noticed is the headaches that only happened a couple of times the first week, my breathing has been fine but one day I noticed I would take a deep breath here and there so I took myself off of the pill for 4days to give my body a break and then I got back on. For the dry mouth I chew Sugar free gum and water, water, water.. I take my pill in the morning so I never experienced the sleep problem. I did alot of research on Phen before taking it and I'm glad my Dr. choice this for me it's helping alot. My goal is to loose 60+ lbs by Jan and it's possible with Phen, exercise,portion control, and most of all "Discipline".. If you are in desprate need to lose weight like I was give Phen a try it will help you out and you will feel better about yourself once you see those numbers drop on the scale.For those of you who have been on Phen for a while how long do you recommend for someone to stay on the pill??

column2: missle1, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I read a few of these reviews where people were getting dry mouth as a side effect and getting bad breath. I go to school for dental hygiene and I thought maybe I could suggest some information that would help a few people with this problem. I am also taking this medication and experiencing the dry mouth. The bad breath is from bacteria because there is not as much saliva being produced in your mouth to remove or neutralize the acid. There is bacteria in your mouth and when you eat, the bacteria and the sugars combine and create an acid. There is an "acid attack" in your mouth after everytime you eat or drink(besides water). It takes approx. 20 min. for saliva to neuralize an acid attack. With out as much saliva in your mouth it has a harder time neutralizing the acid which in turn there is more bacteria causing the bad breath. Some things that can help are sipping on water, biotene which is a product that helps lubricate/moisten the mouth(can be found at retail stores). Another thing you can do is chew SUGAR FREE gum with an ingredient called xylitol in it for about 5-10min after everytime you eat. The xylitol should be listed in the first three ingredients (gum that has xylitol examples: icebreakers cubes and trident but check the label there are other brands with it as well). Chewing gum with xylitol helps produce more saliva and neutrelizes the acid quicker than 20min. which reduces the bacteria. Xylitol also reduces plaque and tarter which in return helps reduce the chance of cavities. This along with good oral hygiene(brushing 2X's per day for 2 minutes each time and flossing 1X per day). I hope this helps.

column2: Life, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have taken phentermine off and on over the years.  While on this drug life is good.  I have tons of energy (a spotless house, laundry finished etc.), a very decreased appetite, and I fill full much more rapidly.  I lose weight very quickly with this medication.  The first time I took them I was on the prescription medication Effexor.  I do not recommend mixing the two.  I developed an eating disorder.  I literally would count every calorie that entered my body.  I was eating around 400 cals per day.  Not good!  I also developed severe mood swings.I am currently taking phen. and not effexor.  I started my pills on Friday, and I have already lost 6 pounds.  This is a very large amount of weight in a very short time.  It is not healthy, but being overweight is not healthy either.  One of the main things I can tell people that are starting this drug is: develop good habits.  This drug gives me more energy and willpower to eat better and exercise more.  Once you stop taking this medication keep these good habits.  I lost fifty pounds the first go around with the pills.  I went right back to my old habits and gained every bit of it back plus 10 more pounds!  This drug isn't an obesity cure, it is a diet aide and should be treated as such.

column2: milleg92, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I began taking Phentermine, 1 pill a day as of June 2nd 2009. I was 5'4 198.4 lbs and now it is July 16th and I am 178.4 lbs. The first two days made me shakey but I do not do well with caffiene so my body took a few days to adjust. I did adjust and now all I notice is loss of appetite, daily constipation (which is cured with a laxative on occation), and dry mouth. The dry mouth is good because it encourages you to drink water.  I have been eating healthy, around 1200-1500 calories a day, and most times have to force myself to eat.  I have tried Weight Watchers, and am using that knowledge and the appetite supressiveness of Phentermine together. I have not worked out yet, but I plan to in the future. I recommend this highly, but you must see a doctor regularly. Only weightloss doctors recommend this and it is not covered by most insurances. The cost is about $35 per month for a 30 day supply. To me, it is worth it. I am lighter and much happier.  I am losing about 2 lbs a week now (with most of my weightloss being water weight in the begining).  I do not recommend buying this online without a prescription because you need to be monitored while on this drug.  Also you could get fake medicine online. Good luck to all!

column2: Stacy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Hello all phentermine enthusiasts :)  I am on my 4th week taking the 37.5 dosage.  Prior to going to the doctor I set my mind that I was going to make a serious life change.  I have had tremendous amount of energy, feel productive/non-lazy, and for the most part have felt great.  I have lost about 12 pounds so far.  At first, I felt nauseated all day.  I have found that if I eat 1 cracker right before I take the pill I have no nausea.  I have been walking/jogging 4-5 miles 4 times a week.  My only problem that I have experienced (if you want to call it a problem) is that I don't have a desire to eat and can go all day without eating.  When I finally make myself eat I feel like my heart is going crazy.  The pill has not made me irritable but makes me cry when I'm emotional.  I highly recommend the LoseIt application for those with iPhones, it has made a huge difference for me ...otherwise I'm not accountable for what I eat.  I eat between 800-1100 calories.  Best of luck to all!  LOSE WEIGHT, FEEL GREAT!!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking it for 8 weeks now and I am down 17 pounds. I am very happy with the way it's been working, becasue it isnt happening too fast, but I along with others notice the weight loss. I'm a little over 5'2, not quite 5'3 and was weighing 152 which was the most I ever weighed.  I was unhappy with the way I looked and none of my clothes fit so i thought I'd give it a try. I completley stepped up my workout game from going when I could squeeze it in, to making it a priority and taking cardio and weight toning classes about 4 or 5 times a week.  I actually ejoy working out now, which I never did before. I also, have changed my eating habits, and portion control is a BIG thing. I weigh my food (meats, chicken) and load up with salad and veggies. I really don't miss eating until I'm bloated. These meds help me not to be starving and to push my plate away when I am comfortable.  I was a big sweet eater, and I really don't miss it, I treat myself to a half a cup of frozen yogurt each night and at around 3:00 I eat an Atkins Advantage bar. They are awesome, chocolate and totally take the edge off of my sweet craving and fills me up.  No bad side effects what so ever. I want to lose 10 more pounds, so hoping to wean off it in another 8 weeks.

column2: mary, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started phentermine on 5-11-09 as of 6-24-09 have lost 14lbs. If you want ot keep the weight off you have to change your eating habits and get exercise.I'm not talking about becoming a work-out fanatic, just good old-fashion get off the couch AND MOVE kinda exercise.

column2: Tam I am, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking phentermine in late Feb. '09, and the results have been amazing.  When taking this medication, I don't constantly think about food and snacks.  I have lost 43 pounds, averaging 10 pounds per month.  It is important to note, though, that my success is not due solely to the drug.  I have completely changed my lifestyle to eating very healthy (lots of fruits and vegetables and healthy meats/proteins).  I joined a women's gym and work out 3 to 5 times a week, and actually enjoy it, which I never thought I'd see the day on that one.  I am on 37.5 mg dosage, but I have recently started cutting the pills in half because I don't want to be dependent on them forever.  I just have a few more pounds to go to reach my goal, and then I will stop taking them.  I am going to keep them on hand, though, for times that I feel like I'm starting to slip back into my old "bad habits."  Side effects that I have personally experienced are dry mouth, which makes me drink much more water (a good thing) and I had trouble sleeping for the first 30 days.

column9: heads up !!!! as i promised y'all i went fr my first month weigh in , lost 12 lbs in a month . i feel good and just filled up my 2nd presc . the doc wants me to take it fr another month then reduce me to probably 15 or 30 mg , besides dry mouth , feeling hot and have noticed too ( bad breath ) sometimes . the doc explained that because saliva washes down bacteria in our mouths , the drying effects of the medication can cause bad breath . so fr anyone taking phen , just pay attention to oral care . one funny thing is my husband is happy not because im losing weight ,,,,,, its because im losing the fights . i am always the one to say the last word and always talking . now with the dry mouth sometimes if i talk too much , my tongue will just stick to the top of my mouth and that will make me shut up for a while . yeah the dryness is no joke . good luck guys !!! will post again after 7/23/09 .

column2: Golfgoumba, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 44 old male, 5'9", I started this drug on 2/1/09 at 280lbs, as I write this email on 6/19/09 I am at 225lbs. The first 60 days I would take the pill every day at about 11am and it work fine, the first week I was slight jump but after that I felt fine. I basically kept my calorie intake to about 1500 calories but no bread or pasta for the first couple months. I lost 30lbs the first month!! The last two months I dont take the pill every day, usually not on weekends because I am so active. I have slowly added pasta and bread back into my diet. The Omega 3 wheat grain pasta from barilla is great!! So the last 4 months I have lost 25lbs. During that time I went on 2 week vacations and I have kept it off so far! I want to try and lose another 25lbs but I am going have to work out more I think to get there. The only thing that sucks so far is I am buying NEW clothes, I am loving the new clothes but my wallet is taking a hit. BUT ITS worth it!! Good Luck to everyone!!

column2: celestejane, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Just started this med about 2 wks ago and I can tell an instant change the first day.  OMG! Lots of energy!  The problems I started having was having extremely dry mouth, slight irritability and headaches. I can tell I lost some weight, but haven't been back to the doctor yet (have 2 more weeks to go).  Doc said to be careful and to monitor your blood pressure because it can increase blood pressure. I'm on 37.5 mg, but going to have to halve the pill because I think it's too strong. My appetite has decreased tremendously, but I eat just because I should.  I think this pill will work, but you should monitor yourself and notice any side effects, if any.  Listen to your body and report anything unusual.  Stay safe.

column2: Ashley , 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I feel like I should be losing more. I completely changed my eating habbits. I only eat 1,300 calories a day. I work out 4+ times a week. I dont know if taking the whole 37.5 pill in the morning would make a difference...? I just feel like I'm not doing something right. I dont have any symptoms anymore. I still have very little appetite though. Any suggestoins?

column2: Linnea, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I lost 20 lbs on Phentermine two years ago. I gained 10 back, so dr. was willing to give me another one month prescription. However, when I took the first 37.5 pill, I felt weird and hyper, something I hadn't experienced when I was 174. So, I cut them in half, and taking 1/2 dose is much better if you're at a lower weight. It's the only med that works on your brain so you just plain aren't hungry. You must change your habits when you go off, or you will gain it all back. Eating is habit since you will not want to eat on Phentermine

column2: cab, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: 59 y.o. - slightly overwt. all my life.  Sick & lost over 20# and kept off for 4 yrs.  Gained all + some back.  Begged Doc & got & tried the pill.  Started 15mg 3/29/09, increased to 30mg 5/09 - only lost 2-3#.  Debating if worth the $$.

column2: kfarris23429, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this for 5 weeks and have lost 16 lbs.  Some would say it is a slow weight-loss, but I am satisfied with how it's going for now.  I take 1/2 a pill at 10 am and 1/2 at 4 pm because a whole one seems to lead to a Ms. Cranky-pants situation.  I also count my calories on livestrong.com, which is important because it's not healthy to get below 1200 cals a day which leads to 'starvation mode'.  We should all be doing this the healthy way, don't abuse this drug, let it help you do what you need to do!

column2: cocoa, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Am responding to the person who reported feeling HOT , OMG i am burning up . im always the one complaining about being cold but since being on the pill , i feel so hot and sweat a lot especially 3 hrs after taking it . this doesnt bother me . i'd rather be skinny & sweaty that be fat and miserable .i didnt think anything of it until i figured out when the "hotness " started . it was exactly 2 weeks , the same time i started on the pill . i love the pill ,its working for me and its unbelievable . i am going for my 1st(month) check up on the 23rd and i cant wait . i dont believe what my scale is telling me so i will post my results after my official weigh in .Good luck to everyone !!!

column2: GagesMom2, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: About two and a half years ago I managed to lose 53 pounds on my own with diet and exercise.  Over the last year the weight started creeping back after a dramatic change in living situation, loss of my father, etc.  I went back to what I had done before and, alas, it wasn't working this time.   Upon the recommendation of several friends I joined a diet program, including a prescription for the (Adipex) Phentermine. Though at first I did experience the usual side effects of jitters, racing heart (couple of days of fluttering) and difficulty focusing I stuck with it and finally the side effects levelled out. I have lost 34 pounds in 10 weeks and have become re-accustomed to smaller, more frequent meals and a moderate exercise routine, going from a size 14 to a petite 4. However, remember that this is short-term and meant only to jump-start a lifestyle change that includes permanent changes in attitude towards food and exercise.  After just 8 weeks I reached my goal weight and was "graduated" from the diet program I had enlisted in.    By all means, if is deemed safe for you to do so, try Phentermine if all else fails.  However, take advantage of your time with this drug to learn to moderate your eating habits and exercise so that, when it's not available to you, you will still have good habits to fall back on.

column2: 25-34 Female  (Patient)

column2: sweetie_85, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: In response to weightlossfriend...I too have that same problem.  I found drinking apple juice helps with the constipation.  Let me know if it works for you! It's usually yogurt, Special K, or oatmeal in the morning, a 90 calorie snack pack for a snack, and a salad with chicken and cottage cheese for lunch.  It seems the weight loss is starting to slow down, but I'm still optimistic.  I haven't made it to 1 month yet so we'll see!

column2: weightlossfriend, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Hello.  I have been on this medication since 04/30/09.  As of today I have lost 13 pounds total.  I was really excited the first month because I lost 10 pounds.  But this second month on this pill is coming off really slow!  I increased my amount of excercise to 35-40 minutes per day.  I also so a lot of ab work and cardio/walking.  I watch what I eat and I have decreased my carbs to at least cereal in the morning.  My major issue is the constipation...I drink tons of water.  My doctor told me last month to take Miralax daily and it helped but I found no matter what I did I could not lose weight.  So I finally quite taking that last week and I have lost 4 pounds.  Does anybody have any ideas how to rid yourself of the constipation?  I really don't want to get laxative dependent!  Thanks.  Also, how are some of you losing 18 pounds in a month...do you eat at all?

column2: Bill, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: My doc has prescribed this med for me to assist is weight loss with the boost of metabolism. He has always had me on the lowest dose, once a day. I was 5'11" 295 and now as low as 211, now away from the gym I stay at 214 and still eat well balanced meals. It has been great for me. Although, there is a lot of bad info out there coming from some doc's. I guess I would rather take the chance at some minor side effects than be severely obese with many medical problems caused by being severely over weight.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column9: I have had a great experience so far.  I first took the pill May 27, 2009 weighing about 173 at 5'9.  Today I weigh 158.  It's been very effective.  I have been eating quite a bit less, while still maintaining a healthy diet.  But, I have a question for the females taking this medication.  It's that time of the month and I feel like I am eating more than I have since I started the pill.  For the first time in 2 weeks I have eaten every meal and finished my plate!  I'm hoping the pill hasn't stopped working and it is just my hormones. lol Any other females experience this?

column2: 2boys4me, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I went to the doctor after seeing an ad for weight loss and he started me on 30 MG on May 13. I went back a week later to the doc and lost 5 pounds. I was excited! I was not very hungry, but towards the late afternoon, I would feel a little hungry.  When I went to him the 2nd week (he requires the first 2 visits a week apart, after that it can be anywhere from 3-5 weeks, plus you get the meds right from him in the office included with the visit price)he increased me to 37.5 MG and another 8 MG to take around 4:00.  This takes the edge off so I don't over eat at dinner.  The only side effect I have had so far is some nights I wake up and I'm wide awake for a little bit, but I have always dealth with insomnia issues, so not sure if it is related. So I am 4 weeks into it and based on my scale I have lost 12 poounds in a month. I have always exercised and for the most part eat healthy but now in my late 30's just kept gaining. I inceased the intensity of my workouts, and am really eating good (no more bar food!) and I feel great. My goal was to lose 30 pounds. I'm 5'2 and was 152 which was my heaviest I have ever been.  I have been as light as 105 (way too thin) when the kids were younger and I was always running after them, working full time, but now they are older and so am I (39)so I needed a boost, to get me motivated and it;s working.  I am just hoping to get to get to 120-125 and which would be about another 15-18 pounds and then wean off the medicine and continue my better habits. That is the major part of my weight gain, is I started picking up bad eating habits, so i needed to get back on track.  I will have my offcial weigh in tomorrow and update, but I'm happy with the 12 lost so far in 4 weeks!

column2: phnetermine, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I start on Phentermine about 2 years ago.  The first 3 months I took it I lost 10 lbs a month.  You have to really want to lose weight, but if you do, this really helps!The next issue is keeping it off without taking this drug too long, as it eventually will not work for you and or you could become dependent on it.  So my doctor has allowed me to get 1 30 day rx about 3 times a year, maximum.  This works for me like a on going maintenance.  I do not take one everyday but make the rx last 3 months or longer.  But I manage to keep the weight down!  That is major for my health and self esteem.  Good luck to you guys, it is great if you respect it and work with it.

column2: dfp0124, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: hi.. i'm  a 35 yr old mother of 3 & it has been extremely hard for me to lose weight. i've tried just about every diet out there...NOTHING has ever worked . well about 3 months ago a friend of mine suggested i try phentermine... i know they say there's no such thing as a magic pill but phentermine has been for me! i lost 44 pounds in 3 months time. i have not experienced any of those side effects i read about. i couldn't be more excited. i feel better than i have in a very long time. i have so much energy now i can keep up with my kids, & still exercise at least 1 hour a day. it's great. but i heard that you can't take this pill longterm & i'm so scared that i will come crashing down when i stop taking this medication & gain all the weight back.Good Luck to all of you!!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking this medication just a little under a month ago and I have lost 10 pounds so far. I was gaining weight and I was the heaviest I had ever been. I love this pill and I am so glad I started it.

column2: Sparkle56, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Started taking 30mg 2 days ago and besides a small headache! I am feeling great, lots of energy, decreased appetite and other than that no other side affects. I am already weighing in at 204 3 days later!  Good Luck to all!!!

column2: me, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on the 30mg once a day dose and it worked like a charm, I dropped 13 lbs in 2 weeks and it gave me the energy and motivation i needed to get into a good exercise program but i stopped taking it for a while so that my body wouldnt get dependent on it and that went well I decided to take it again now after a surgery that had me stuck in bed for a few weeks and this time around i have no energy at all in fact it seems to make me sleepy anybody experience the same thing?

column2: KIM, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Phentermine for about a month now and have lost 13 lbs. I haven't had any side effects (except maybe staying up longer at night). I have really been working on my eating habits and walking more. I have been concerned about all of the people who write in saying that as soon as you go off of the pill that you will gain all the weight back. Well, I talked to my doctor about it yesterday at my follow up appt and she said that the only way someone will gain the weight back is if they have not been eating approx 1500 calories a day and have put their body in starvation mode, so when you stop taking the pill your body tries to store as much fat as possible because it thinks it's starving or that a persons eating and exercise habits haven't changed. She said the weight is not going to magically re-appear for no reason unless you are still eating more calories than you are burning(thats how we all got overweight to begin with).

column9: today was my 1st day on the notorius " pill". all day i was running around , couldnt sit down and did not feel hungry at all . i had to force myself to eat so i could take some of my meds on a full stomach . all i could eat was 1/2 a sandwich . my whole mouth had this awful feeling , you know the one you get if you ever ate an unripe banana ? that one ! so i am really excited about this . my doc also gave me a Vit B12 shot and some magnesium gluconate to curb the sweet cravings . if anyone wants to find a Doc in the Dallas area that prescribe Phentermine , please email me @ bayten16@gmail.com . i'll be glad to share this info . will check back in a week .

column2: ann mick, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i am on my 5th day of phentermine. today i did not take my pill, because i have been experiencing some big side effects. i am on the 30 mg blue capsules. i'm 5'6'', 158lbs, and hope to lose 15-20. My clinican said that this would jump start since I haven't been able to shed much. However, I have found this drug to be quite scary. Yes, it makes me feel powerful by not wanting to eat anything and giving me LOADS of energy but there are more negatives than positive. I have had horrible headaches, lack of sleep (I lay in bed and my mind races), heat flashes, and heart racing. I will probably decrease my consumption to 3-4 times a week. Overall, this is not a magic pill. It will help in a short time that you need to lose weight, but going to the gym and eating the right foods are the way to go!!

column2: erin k, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: today is my 3rd day on phentermine 37.5. i am overweight from having my 2nd baby(i gained 70 pounds this pregnancy) and my metabolism took a dive. to get to a safe and healthy weight my Dr. suggested i lose 35 pounds but i will be thrilled to lose even 20-25! i started out taking half a pill for the first 2 days and i definitely noticed it taking the edge off my hunger and giving me more energy to work out. this drug was recommended to me by friends and family members who have taken it and had great results, but all of them warned me about the heart palpitations and headaches bieng scary at times. today i actually took 3/4 of a pill because i was scared to jump to a whole pill when i was already getting the results, and im glad i didnt take a whole pill because my heart is racing and my right arm feels cold.i will take it easy today, and tommorow i will go back to half a pill because i was doing fine with that and i dont want to have any episodes that make me go off this medication because so far im liking it. ive felt starving all my life no matter how much i eat, my appetite is insatiable even after a thanksgiving dinner, so im enjoying the novelty of not feeling like a slave to my hunger for once. i wont weigh in for another week, but i will come back and post my results. (:

column2: Shawnap, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Phentermine for a little over a week.  I have lost 5 pounds so far.  Initally I had the headaches, dry mouth, teeth clenching and I get hot flashes.  The headaches adn dry mouth have gone away. I started at 261 now I am at 156.  My short term goal is 60 in 3 months, long term is 120 in 6 months.  I'll keep you posted.

column2: vance134, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Hey all... I have been on this med since Feb. 2009 and have lost almost 42 lbs. I have not had any of the side effects and am really happy with the way this drug has worked. It suppresses the apetite and gives you that little bit of boost of energy. Make sure to follow your doctor recommendations and maintain a healthy diet. If you want to change your eatting habits and really have your mind set to changing your lifestyle you will not gain the weight back when you get off of the pill. You MUST change your eating habbits. Good Luck and if you have any questions please feel free to email me at vance134@wbfrec.com!

column2: hindsightis2020, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I started taking Phentermine in mid-2002.  I took it with a doctors prescription for almost 1 year.  I then became highly addicted to it to the point I was hiding it from my husband.  I took it for at least another year and lost a total of 65 pounds.  It gave me an incredible amount of energy and I felt great!  One morning shorly after taking it my pulse started rising very quickly.  It shot way up and I was very shaky and almost passed out.  My husband called 911 and I was taken to the hospital.  My pulse was over 230.  My doctor told me to quit taking Phentermine immediately.  I went through severe withdrawal - extreme tiredness and irratability.  For the next year I made about 4 trips to the hospital for tachycardia.  I never had any problems with my heart before I began taking this pill.  I was referred to a cardiologist who prescribed a heart medicine for me that I must take daily now to keep my heart rate in check.  My doctor says the Phentermine didn't have anything to do with this but I am not sure I believe that.  I have now gained back almost everything I lost and am desperate to lose it again.  I have had thoughts of trying Phentermine again because I know it works fast but you will NOT keep weight off with this.  It is great for the short term but a lifestyle change is necessary for long term.  Please use extreme caution with this pill.  If a pill makes you feel that horrible to come off it can't be good for you.  There is no such thing as a magic pill.

column2: cancerqueen, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Update**** I have been taking this med. 37.5 mg since 3 weeks ago and so far I have lost 9lbs. weight in at 189lb and looking to lost 45-50lbs. Started out take the whole pill in the morning, but I could not deal with the pressure headache, dry mouth chest pain and short of breath, now I'm taking 1/2 at 7:30 am and other 1/2 an 1 hour later, that made a big difference, only sideaffect is the dry mouth. I think its working really well.. I thought I would more lbs than that, but I heard that is not good, so I think I'm on the right track. Also I do work out cardio and weight, toning, 4 to 5 days a week...so I am building muscles at the same time. I have my one month check this week, will see what my doctor says... I am worried that this med increase my blood pressure... I hope that is not the case... I don't plan on taking this for more than three months... will keep yall posted and good luck to all on their weight loss journey...

column2: fabandforty, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking it on and off since Feb. '09.  I have lost 23 pounds and want to lose 15 more.  However, I am now afraid to stay on Phentermine because I am starting to have a clinched jaw, sore teeth, and twitching.  At first it didn't bother me, but now it's getting really annoying.  Sometimes I have red eyes.  I have the dry mouth as well, but no constipation, insomnia, nausea or headaches.  Has anyone else experienced the clinched jaw and twitching of the toes? column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I cannot say enough positive things about this med! As with anything though, it does need to be monitored and used carefully. I've been taking it on/off for 1 year. I go in monthly for BP checks & if my MD thinks my BP is too high OR if I've lost either too much (or not enough) weight she won't refill. She says it is important to still do all the other "right" things...exercise portion control, calorie intake. Each month I've been on it I've lost anywhere from 5 lbs to 17 lbs. I haven't had bad side effects aside from insomnia but I've always had that. In the beginning, I did really have to force myself to eat. I was concerned that I would balloon when I stopped but the months I've not taken it I have been able to maintain.  So far (over 1 year) I have lost 103 lbs. Unfortunately, I think she is probably getting ready to stop giving it to me!!! :( Best wishes to all!!!

column2: UpdatedMan, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: ***Update*** I have been taking the supplement for exactly 3 months. I dropped from 268 to 230 doing a reduced calorie diet and watching sodium and fat.  It is really effective with getting your metabolism up and curving your appetite. I do think decreasing your dosage helps to if you are taking it for a while. I had to reduce to half a pill because my mood swings were out of control, I was having difficulty sleeping, dry mouth occasionally, and sometimes I would sweat easily. After 1 1/2 month, I reduced to half a pill and everything got better. The biggest mistake is not eating or not exercising while on the pill. It will curve your appetite but if you dont eat healthy you are messing up your metabolism. I would also try to eat heavier meals during the day too. I had to take the pill 30 min before breakfast so it became almost a task for me to eat in the mornings. But afternoon hits, pill wears off, and I was ready for snacks! I didnt exercise the first couple of weeks too - so that added to my mood swings and trouble sleeping. I would take this supplement again probably wither a reduced dosage and a shorter period of time. Hope this helps!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have used phentermine several times over the last 2 years and have had mixed results.  I used it for about 3 months the first time and lost 15 lbs (I have never been obese, but have always carried a little more weight than i would like).  This pill is the only thing that has ever truly suppressed my appetite, which was great, but unfortunately, as soon as I stopped taking the pills, my appetite came back and eventually the weight came back too.  I have tried to get the same results with phentermine as I did the first time, but i think my body has become somewhat immune to the effectiveness and my body doesn't seem to tolerate it very well anymore.  Even though I have stopped for several months & then tried to start over, I have only been able to take it for a few weeks before my body just seems to have enough of it.  The last time I tried phentermine it actually made me really sick after about a week.  So, my suggestion is, if you use phentermine, once you start to feel your body becoming immune to it, it's probably a good time to stop taking it and then make sure you don't fall back into your old habits (that was where I failed the most). I have heard different opinions from my doctors on the "safeness" of this drug, but for me, there were always side effects with it, such as really bad dry mouth, insomnia (for the first few days), blurry vision at times, occasional headaches and random moments where my toes would go numb for no reason.  However, the last time I used phentermine, I had heart palpitations, a constant feeling of heartburn & indegestion, terrible headaches and didn't sleep the whole week I was on it.  So, based on my experience I think if you use the drug as a tool to change your habits and to give yourself a "jump start" you will probably have very good results, but, if you try to use it as a permanent way to keep weight off, without out changing your lifestyle, you will probably have mixed results.I hope this helps!

When started taking again, side effects came back. Have also noticed I am very moody and quick to blow them out of porportion. I can only take it 3 mths so havent decided I want to finish treatment. I do think it has helped curve my appetite (somedays literally I force myself to eat) and my metablish and energy levels have gone upp.

column2: happylady, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 30 years old, 5'6 and when I started taking Phentermine on 2/18/09 I weighed 184 lbs. In exactly four weeks, I lost 21 lbs.  I am very happy with how this has worked for me.  I have more energy and seeing results helps keep me motivated.  Every week, Tuesday through Saturday, I get up at 5:15 am and do a four mile, 1 hour walk/workout using one of the Walk Away the Pounds DVDs and in the evening I do a 30 minute 2 mile walk/workout from the same DVD.  I have felt so good!  I have had the usual side effects of dry mouth, but it just makes me drink more water which is good!  I watch what I eat and I cut back on portion sizes.  I have had a little bit of constipation, but my Dr. recommended that I take Benefiber 3 times a day and that has helped.  I just had my one month follow up with my Dr. and he is happy with the results.  My blood pressure is normal and I am having a Echocardiogram done this next week to make sure that my heart is not having a reaction to the drug.  My Dr. isn't concerned or thinks there is a problem, but he is very through and wants to check everything to be sure.  He is expecting me to only have to be on Phentermine for another two months and then I will be done.  I have been very happy with it.  I have gone down two pant sizes and I feel so much better about myself.  I have tried for years to lose weight on my own, but no matter what I did, nothing worked and my weight stayed exactly the same.  After some blood work, my Dr. determined that my metabolism was extremely low and that is why he put me on this. I know that everyone's body can react differently to a medication, but I think with diet, exercise and careful monitoring from a Dr, this is a great tool in helping someone to lose weight!

column2: jeanie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i have been taking for 4 months have lost 25lbs, i am 41 started at 221 lbs, im 5'4, never had any blood pressure problems or heart , diabetes, all of which is genetic, and i dont want any of these problems, the medication has helped me alot and my dr monitors my blood pressure monthly, when it seems to loose effect, i skip couple days, but its usually due to stress factors or menstrual cycle, makes me over eat, i think as long as your dr monitors your progress it is safe, it also helps with some underlying depression i deal with, my dr says thats very possible, i took the same medication in my early 30's and lost 40 lbs in a year, i had no health problems afterwards, so i felt after gaining so much weight it was worth another try, just have to learn how to keep it off after the meds do the their part

column2: chavela, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started on Phen 37.5MG on 7/20/08 and about a two days ago I threw them in the garbage.  Yes this medication works wonders but the after math is terrible.  I started at 214 lbs and after 7 months I've gone down to 173 lbs.  (Total of 41 lbs) Which is what I wanted at the time.  I went into the doctors (different Dr. than the one who prescribed the Phen) office for strep throat and ended up staying for over 3 hrs.  They checked my blood pressure which was 166 way too high.  The Dr. then took X-Rays of my heart which showed the left atrial enlarged.  The Dr. took it a step further and did a EKG test on my heart.  Needless to say I have an appointment next week for a Echo of my heart.  I think this explains a lot.  Ladies please please think about it before you start this medication.  You have too much to loose should it turn out like me.  I WAS a healthy, married 33 year old with 2 kids.  Now I wonder if this medication will be the cause of me not living long enough to see my grandchildren.  BEING THIN IS NOT WORTH IT!  I only took this route because my doctors kept telling me to lose wait, I was tired of hearing this every time I went in.  I was perfectly fine before, now who knows?

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It worked the first month only losing 18 pounds.I took a one week break & started the second month having no success! It no longer seems to be effective on me,hoping to try something else to get me down some more.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started phen the first week of February at 173 pounds.  As of today, March 18th, I am 151.  I have lost 22 pounds in 6 weeks.  I am 31, female and 5'4".  Not to say that I have just sat around, popping pills and hoping the weight just falls off, but I have changed my lifestyle as well.  I walk/jog on the treadmill 5-6 times a week for thirty minutes.  I have changed my eating habits.  Yes, I do eat junk now and then, but not on a frequent basis.  When I say I eat it, I mean one piece of candy, a cup of flavored coffee or half of a donut maybe once a week.  I drink a ton of water; close to 100 oz a day.  I consume about 1200 calories a day.  I also take vitamins to help make up for the lack of nutrients I have had for the last five years.  Phen will help to give you the energy to make the changes needed to change yourself.  I have gone off for a few days here and there and have been able to stick with my new life.  I went from a size 14 to an 8.  I can do fun things with my kids, not just hang out in front of the tv.  We went for a three mile bike ride/roller blading trip this weekend and I was able to keep up with my four children.  This alone is well worth it.  Yes there are side effects; dry mouth, cold hands/feet, change in sleep habits, and constipation.  But they are minor in comparison to being obese, which I was.  And we have all heard about the side effects of obestity; diabetes, elevated cholesterol, fatigue, high blood pressure.  I was looking at all of these as future issues, but know I know I can avoid them.  Oh, and I take the generic phentermine.  My dose is 37.5mg per day, but I will often use half the tab unless I know it is going to be a rough day.  Good luck!

column9: I have been taking this medication for approximately 13 weeks now, or just over 3 months. This journey feels as though it's been literally a year! column2: Patty, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have just begun my Phentermine 30mg (By the way - this is a Prescription Drug given by Doctor's only) The one they advertise on internet or GNC without an RX are NOT THE SAME. God only knows what you are getting. When prescribed this drug the Dr. is monitoring you and any side effects and weight loss usually on a month to month basis or more. This drugs works in 2 ways. It is an appetite suppressant and increases the Metabolism that causes weight loss. Eating high protein and fresh vegetables and fresh fruit are suggested. Drink water constantly! A Multi-Vitamin is good, as well. NO SOFT DRINKS! DIET OR NOT. Try and stay away from White Food. Meaning Pasta, Potatoes, Bread (Other than whole grain) Sugar. Protein is Boneless Skinless Chicken Breast Baked. Fresh Fish and some Red Meat baked not fried. Eggs. Eating small amounts throughout the day helps the body burn more calories. Than eating 1 large meal a day. This should be used as a JUMP START to weight loss. Take advantage of it-however, new life changes are necessary to stay leaner. You must change your eating habits and begin a safe exercise regimen appropriate for your body. Exercise daily for at least 30-45 minutes. You can begin with baby steps. Start walking in place instead of sitting while watching TV. Gradually increase activity daily. I need to lose 51 pounds. I started 2/26/09 ~ I will keep you informed. I feel great!

column2: lilypad, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I wrote an earlier review that this is the second time in my life I have taken this weight loss pill.  For me, it takes about a week to jump start the good habits.  I lost 60 pounds the first time around and am now taking it again after the birth of my fourth son who is now 2.(I have around 40 pounds to lose this time.) The side effects do decrease.  If you feel jittery and are taking 37.5, half it and take one half in the morning and one in the afternoon.  Just eat healthy and try to exercise.  It is a really great tool to help you lose the weight.  I met my goal the first time around and kept it off until I got pregnant with my fourth child.(7 years later!) People are asking if they are losing weight fast enough on this pill, basically the heavier you are the faster you lose it in the beginning.  It does taper off eventually, and those final pounds are tough to lose.  Eat low fat...look at labels when you buy food.  Eat at home and don't eat fast food or at restaurants. The side effects are definately worth it to me! I have a ton of energy and appreciate the boost. Caffiene does heighten the effects of phentermine, so be careful! Give it a chance for a month or so and see if this the weight loss pill for you. This has been an amazing tool for me to lose weight and to get healthy.  It is NOT a miracle weight loss drug.  It really helps to curb your appetite, but you also have to do the work! I started phentermine (again) on 1-19-09 and lost 20 pounds to this date.  Good Luck and TRY TRY TRY!

column2: tina, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking it for close to 4 months and have lost 48 lbs. I am also going to Weight Watchers which hopefully will help me to make this a lifetime change, and not "a diet" until the weight is off and then resume my old eating patterns. Since I started out at 294 lbs. I still have a long ways to go, but really find the combination of the two to be great.  Have learned too, that you don't want to be too restrictive or you lose fast for a few weeks and then this slows your metabolism down, which you don't want and then you stop losing.  With Weight Watchers you have a certain amount of points that you should consume in a day, and you can eat anything you want as long as you don't go over your points consistenly.  And you have 35 extra points weekly that you can use during the week or all on a special occasion that week. I would highly recommend anyone taking this drug to also join Weight Watchers to make it a Lifetime change. I also love how much better I feel with 48 lbs. less to carry around.  Also greatly love the energy I have from taking the phentermine, and the wt loss. As far as side effects, I do get dry mouth, but this makes me consume more fluids which is a plus.  I always take it around 8-9am. Had some insomnia at first, but sleep fine now with taking Tylenol PM about 1 hour before I plan to go to bed.

column2: Menjoo, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was recently prescribed Phentermine, however, before I was prescribed this drug there was a strict screening process.  My doctor wanted to make sure that I wasn't on any medication(s), that I didn't have a pre-existing medical condition and that I was in good health.  I was warned about the side effects which could be headaches from the body adapting to the medicine, dry mouth, constipation, and insommia for the first week or two.  I was given mult-vitamns, pyruvate fat burners, colon cleanser for constipation and 37.5 mgs of Phentermine. I take half in the morning and half in the afternoon.  I do not take the second half after 2:00 p.m. which helps with the insomnia, and I do not eat after 5:00 p.m. I am on 1,000 calories a day and a 5 day a week, 30 minute exercise program. My health and progress are monitored weekly by having my blood check checked and weigh-in.  So far I am doing well on the drug, there is a decrease in my appetite and my craving for sugar has tremendously subsided.  For the dry mouth I alternate between bottled water and Vitamin Water.  I have more energy and I can relate to those who are cleaning house.  I can do fitness programs on my treadmill that I was not able to do before.  I hope my information was helpful and beneficial.

column2: ccd4682, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for almost 2 months now. I will say that my weight loss has definitely slowed down. In the first month I lost 19 pounds and this month I have lost about 7. I was at a plateau for about 2 weeks where the weight would not budge, which can be very discouraging. I was hoping to lose another 16-20 pounds this month, but I guess that won't be the case. My doctor said that the weight fell off so quickly in the beginning because it was mostly water weight, which makes sense of course. I still have another 40 pounds to go before I reach the ideal weight for my height. My doctor and I thought I could lose about 60 pounds in 4 months, but again, I guess we'll have to extend that deadline. I exercise about 3 times a week and I am on a strict low calorie diet. I do get dizzy at times especially when I get up too fast, and I definitely get the flushed face and neck everyone is talking about. Overall the worst thing about losing the weight is that the bust is the first thing to go!! My clothes are loser which is great, but my bras are absolutely huge (I'm guessing I've lost at least a cup size and a half), which is the last thing I wanted. I guess I'll have to take the good with the bad!

column2: Bcas, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Along with the loss of weight; I find that it gives me alot more energy and awareness. I don't feel like in a fog or groggy. I am a single mom of 5 children and after a long day at work, I am still able to go about the rest of the afternoon with driving the kids to different sport practices and games, as well as coming home and cooking and checking homeworks! My day ends at 10:00 pm with the kids and even after I give myself at least an hour to unwine and get ready for rest. It has been an overall great experience with this medication and so far I have not experienced any side effects. I have been on this medication for 1 year; taking 1 pill in the morning at 8:00 am when my day starts outside of home.  I would greatly recommend it to anyone that is fit to take it to lose weight.
