column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
Omegaman2u@AOL.COM, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I am a sixty-nine year old male and have recently begun taking Phentermine 37.5 MG. After taking as prescribed, I did lose eighteen pounds in two months, however, I began to experience headaches, dry mouth, dizziness, nausea, and seeing small black specks or spots. The spots seem to be more prevelent when I stoop down and then get up, leading me to believe it may be caused from an increase, or possible decrease in blood pressure, or when I am doing things like yard work and become tired. I am basically in good health, other than elevated blood pressure (hypertension)and have never experienced this before taking this diet drug. Could age be a factor? I'm not sure. I stopped taking and informed my doctor, he seemed surprised at my symptoms. We agreed that I should stop taking and in doing so these things cleared up,including a very dry mouth condition. I waited for two or three weeks and tried the medication again, and again, same results. I have now discontinued use and will be seeing my doctor again soon. Has anyone experienced these side effects, especially the small black spots? Dry mouth, dizziness, nausea, headaches, small specks or spots in vision field (I searched this on MedInfo and found something similar called floaters which are associated with age, but I didn't have these "floaters" before the medication). I am trying to determine if the spots are a known side effect, a coincidence, or if I might have additional concerns. Any info helps, Thanks.

column2: cat, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
cris, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Just wanted to respond to the person who said they get sleepy.  Ive had a similar reaction to you.  I felt very sleepy for a few days and also had a calmness to me that felt the way I did when I was taking Zoloft (antidepressant/anti-anxiety).  I never feel jittery, though I do feel dizzy sometimes if I stand up too fast.  I dont feel unusually sleepy anymore but I dont have the increased energy that others talk about either.  The dry mouth is more than I can bare sometimes.  I woke up one morning with bite marks on my tongue and the inside of my mouth, maybe from my mouth being so dry it causes my lips to stick to my teeth.  Really gross!  I also get stomach pain occasionally.  Other than that, I have had no major problems.  The benefits are great.  In the first couple of weeks, I never thought about eating until I heard my stomach growling.  It got me through the holidays wonderfully.  I worry that maybe I am not getting enough nutrition.  I am now journaling my eating on www.thedailyplate.com (through www.livestrong.com).  I have lost weight but I have recently decided to wean myself off.  Everything that I read says that most people more than likely gain the weight back.  The idea of losing 30-35 lbs and then regaining it is heartbreaking.  Ive decided to do it the hard way and hopefully it will pay off in the long run.  I wish you luck!

column2: 25-34 Female  (Patient)

column2: twotwo22, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Phentermine (37.5mg) for just over two weeks now and I'm really loving the results. I've lost over 12 pounds and I have about 30-40 more pounds or so left to go. I have noticed other users who have had excellent results without changing their lifestyle at all, not the case for me. I am exercising atleast 5 times a week and I have cut out basically "all the good stuff". I try and stay away from sugar, salt, fat, and excess amounts of dairy and eat fruits, vegetables, and fat-free products. I have also noticed that some days I feel more hungry than other days and I'll crave things I know I should not have which can be stressful. The only side effect I have had is the flushing of the face and neck which can be quite embarassing and dry mouth which comes and goes. Overall I would recommend this drug to anyone who wants to lose weight, especially those who have tried to lose weight in the past and have been unsecessful.

column2: Sydney01, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is my second time around using Phentermine. I had alot of success taking it the first time for 3 months. Lost a total of 35lbs. Once off it the first time I felt withdrawels and had a lack of energy. I found another doctor 2 months later who gave me 3 months worth again. I basically remained at the same weight but felt that it was in control. I've just finished the last pill 6 days ago and have felt depressed, low energy and now I'm sleep walking. It's the only medication I've taken so I'm thinking that it's realted. Also I have amnesia with the sleep walking and have no recollection of my actions....very scary. I know that I probably took it to long so I'm almost sure it's messed up my brain or something. I'm heading back to the doctor that gave me the second dose and from the research I've done looks like I may need a sleep clinic or something.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started this medicine at the end of September. I have been on it for 2 months now, going on month 3. The doctor will only let me get on it for that amount of time because it can be habit forming. If you read online about this medication you will read that you should not take it for more then 2 weeks at a time, and that you can become co-dependent on it. I believe this depends on the doctor and patient.  I took it everyday the first month, then the second month I took if every other day because it seemed to be working. When I started I weighted 155, when I did my first weigh in I weighed 142, although my scale at home said I weighted 138. For my last weigh in I was at 131. This medicine curves my appetite and gives me energy. You should so some exercise and diet with this medicine to get optimal results. I do about a 1 ½ cardio a week broken up over 4 days and I use retention bands for my muscles, and do some yoga. You have to remember muscle weighs more then fat also. I also am a big snacker. I got 100 cal. pack from the store and these fill me up for a mid-day snack. I do get dry mouth, and my eyes do get tired, but these are common side effects. I might also add that I am on 37.5 mg.

column2: stylistgal, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking this medication almost 8 weeks ago and I love it!!  I've dropped 32lbs and have about 18more to go.  The dr that prescribed this to me has me come in once a week to weigh in and take my blood pressure.  She only gives me enough of the drug for one week so that she can regulate the use.  I also am on a very strict diet. Lots of protein, veggies, and fruit....no bread or sugar and limited dairy.  I have gone from a size 16 to a size 12, and this is with limited excercise ( i do try to get 10000 steps a day).  The first few days on this product I was all jittery like i had way to many redbulls, but that feeling went away quickly.  I take half a pill in the am, and half a pill around 2pm.  I havent had any sleeping issues, or any loss of sex drive (my bf keeps saying how skinny and hot i look lol, so that helps ;)   ).  The dry mouth sucks...and it doesnt go away, but i drink a TON of liquids so it doesnt bother me too bad.  Any questions??? email me at vena26@comcast.net.  Hope this helps.  Good LUck!!!

column2: tgds, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

I would recommend this drug to anyone that has trouble with emotional overeating. It helped me control that instinct, and I've learned how to channel that into something more productive. I want to lose 22 more pounds and then I will slowly start reducing my use of the drug. I should add that my doctor also gives me an injection once a week of B6 and B12. column9: I started this drug on 10/15/08...so it's only been 2 weeks...and I've lost 13 lbs.  This pill isn't a crutch, I've lowered my carb intake to about 20g a day at the most and don't eat any sugar.  I pay attention to the Nutrition labels. Absolutely no fast food.  I drink at least 8 glasses of water a day and have done vigorous walking 2x/week.  I eat breakfast, lunch, and dinner..but have small healthy portions because my Dr. said not to skip meals and to make yourself eat.  I'm extremely happy so far...I do have frequent urination, and the only side effects have been dry mouth and increased energy/heartrate (maybe not a bad thing?).

column2: carolineincity, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Phentermine for three months now, with 1-week intervals in between to maintain its effectiveness.  Due to a couple of car accidents a few years ago, I put on about 50 pounds.  I really like to work out regularly but I now suffer from Grade IV osteo-arthritis, fibromyalgia, and carpal tunnel syndrome. I am only 36, and I am a size 16.When I take Phentermine, I DO have the energy to keep going (especially if I take Vitamin B supplements as well), and my appetite decreases noticeably.I am in the 4th month and I have noticed that the effectiveness is wearing off exponentially, so I will have to find another way to keep up my energy.Also, some of the generic versions of Phentermine do NOT work and the pharmacies will try to pass off the bad kind, so make sure you're getting the right pill --Adipex works the best and is still considered a generic of Phentermine.I highly recommend this for "getting over the hump", but even if it doesn't hurt you, it loses its effectiveness after several months, so keep that in mind!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started this medication on Feb. 23, 2008 and have lost 145 lbs as of today!  It's important to remember that this is just a tool for weight loss and not a long term solution.  In order to lose the weight and keep it off, you have to make life changes that include a regular exercise plan and a balanced diet. I work out 5 days a week for 1 1/2 hours a day and I eat 1200 calories a day. The biggest side effect is dry mouth, but drinking a lot of water makes it bearable.  40 more pounds to my goal weight-wish me luck!

column2: SAD, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I initially lost 30lbs. but over a year and half have gained some back. The effectiveness loses power. I've been on it 3 Years, and just stopped taking it, cold turkey. This is the second week without it and my exhaustion is great.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: None, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I had no prior history of siezures, 30 years old, and am healthy other than my weight-just under 200 lbs (which I gained during pregnancy and have been trying for 4+ years to lose the 70 lbs I gained).  Though the ER doctor could not tell me EXACTLY what caused the siezure, when I told him I was taking this medication, he immediately directed me to stop. (I had blood & urine testing, a chest x-ray, and a CT scan of the brain completed-all were normal).  I am not a doctor nor do I have any medical training, but my STRONG opinion is that this medication was the cause.

column9: For the person with hair loss, did you loss a lot of weight at once?  Usually hair loss is caused by the rapid weight loss more than the med. itself. Of course I'm no expert, but wanted to give you some hope on that.  I, as most women, am very attached to my head of hair and I'm sure that can be a very SERIOUS drawback.  Blessing!

column2: It's Me!, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Kim, I am by no means and expert, but I think you should have your blood pressure checked.  One of the biggest (or most serious?) side effects of this drug is that it can raise your blood pressure.  To me the symptems you describe could easily be from elevated blood pressure.  You can have high blood pressure with no symptoms, but to me the symptoms you describe would worry me that my blood pressure was REALLY high.  I don't want to worry you, but I would get that checked asap to at least rule it out.  The side effects I have from the drug mostly subsided after the first few days, but I wasn't having anything as bothersome as what you describe and I wouldn't want to "wait and see" if I was in your position.Please let us know what you find out.Blessings

column2: Verucasalt, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have taken this in the past and works great, now that I have moved does anyone know what doctor in Salt Lake City, Utah would prescribe this?

If you are taking this medication with any other type of Serotonin re-uptake inhibitor drug, like paxil, cymbalta, etc, you can get a very dangerious condition called, Serotonin Syndrome. Research it on webmd.com. Make sure that your doctor and pharmacist know you are taking both drugs. I started to take Phentermine with Paxil and in 3 days, developed seretonin syndrome and was off work for two days until I got better. It knocked me on my Butt. Since then, I have gotten off of the Paxil and have started back on the phentermine. So far, so good. I don't know yet if it was worth all the problems.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Good Afternoon, I started this medication on 08/12/08, and up until this date i have lost 10lbs.  I have done a lot of searching and investigating on this drug. And a lot of people are concerned to the reason why the pounds are not coming off.  Phen has a appetite suppresant and you will not eat because you are not hungry.  The problem with that is our bodies needs calories to survive.  If you are not eating enough calories per day your mind will think that your body is starving.  So it does not matter if you excersize,  your body will not burn calories that it thinks you will need. It will store all fat in your body if it believes that you are starving. You have to eat enough calories for your body to survive.  Several people that i have spoken to have stated that they eat a 1500 calorie healthy diet along with excercise and lots of water and the weight just flys off. I believe this to be very true.  So for those who have a problem with seeing results they have to find out how many calories there body needs to thrive and it goes by how much you weight.Example: weight before phen 222according to my weight my body needs 1700 calories. I hope this helps.

column2: googlehead, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The good and the bad: It worked fabulously for me, after my metabolism bombed from Epstein Barr and Lymes, I lost nearly 20 lbs on only half a pill in the morning. Tons of energy to work out, little appetite. Okay, so now it's time to stop. Guess what? Starving. Exhausted. My 3-mile runs feel like marathons. My "old" diet feels like starvation. Do not kid yourselves into thinking that this is a magic bullet you can use forever! Your body cannot stand to stay on this, so use the lowest dose you can, and be prepared for the opposite feeling from the energetic optimistic business while you are on it. Keep your dose low!!! This drug is psychologically addicting because you feel so good about your weight loss and energy. Please be careful.

column2: 4health11, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Hi, I started taking this medicine on July 11, and I saw my doctor Thursday August 21 and lost 23 pounds. I am taking 37.5, half in the morning and the other half about noon. This medicine is wonderful in the fact that it gives me so much energy that I can exercise. I am lucky enough that I have a Nordic Track Eliptical it tells me how much calories and carbs that I have burned which I felt that I needed, because I put myself on a low calorie diet this helped me keep track, plus I do other exercises. I think that is how most people lost a lot of the weight is adding exercise not just changing how much they eat or the way they eat. The pill is only good enough if you are willing to change the way you eat and exercise specially if you have to lose a lot of weight, like me. I have another 25 pounds to go, but with this medicine I know I will be able to make. I drink a lot of water so I didn't experience the dry mouth, does curb the appitite so sometimes I forget to eat or just don't eat much. Thank God I don't crave the sweets, chips,fatty foods,etc. anymore. Which made it much easier to watch what I eat. For those who are really serious put yourself on a low calorie diet. Add exercise to it and put yourself on a cut off TIME. For me 5:30 no matter what time I go to bed. I eat cherrios for breakfast, turkey sandwich with mustard and banana peppers and no mayo and I have a pickle and sometimes applesauce, dinner lean cusine nothing else. Weekends a little different.

column2: REALTORCHIC123, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was reading the posts to see what response others had to this drug because i was so pleased with it. This drug has changed my life totally. Just like anything you do in life you have to be willing to work for results. When I first start taking this in June 08 I weighed 218 pounds every one always sd how good I looked because I'm a Realtor I have to dress very nice. The thing people didnt know was I was good at covering up my problems areas I was so unhappy on the inside because I tried so many fads along with exercise sometimes I didnt even eat. I gained alot of weight with the work I do being on the go and just eating fast food. I have changed my life totally instead I opt for fruit and yogurt as my breakfast and or lunch. I drink plenty of water as well. You can nix in a salad or if I eat out I always get something grilled and ask for a to go box and save 1/2 for lunch the following day. If you make a few changes in your diet it does get easier to make healthy choices. To date I have lost 30 pounds not 2 mention the inches off my arms,hips and waist. I can wear a size 11/12now which is great because I was in a size 14/16.My target weight goal is to get to a healthy 150. I did this a clinical trial for a six month program which will be completed in November. Im taking it one day at a time but to those who are condering the drug dont just take the pill and expect results please try to change your eating habits even if its a small change and try to exercise for at least 30 min a day. Its very hard to fit exercise in my busy day so I walk for 30 minutes on my treadmill when I first wake up and run up and down the steps for like 5minutes to get my metabolism up. I even invested in a dog which is great because I can go to the park to walk and run my pet.The only side effect I had was pretty much like every one else it will be hard to sleep for the 1st week and you will have dry mouth for a week or so. Other than that the results out weigh these side effects. Good Luck

column2: KISS..keep it simple silly!!, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for 1 month and a week and have lost 18 pounds. I work in EMS and find that it gives me extra energy throughout the day. The key to the medication is to DRINK LOTS OF WATER!!! You get dry mouth because you aren't drinking enough. Anything that is designed to increase your heart rate and decrease you food intake is going to demand more energy from your body. Metabolism is your body creating energy. If you creat more you there for need more. You can't think that maintaining your normal water intake will cut it. More Fluids(not a diet coke either) Also you may not feel hungry but if you don't eat you will get a nervous shakey feeling. Eat a small portion of fruit or veggies maybe a energy bar. This will cut down on the feelings and also will cut down on the headaches. Your stomache will have something else to do besides hurt and make you feel bad. You are getting headaches because your body is use to being fed a certain amount. If you stop feeding your body, the brain is going to react to make you think to eat..IE the headache..Also the side effect of high blood pressure can also cause a headache. Increase your red blood cells increase the amount of pressure it takes to move them around the body. I find that if I have a bad heahache eating a small healthy snack and one Aleve does the trick. I haven't noticed this but some have stated they are having issues with constipation. DRINK WATER..also keep in mind if you are cutting back in the amount of food you are putting into your mouth or the quality of food, it will effect the amount that is elimanated. The less you put in the less you get out and the more the body uses to produce energy. Issues with sleeping are simple...burn the enegy your body is producing..walking,jogging,swimming. Get your butt active burning enegy leads to sleeping better at night and cut back on the coffee. You don't need the jolt if you are already taking medication that gives you the jolt, your just doubling up!!

column2: b, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: I have been on phentermine for 4 1/2 months and have lost 105 lbs.  My doctor wants me to lose another 75, but my goal is another 100. The only side effect I have had is dry mouth.  It's important to keep in mind that while this drug curbs appetite, it is your responsibility to maintain a low calorie diet and exercise.  When I started I only ate 600 calories a day and walked for 30 min/day 5 days/week.  I have now increased to running 45 min a day 5 days a week and weight lifting for 45 min a day 4 days a week. When I increased my exercise routine, I increased my caloric intake to between 700-900 calories a day.  I'm not advocating that anyone else cut calories to this extreme, but merely trying to state that eating less volume of food does not equal eating less calories.  Also, once the weight is off, my doctor has said that it's a good idea to have a red flag weight, which is usually 5-10 lbs more than your goal.  My goal is 160 (I'm 6'1", so that's a healthy weight)and my red flag weight will be 165-170.  I'll weigh myself once a week and if i get above that red flag weight, I'll know that I need to immediately start working out more and eating less to ensure that I don't become obese again.

I want to lose at least 80lbs.  Any advice would be appreciated.  If you would like to email me my address is tdoh3@msn.com. column2: Tam, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started June 7th on this pill.  I took the 15mg for one week.  I felt a little fuzzy at first but then it was better.  I then was to start taking the 37.5mg pill, which I did for one day and felt awful.  My head was full feeling, terrible headache and I could not sleep, so I quit taking.  I just restarted taking the 15mg pill on 7/8/08.  I actually feel hungier when I take the pill.  Seems odd to me after reading other reviews.  To date I have lost a little over 11 lbs.  I'm not sure the pill helps me, I may try the 37.5mg again once I go back to the Dr. next week.  I am also on a 1200 calorie diet.  I have actually been eating less, but see not much weight loss.  Does anyone have any comments or suggestions?

column2: wendyz, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started this meds with my doctors supervision I take 1 pill a day an hour before breakfast and WOW!!! My goal was to lose 60lbs and I have lost 60+ overall I am very pleased. I have energy all of the time. Dr sees me once a month and has me on a 3 months on 1 month off cycle. I have 5 more days then I am off a month then when I go back on them I will be starting the weening off process...I actually do ALL my housework and do it right you know the deep cleaning part not the just make it look clean part! we are remodeling and I can actually help instead of get in the way!!! YAY!! I would highly recommend people speaking to there doctors about this med! and CAREFULLY following the doctors advice and keep your monthly checkups. The monthly checkups and the website www.sparkpeople.com kept me going and on track. I highly recommend anybody to log onto that site and read it daily and join it! IT IS FREE!!! I have learned ALOT from it and it has helped me change my lifestyle to keep the weight off!!! keeps track of you colories your progress and a forum that people in the same boat use to keep everybody motovated and on track!!PLEASE check it out!!! It would help even if you didnt use this medication!!! GOOD LUCK!!! hope this review helps!!!

column2: stephanierb, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: started 4/29 on 15mg 2x/day.(capsule) did that for 2 months. the first 2 weeks were hell. i took a 3 day break from it and when i started again it has been great every since. the key is to EAT! eat something. it dont work well if you dont eat. i learned that the hard way. i now eat something even when i dont have any desire to. on 6/23 i started the 37.5 once a day.(white pill with blue dots) i cant take that much of a dosage at once so i break in half and take in morning and afternoon. i am 5'8 and started at 180.i just weighed and am down to 159 (21 lbs) and very happy. do have the dry mouth a little but the biggest side effect for me is the anxiousness. i notice after my afternoon dose i have a bit of racing thoughts and talk alot. i am normally a thinker anyway so this just magnifies it i think. i am having a sleep issue but have a lot of stress in my life so it is a combination of both im sure. i guess what i cant stress enough is to eat even when you are not hungry and have no desire, my dr told me the pill cant work if you dont eat. as to excercise, unfortunantly i dont do any other then my normal running around with 2 kid in sports.also in the first month i didnt lose as much as i thought i would but i have started seeing the results in the last month and a half! if you start to see a slow down of progress, back off it for a few days (like the weekend) and start it back up. i have done that a few times and i cant wait for the next 10 lbs to go!!!!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've only been taking Phentermine for 4 days now so I hardly feel qualified to 'review' this drug. I came to this site in search of information about side effects, though, and have found reading these posts quite interesting, encouraging, and helpful. I see a lot of mention of dry mouth, which I'm not experiencing. However, I've had a persistent, dull headache since taking it, and haven't slept well either. I take it first thing in the morning and wonder if anyone else has this difficulty? My work life is currently very stressful and there was a recent death in my family, as well. It's hard to know if this is the drug, or if I'd be sleeping poorly anyhow. Despite these things, I'm happy to say that in just a few days I have noticed a difference, not only in the scale, but in my eating habits. My hunger is very controlled and I'm satisfied more easily than the bingeing I've been doing lately!

column2: buttercup, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on 37.5 for about a year and lost 30 pounds. Side effects for me at the start was edgy, hyper, mean & headaches. This was on the generic, when I changed to Name Brand, things were a lot different. After 3 months, I went back to generic and now I ask the pharmacist to make sure new, fresh pills are in the bottle. The older ones, sitting on shelf for a while tend to be ineffective and cause headaches. Also I had to get on a Blood Pressure med to regulate that issue, well, it was either that or divorce...lol, anyway, very hard decision! lol, okay, well good luck to all and my cardiologist says with 30 pounds lost in a year, to keep going until the next 30 is off and then stop after reaching goal.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was on it for 6 months, went from 174 to 146 on my small boned frame. I've been off a month. Have lost no more weight, but I haven't gained any either. It really worked, now I'm back to blah, but at least I haven't gained any back yet. I am very careful of what I eat, portions esp. that's how I lost it w/Phen b/c I ate maybe 1/4 of what I used to.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been over weight most of my life. I gained about 30lbs. after my son pass away 06/06. Then 02/08 I found out I have fibromyalgia. I was put on Lyrica. Gained 10lbs. the first week then another 10 over the next few weels. My PCP gave me the Phentermine 37.5 in mid March and it has helped so much. I haven't lost any weight but the Lyrica made me want to eat everything in site. It was crazy the amount of food I wanted. The Lyrica also made me sleepy. The Phentermine balances out the side affects of the Lyrica. With out Lyrica I wouldn't be working or anything. So 2 thumbs up for Phentermine. Hopefully I will lose some weight.

column2: CadTechLV, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Im a 41yr old male 62 327 lbs. I started taking this med 37.5 mg on April 16, I have dropped 46 pounds and feel wonderful. I have lost weight in the past, but found it much more difficult. This med takes the edge and cravings out in the late afternoon and also gives me just a bit extra energy. Im doing light exercise along with my normal active work schedule. Its necessary for me to remind myself to eat and snack to keep my metabolism efficient. It has increased my blood pressure a few points, so we had to up the dosage on BP med. Worth it though, being 100 lbs. overweight is the main cause of the slightly elevated BP anyway. Weight loss was dramatic at first, now Im dropping about 2-3 pounds a week, which is still quick. Only side effect was food tasted a little different and the dry mouth. But, that encouraged me to drink more water, which I needed to do anyway, so its kind of a good thing. Dr put me on Topamax also, that made be very forgetful and unable to focus, which already having ADD made things worse. I stopped taking the Topamax after 2 weeks, but was & still am losing weight. Overall very satisfied with this med. Good luck to you, hope you have as great of results as Im experiencing.

column2: hayn73, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: In short this pill works wonders but I would like to know if anyone has experienced side effects such as nausea, headaches, fatigue, mood swings that include going from anger to depression and lack of motivation and energy.  I have only been taking this medication for 2 weeks but would like to know if anyone out there has experienced any of these side effects?  If so, did symptoms get better over time or did you have to quit taking medication?  I think this medication is amazing but having a hard time adjusting to constant headaches as well as severe mood swings.  Also, some days focus seems to be super human and other days I can't seem to focus on anything.  Some days I have high energy and can accomplish multiple tasks and projects and other days I feel tired and can't motivate myself to get anything done.  Also, since this medication keeps my appetite in check I was hoping my weight loss would be dramatic considering my workout regiment.  Once again, I feel energized on some days at the gym while other days I feel very weak and lack motivation.  I have been trying to track my nutrition, diet and workout plan.  Currently I have made minor adjustments in my diet (eating smaller meals 6-8 times a day) and nutrition (trying not to mix high energy supplements like ultimate orange with medication).  If anyone can offer some advice or share their experiences it would be much appreciated.  Thanks.

column2: tammy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started this in March 2008 at 193 pounds and my over all cholesterol over 250.I now weight 162 pounds and my over all cholesterol today is 212.I feel wonderful.I do get the dry mouth but I just drink more water which helps to promote weight loss also.Wonderful weight loss medication.very happy with it.

column2: Sharyncaok22, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Sorry for this being long, but it's helpful info.  I started 3/12/08 - 5 days on, 2 days off ( 2nd day off is the hardest to control eating - I try snacking on fresh fruit, drink water, crystal light or weak tea with sweetener.) I also have the dry mouth. Two weeks later I lost 10 lbs. I moved to my mother's house (5 hours away) spent the next 4 1/2 weeks taking care of her before she passed away. It was more of a challenge losing weight - she wanted to eat restaurant meals instead of nursing home food (they have delicious homebaked cookies, brownies and muffins 3 times a day & there was fresh fruit, juices, & lots of iced tea too).  But I did manage to lose another 5 pounds while there. I also take a thyroid pill upon waking, an hour later phentermine capsule, & eat 1 to 2 hrs later. I never was much on eating after waking, so I don't feel hungry in the mornings, & I have to remind myself to eat.I try my hardest to do without breads, potatoes, sweets. Breakfast is a glass of juice & a Special K breakfast bar. Lunch & snacks are Yoplait Whips or hard boiled egg, fresh fruit, veggies. I fix a glass of chocolate flavor slim fast for lunch or dinner (for husband & me it was baked or crockpot chicken or ground turkey meat as hamburgers without bun or fish and veggies)...sometimes 1 cup each 1% milk and cheerios and 1/2 cup strawberries half hour before bedtime. (My system seems to lose weight more if I have milk & cheerios before bedtime.)Yesterday was my birthday - I am proud to say I have maintained a 20 lb weight loss (4 inches off my midriff area, 2 inches off hips - only lost 1 inch around my waist - guess that's where I need to do more exercises.) I like weighing every morning & night to see gain or loss - then I am able to control eating & exercising the next day. I've only taken 40 capsules in 3 months. A good kickstart for my hypothroidism weight loss - challenge is keeping it off, losing 40 more, and maintaining. Good luck everyone.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year
column9: I had great success with Phentermine! Lot the weight, then started having slight memory loss  dizziness, then I had a seizure. I am in perfect health otherwise; besides now with memory loss. BE CAREFUL!! (thank goodness I wasn't driving when I had the seizure)

I've been taking this since october '07. I've lost 45 pounds so far with no exercise. I have 2 kids and i teach 4 year olds, so that prob counts as exercise. It has drastically reduced my appetite. I take the 37.5 mg tabs once a day. I only get mine refilled every month and a half bc i dont take it every day. Dont want to become dependent on it. I usually take it wed - sat, weigh sun morn, and watch my portions sun-tues. Has been working really well for me. I'm happy, husband's happy, and dr.'s happy, so as long as it keeps working and he keeps refilling it, i'm taking it. I like it bc weight comes off very gradually instead of all at once. The longer it takes to lose it, the longer you can keep it off. No jitters, insomnia, or any other wierd side effects. Little bit of dizziness first couple weeks after that, nothing. I would def recommend giving it a try.

column2: Lhdh, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Sleeplessness...Gas.....

column2: Tnicolle, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This was a wonderful drug at first. When I first started taking it, my appetite was really small. And within 6months, I had lost 60lbs. But after taking it for so long, it no longer decreases your appetite. And just eventullay stops working. And when you stop, the weight stays off for a few weeks and then starts to come back. So I guess, when it is time for you to get off of this drug, start taking the Alli, which keeps your body from digesting fat. Look it up. That, there is no time frame that you have to be off of it by. Phentermine is great, but results don't last, so plan for hard exercise and a major change in activity and what you eat. I am starting over, but I am using Alli. My dr would not let me have anymore, and yours probably won't either, so don't get too used to it. And if your Doc let's you go over 6 months, you don't have a very good doctor and they are not concerned about your healt. My dr made me sign a paper stating I would be dismissed from her practice if I asked for more. That's how bad it is for you to be on longer than recommended. My recommendation is, use it for your boost to drop mega lbs, then switch to Alli, so it doesn't come back. Or start taking Alli now and keep taking after stopping the phentermine. Good luck!!

column2: yogie68, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It worked for me for a few days but after a while I was starving. I have been taking it for 2 weeks and lost 10 pounds.  The doctor had me on 15mg twice a day and because after several days I was starving, he now gives me 30mg in the am and 15mg at night. I don't want my body to get used to it so soon, so I only take the 30mg by 12pm. I still a burst of energy. I have been working out 5 to 6 days and week. I have a month supply so I hope this works for me. I have been struggling for 2 years with my extra 50 pounds.

column2: simon, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column9: I have been on this med for 6 days and have already lost 5 pounds. I feel so much better since starting this medication. I have the engery to excerise. I watch what I eat and am not hungry.

column2: amyaub, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication did nothing to curb my appetite. The very slight weight loss I saw while on it I attribute to the eating right and working out I was already doing before starting. Wouldn't try this one again.

column2: TransitionalAnn, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I gained A LOT of weight in my pregnancy with our first child since I was bed ridden and bored (ate a lot..) I went from a size 5 to a 20 (135 to 275lbs)! Well I went from 275 to 235lbs on my own but stopped And no matter how much I exercised, if i ate anything (even healthy foods)I wouldn't lose weight... The doc said I just needed a jump start and in 16 days I have lost 20lbs and I am eating! I stuck to his suggestion of no simple carbs, TONS of veggies, avoid dairy, no caffaine or soda, lean meat and no sugar.. Its been easy because I haven't been craving sweets and when I do actually get hungry (i have to force myself to eat meals) I snack on veggie sticks and a smidge of light ranch... A friend of mine recommended it to me cause she dropped 60lbs in 3 months and has kept it off... BUT I am also getting an amino acid injection (Lipo-B) once a week to keep from building a tolerance to phentermine... Here's a good article on phentermine...http://phenterminereport.com/

column2: Jerzey, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This is my 3rd or 4th time being on adipex since 2002. Each time I took it it worked for me. The first time I took it in 2002, I lost 40 ponds in 3 months. At that time I was on a 1300/day calorie diet and I excersized regularly. Then I got pregnant! Go figure,LOL, So the following year I used it again but it was much more sporadic and I didn't excersize as often and I still lost about 10 pounds in a 3 month period. Last year I got married, and I wanted to lose some weight I had gained before the wedding so I tried it again and I was able to lose 20 pounds just with taking the pill and minimum-moderate excersize. So it does work. It's an appetite suppresent and a metobolic booster. Definitly take it as early in the day as possible because I found if I take it late, it keeps me up. If you are just starting  would also take it every other day for the first week, so your body slowly builds up to tolerating it. If you have the tabs, I would also consider cutting the tabs in half to start out. Great drug, but it does not work alone, You have to try and work with it, Minimum you should be drinking a ton of water daily and try and at least do  some sort of excersize, wether it's daily walks or a treadmill 3x per week. Oh sidenote...whenever I was on this pill and tried to eat junkfood "Mcdonalds" I got instantly sick. (diarhea) I would stay away from fast food. Hope this review helps! Good Luck!

column2: nikki, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 21 years old.  I started this medication on April 17th.  As of this morning, I have lost a total of 22 lbs in 18 days.  I have cut back tremendously on the foods I eat.  I eat 1 package of oatmeal for breakfast, a low fat low cal lunch, and Yoplait yogurt for supper.  I have not ate after 5 pm.  I drink 80 ozs of water daily.  No sugar, tea, cola, ect.  Water and skim milk only.  I walk 30-45 minutes a day.  This medication has proven effective for me.  I caution you however, do not take Suddafed or Imitrex with this medicine.  I passed out cold from my heart rate being too high.  Also, I take 37.5 mg daily 1 hr. before breakfast.  I will only take this for 3 months.

I'm also very afraid of getting off the med and gaining the weight back.  Right now I'm enjoying finding "new" clothes in my closet that I haven't been able to wear in a long time.  WONDERFUL!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Helped me lose 40 lbs in my first 8 months, not much since.  Started working, so I don't exercise as regularly. I'm VERY SCARED about gaining the weight back, I hear it happens. Hence, trying to change my lifestyle and eating/exercise patterns. But I'm even more scared about the side effects of long term use. column2: Momof3back2back, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have read a lot of the reviews of this drug. I think that a lot of the headaches and stomach cramps that are being felt are from the fact that you need to remember to eat during the day.  I have been on this medication for 1 1/2 months, eat six times a day (yes I have to make myself) drink tons of fluids and have lost 49 lbs.  I also exercise 3x a week, for 45 minutes to a video.  Remember to eat!  Most important.  The headaches that most of you report feeling is probably from dehydration and not having enough vitamins.  This pill is not to help your body starve!  Make yourself eat 6x a day.  3 meals 3 snacks. very easy. You will eat less, but more often, you need calories to function.  This pill will be very effective for you if you remember to follow a healthy diet. Also if this pill stops working, (drowsy after a couple of hours of taking) I found that if I stopped for a couple of days, and then started again the effectivness was recharged.  Good Luck to all of you and remember, EAT AND DRINK FLUIDS!!!

column2: Phen4me, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Phentermine has been a life saver. After my 2nd child I found it difficult to loose any weight (I'm 150lbs). However, the mood swings, being spaced out, and the drymouth are really bad side effects. So far I have lost 12lbs and my goal, with diet, is 25lbs.

My doc only prescribed me 2 months, said that was all I needed. I lost 15 lbs in 2 weeks but then it stalled. Definitely, I was able to control cravings. Dry mouth was there, being jittery, cranky but I had more depression when I was overweight than now. I feel a lot healthier now. Warning though - you really have to fight to keep the weight off. Make sure you start an exercise routine right away. Don't depend on the medicine to change your life.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: When I was in high school I was put on this medication and lost 100 lbs in 3 1/2 months.  Unfortunately, I didn't make portion control and working out a part of my routine, and I gained all the weight back plus some.  Now that I'm a little older, I decided to give it another try.  I've been taking the medication for almost 1 month and have lost 31 lbs.  The only side effect I have noticed from both instances on the medication is dry mouth.  It's important, while on the medication, to start an exercise program that you enjoy and will be able to continue after you stop using the medicine.  Phentermine is very useful in reducing your appetite and a great dieting tool, but to make any weight loss permanent, one must make a life change.

column2: thebear, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started phentermine exactly 7 days ago. i experienced dry mouth but dealt with that by drinking lots of water and chewing gum and had a headache develop each day for about three days, i also had a feeling like i had had too much caffine but that went away after two days....i decided not to weigh myself more than once a week. I have gone from monday being 203- friday being 196...7 POUNDS!!! i was pretty happy!!! i also have been to the gym four times and have been able to continously workout with out stopping for a break, i do 45min of cardio everytime and two days a week work on some weights as a bonus. i also have been just generally trying to be more active, by playing basketball and cleaning more often. as for my appetite its nice that i don't feel the need to snack all the time but i have been eating healthy and regularly. and with the results im getting that gives me even more drive to keep up my efforts. this drug helps but unless you change your diet and exercise as well don't expect great results, it takes alot more than just a pill to change your overall health. But if you put all the pieces together sooner or later it will all begin to fit together.

I think my body is just used to this drug because nothing else has changed. I will check with Doctor to either up the dose or change drug. I'm a 36 female and start weight was 245.Also about the ? of a period. Mine was delayed the first month about 2 1/2 weeks and I knew it wasn't due to anything else LOL

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started out at 300lbs.  After 4 months I lost 25lbs, but the last three weeks I have not lost at all.  I am never hungry.  I use to get energy from the pill, but that hasn't happened lately.  From what I understand, your body gets used to the medication and it stops working as well, so I guess that is where I'm at.  Side effects were: Heart racing, irritability, feeling hot (not sure if that's a blood pressure issue or not), and generally being unpleasant to be around.  I guess it's worth it to lose weight, but the crankiness is unbearable sometimes.  I've also slipped into a minor depression after being unable to lose any more these past few weeks.  Overall the drug is wonderful, but I worry about what it will do to my body if I continue to take it without results.  I would definitely recommend it to others who are looking for serious weight loss.  I lost 6 lbs my first week without doing anything different.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: For the first 2-3 days, I was bursting with energy that I've never had before! And a cleaner house than before! LOL! However, with that came the inability to sleep well. Thankfully, that subsided as my body adjusted. Within the first 4 months, I lost 43 lbs with no exercise (although I NEED to exercise!) as well as following a modified low-carb plan. I find that I'm never hungry, I tend to forget to eat, however, that means that I'm not grabbing the first thing I see. I'm making much better food choices. In fact, sometimes I have to FORCE myself to eat because I know I need to. That in turn, makes me pick smaller portions. Starving yourself only causes your body to STOP losing weight. If I want something sweet, then I allow it because I know I'm not going to over-eat anymore! The only side effects I've noticed is severe dry mouth. I was never a fan of H20 before, but I am NOW! It is mandatory that you drink lots of water because you can become dehydrated if you're not paying attention. The only other thing I've noticed is that I tend to want to smoke more-I think this may be my subconscious replacement for food though...so I pay attention to that as well. I've always had low blood pressure and have been in good health so those have not been an issue for me. Occasionally, I will feel my heart beat elevate, but normally that's because I haven't eaten yet. I can lose approx 4-5 lbs per week, depending on my water intake and time of the month. After reading some of these reviews, I think I will try skipping a day or two once a week...to jump-start again. I have 55 lbs to go and I'm confident that I will reach my goal!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

The first couple of days I was really dizzy and was kind of shaky. I called my doctor and he told me to increae my water intake until it went away and it worked. I drink at least 96 oz of water a day and all of the side effects have disappeared and I feel GREAT!! I have about 70 lbs to loose total and I am already a quarter of the way there. My doctor gave me this prescription for 4 months, I guess I will update this posting after the 4 months is up. I would recommend this pill (along with a change in diet and exercise) to anyone.

column2: pennymoore6969@yahoo.com, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on phen on & off for 1 1/2 yrs. Lost over fifty pounds!! Doc started me on 37.5 mg at first. had problems with this dosage, it gave me stomach aches so I went 2 the 30 mg. after that the aches went away. gives me energy and i dont want 2 eat anything. So when I do eat I try to eat healthier foods since I'm not eating a whole lot. I've had arthritis since i was 3 and losing the weight has really helped my joints. My Rheumatologist says for every 10 pds u loose, it feels like 100 lbs 2 ur knees! He is right. I would suggest phen as a weight loss alternative. There are some of us that just cant diet and excerise and loose weight; we need help. Having a joint disease made it impossible 4 me 2 exercise. I am 5 ft and used 2 weigh 175 lbs. Now i weigh 121 lbs. I'm going 2 get the last few pds off before spring. the main reason i'm writing this review is that some of my side effects have me puzzled. In the last month or so I have been having anxiety attacks. Very irritated about stuff that normally would not bother me. I stopped taking phen for 4 days because of a bad cold. When I started back on it the attacks came back. I am convinced it is the phen. Maybe it is because i've been on it 4 a long time. However i have decided 2 stop taking it. Permanently!!!! The stress and anxious feelings r bothering me 2 much. I do recommend phen just talk 2 ur doc and pay attention 2 your moods and especially if u become over anxious about small stuff. on a lighter note since losing the weight, i have met someone. He is a great guy! Good luck losing weight!! If u  have had some of the same exp. on phen u may contact me at pennymoore6969@yahoo.com.

column9: As to the rapid heart beat and sleeplessness, Dr. Paul Rivas in his book "Turn Off The Hunger Switch" recommends taking the beta blocker 'Pindolol' with Phentermine to ally the above conditions. column2: anna, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Dosages: Started on capsules 30.5mg, increased to 37.5mg pills, then went to 2x 30.5mg capsules daily. Results: 20 pound weight loss in 2 months.Most Severe Side effects: irritability, dry mouth, insomnia, no appetiteGeneral: I knew phen was not a magic pill, just an appetite suppressant. That definitely worked. I had to force myself to eat most days, coming in under a normal calorie range (causing my body to shut down and hang on to the weight!) Not taking in enough calories was messing me up, and that, coupled with cost, led me to stop taking the pills. (Rx was $32 for 1 month, but Dr wanted  monthly visits not covered by my insurance. It was cheaper for me to go to a "Phentermine clinic". There, I paid $80 month for 'consult, 1 month Rx, and nutrition guidance') The side effects for me were major.  The first week, I had 'spotting'- a weird blood discharge no where close to menstruation time. The dry mouth symptoms never went away(worse on 37.5mg dose). I was EXTREMELY irritable (not my usual nature) on the 37.5 mg dosage.. to the point where coworkers and friends made comments. The insomnia was worse for me on the 30.5mg dose.. to the point of no sleep for four days at a time, or 2-3 hours per night maximum.Overall, I do believe that it was VERY effective in suppressing my appetite. I would use as a crutch again.. however, hope to go from 161 lb to 145 lb (highest weight to be in normal BMI for my height) on my own.  Would recommend to others when they reason they need the pill is appetite suppressant. Still encourage healthy diet (lower fats, watching calories) and EXERCISE. Anyone/any plans that doesn't insist on physical activity is a SCAM.

column2: Sandy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The first time I took Phentermine, it worked wonders.  I lost about 30 lbs in two months, and felt great.  I actually had to force myself to eat.  After taking it for 3 months or so, the effectiveness wore off, but having lost 35 lbs or so by then, it was the motivation to keep going on my own with diet and exercise.  I went from a size 24 to a 14, about 60 lbs.  I am going to a Dr. next week to get back on it.  I did buy it online, and they "provided" the prescription, but this time am going to a Dr./Weight Loss clinic to get it.  I took it again after having my son, but it did not work very well.  I did maintain the weight loss with the exception of 35 lbs.  I am hoping it helps me lose even 20 lbs to get me back motivated, and back to the gym.  I think anyone taking it for the first time had great results for the first 2-3 months, then it is like the body becomes immune to it, no matter how long (even years) you go off before trying again.  Wish me luck!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I use this and I also completely overhauled my eating habits. I eat much healthier and I eat smaller portions. I also started working out doing cardio 3 times a week for 1-2 hours each time and I also started weight training 2 times a week. I have been using it for 6 months, and every few weeks I stop taking it for 2-3 weeks. To date I have lost over 50lbs, and I feel great!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for about 2 and 1/2 years. It has been great, yet at this point I think there has been a build up of some sort. I have noticed I am increasingly anxious. Maybe that is just due to the idea of stopping the drug and gain weight back.

column2: Cheryl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I've taken it before. But now it doesn't seem to work as well for me. I'm taking the highest miligram. I exercise and watch what I eat. Maybe I will get off it for a while and start over in a few weeks. That might make it kick in a little. My Dr. will not prescribe it to his patients. So I got if from an on line pharmacy. It is the actual medication. But it did cost way more than getting it from my Dr. Good luck everyone!

column2: JLKirk78, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am taking phentermine now for the 2nd time.  I first took it when my oldest child was 2 1/2.  I had tried all sorts of diets to get the baby weight off with no results before.  My doctor recommended combining the drug with a low carb diet and I lost 50 pounds in about 2 months.  I went from 190 to 140.  I did not exercise at all, but was very strict about my diet.  I even noticed that the month after I stopped taking the drug I continued to lose about another 10 pounds.  It really changes your lifestyle.  The weight stayed off until I became pregnant again, and I also did not gain as much weight with this last pregnancy.    My 2nd child is 7 weeks old now and since I have finished breastfeeding I have returned to this drug without wasting valuable time on anything else.  I weigh 167 and my goal is to lose 40 pounds in the next two months.  It feels so good to know I can do this!  If you are having a hard time obtaining this drug and can come to Nashville, Tn; look up The Doctor's Diet Program.  6 of us in my family have seen them with these significant results, and they have turned away only 1 friend of mine due to health concerns.

column2: surfcurlgrl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: While eating properly, such as no bread, no sweets, and NO alcohol, the medication is a highly effective appetite suppressant and provides added energy to the physical body. I highly recommend it. Getting a doctor to prescribe it for you if you are not obese, or grotesquely over weight is a real problem though. I have trouble sometimes getting rid of a few added pounds, no more than 10 usually, and doctors would rather not risk the side effects this drug may cause. I  know my body better than anyone and if I feel that a drug is causing problems for me I wouldn't continue to take it. I am on the hunt for a doctor that will prescribe it to me so I may take it PRN, as it is a lot easier to lose a few pounds that are put on due to holidays, or a busy schedule than it is to take off an exuberant amount of weight.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: Despite 1 hour work-outs at the gym four days per week, and following weight watchers, in three months my weight did not change.  One week on Phentermine, I lost 7 pounds.  One month on Phentermine, I lost over 15.  I will find a way to take Phentermine every day for the rest of my life.  I will never be overweight again.

column2: towens, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just started taking P 37.5mg.  Everyone talks of energy, but I haven't seen it.  Is there something else wrong with me? I can take the pill and go chill back on the couch. I want the energy so I can go and do!  I'm I ADD and this med does the opposite to me?

column2: april4762, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have lost approx. 20 pounds in about 4 months with very little effort I have so much energy and at my age I can work 2 jobs and run circles around the much younger associates,I sleep fine at night usually and I don't seem to have any trouble stopping for a while in between so that it works as well as when I first started the program,the B12 shots seem to really help alot too,I am feeling so much better no swelling anymore or feeling run down and recently my daughter described me as HOT!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I weighed 202 lbs. and wore a size 22 and 8 months later I weighed 127 lbs. & wear a size 8. I have kept it off for one year now!!! YEAH ME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I started taking the pills about 2 months ago. I have lost about 22 lbs so far. It has really increased my energy and decreased my appetite. I am happy so far. I wonder how long is safe to take it? I really haven't had any side effects either.

column2: Sherry, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Very obese after car accident...I have lost 42 pounds in 3 months!! Along with proper eating....and I can do very few exercises.Was answer to prayer for me.

column2: Hbird, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I lost 52 pounds in 6 months on Phentermine. I went from a size 14 to a 8. The pill alone didn't do it, I work out 3-5 times a week, and changed my diet to eliminate sugary foods, and fill up on vegetables, fruits, and protein. It has really helped to take away my sweet tooth. Lately I have been noticing some depression, complete lack of sex drive, and severe irritability. Not sure if prolong use of this drug may cause this?

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: constipation

column2: Serendipty_22, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Well I started taking Phentermine on 09-25-2007 and as of 11-7-2007 I have lost 12 pounds.  According to the BMI scale I am considered obese at 5'5" and 201 pounds, down to 189 pounds now.  My  goal is to get to 125 pounds and stay there.  I was diagnosed with disc degenerative disease which had caused me to fracture a vertebrea along with an accident at work.  I had back surgery and have not been able to exercise like I normally would have to help lose the weight so I was put on this wonderful drug.  It has surpressed my appetite so much that there are times I forget that I haven't eaten all day until maybe 9 or 10 at night and even then I can eat something like celery and peanut butter and it fills me up.  I can't wait to see the results once I start to exercise again.  The only side effects I have had are dry mouth and I have recently noticed if I forget to take it one day and take it the next day I sometimes end up with diarrhea, but other than that I haven't had any major side effects.

column2: ann boyce, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My experience has been with prevention of migraines and taking one 37.5mg Phentermine daily in the a.m.  I am currently without this med, and I am speaking with my physician tomorrow morning to see if i can have it prescribed for me--I am overweight also, but have suffered from migraines since I was 11 years old.  I KNOW this medication PREVENTS my migraines from occurring.  I feel as if noone listens, even though patients are supposed to be proactive in their health. I am suffering right now from a migraine that has lasted for 11 days. I have been prescribed Midrin, Inderol, and MAXalt.  These are not working.  Please, if anyone has the same experience as myself--let me or someone know.  Thank you--Ann Maria Boyce    annboyce2@hotmail.com

column2: lovethatdress, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm not severly overweight but am only 5' tall. so a few lbs. show up quick on me. Plus I am a severe asthmatic. I took it in the fall and went from 132 to 128 in 30 days. because I did not have as much to lose my numbers are smaller but very significant in my clothing size! I started to work out, i could only make it 5 min. into a work out at first because of my asthma condition but I pressed on and came to do a 45 min workout in medium impact mode. I lost 8 more lbs. I also was determined to make my calories count, make good choices and reduce amount. And if I over do it; say out to eat... I eat only a bite or two of meat or other food high in protien to take me through the night so offset the amt. calories eaten per/day. It seems each fall I have a bout of asthma and I gain some back. but I work through it and am so happy with myself now! if you have an intent on changing how much you eat and cutting back on the goodies (sugar) you can loose it and keep it off. I think if you start eating in a way that is not normal for what you usually eat (unless it is fast food) then stick to what you usually eat but much less of it and try to eat nothing past 7 p.m. The drug just gives you a jump start. Create an intent that is a doable goal for a eating lifestyle change. I too took about 2 to 3 days to become accustomed to the affects of the drug. It creates more of a feeling of jitters. just eat healthy, vegetables (fresh, especially the green ones) and such and you should be fine.

column2: cd209, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This med really works! I have been taking it for 12 weeks. When I started, I was 227 and now I'm 189. I have losted 38lbs. This is definitely a mircle pill! The only side effects i have was constipation and thirsts. So I start eating more fibers and drink more water. This change helped me eat even better than I was before I had the side effects.

column2: Wired1001, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Started taking Phentermine in May of 07 I had a hard time adjusting to the increased heart and sudden loss of appetite but quickly became used to it. Only major symptoms I have had from this medicine has been frequent constipation and as a result hemorrhoids. To date I have lost 42 pounds using the medicine in conjunction with major diet changes (I became a vegetarian) and exercise. As time goes on I find that the medicine is less affective at curbing the hunger pangs, but you can supplement with low or no calorie foods (IE Celery). I would recommend talking to your DR about doing this in conjunction with vitamin B shots or tablets to help ward off feelings of fatigue.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking these pills after I gained a whole bunch of weight from being pregnant.  I went from 185 after having my baby to 132 is what I am at now and I started taking these pills for about 5 months...They work great!!!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i lost about 20 pounds in about 3 months. but you have to change your diet and work out

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I am taking the month of November off of it then back on it for another 3 months which I hope will be my last as I hope to be at my goal.  But all and all I think it was a good chioce to go on this medication to get my weight going in the right direction.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I HAVE LOST 14LBS IN FIRST MONTH

column2: n/a, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: SEE QUESTION:  This medication has really helped curb my insatiable appetite.  I am not sure how many lbs I have lost, but it does help stop the cravings.  Aside from the dry mouth-has anyone else had this side effect? I take the phentermine at 7:30 every AM. Around 12:30-1:00 my face gets really flushed for about an hour or so.  The skin feels  tight between my eyes-around the top of my nose...it's kind of weird. I experienced a similar side effect with a pain reliever I was prescribed last year after I had surgery...but when I stopped the pain reliever, the flushing stopped also.  I began taking Phentermine in September and noticed this side effect about a week into taking this med.

column2: gigi@yahoo.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: my energy level has been good, and stop craving sweets and stop over eating

column2: snoowl990, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have lost 35 pounds in 16 weeks. Better than I have done on any diet. Feel great.

column2: moon, 25-34 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Like alot of people Ive been on diets all my life. At one point I was over 400 lbs. I lost 200 lbs with diet and excercise, only to gain it back later. Ive been on phertermine for over 7 months now and have lost 45 lbs so far.This drug works!
With the aid of Phentermine, along with a low-calorie diet and exercise, I've lost 80 pounds in the past year!

column2: brodie88, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been using this product for 2.5 months now, and have lost over 20 lbs.  I am very happy with it and hardly any side effects, just the first week (a little shacky) but not bad.  Your body does adjust within the first week or so, after that no side effects.  You do have to watch your intake of coffee.I have another 20 lbs to go this was the only perscription that has worked, it really helps you control your eating, and has kept me from eating the junk foods I used too.  Best and safest out there!!

column2: freedfromprison, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I went to the doctor because I was at the end of my rope. I felt like I was in prison. I haven't been able to lose weight since the birth of my child 8 yrs. ago. I had my gall bladder removed 1 1/2 yrs ago. Having that removed caused more complications, not being able to eat a normal portion of food without it causing massive stomach pains and the runs.. So! for over a year, not eating alot with excerise, you would think I would start losing. Ha! Like I started saying . Went to the doctor and he did blood work and everything check out fine. I now think I'll be fat for the rest of my life! Instead, he put me on this wonderful, helpful, energizing key to get out of my prison. I have been taking it for 2 1/2 months now. I have gone from a size 20 to a 12. I don't have a clue how many pounds I've lost because I don't really care. That scale is always the death of me. I can be in a good mood and step on it and it will literally ruin my whole day. Forget it! not doing it this time. All I know is that I can cross my legs now. Jump out of bed. Keep up with my 8 year old and have enough energy to make it to bed. Side effects...I agree with the others. Dry mouth at times is awful. Keep something to drink around at all times. Along with a box of Tic Tacs!I feel like I've been given a second chance to be healthy!!! Thank you Lord!

column2: Lou, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This prescription works very well, but it does effect your sleep patterns.  If you can learn to change the way you eat you can take this for 3-6 months and loss weight then get off of it and maintain.

So I went almost a month without eating an actual meal. This month has started out better however.

column2: amy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have polycystic ovarian syndrome, which causes diabetes, hormonal imbalance, and weight gain. I have been using this drug for 2 years and I LOVE IT! I lost 50 pounds, and have tons of energy now! I work out regularly too! Diabetes is gone as well.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have lots of energy and It has also controlled my ADD symptoms at work.  I have lost 7.5 pounds in 3 weeks!  Love It!

column2: JJ's girl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I did LA Weightloss and Weight Watchers but I was still feeling exhausted all the time. Being 40+ I knew my metabolism had slowed down so I talked to my doctor and she prescribed this drug. I do not have insomnia since I take it right after brushing my teeth when I get out of bed.

column9: I do not eat to much thur the day. Also I don't want sweets.

column2: ontherox82, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started taking phentermine 7 months ago. I've lost a total of 39 pounds and am more than happy with the results. When I first started I was very jittery and my mouth was extremely dry all the time. These effects wore off fairly quickly. I also had an extreme loss of appetite. That too went away after about a month. Now I eat only when I'm hungry. I would (and have)recommend this drug to other women struggling with weight loss.

column2: lovelyladyjenn, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I have the energy to work out now. I do get a cotton mouth when I take it so I drink alot of water and some juices.

column9: Started mid July 2007. Have lost 27 lbs. Its now October. Love this product.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have struggled with weight all my life. After I had both my kids I still could not get it off. I have tried everythingand in June my Dr. told me about phentermine.
